Incarnación is a woman with a humble heart. Ever since she started her family, she has had a very close relationship with her husband and children, but due to financial necessity, her husband had to leave in search of better job opportunities so that his family may enjoy a better quality of life. Meanwhile, Incarnación works hard in all her duties. For her, neither exhaustion nor sickness exists as long as she can work to cover the family expenses. She sells vegetables as a street vendor, works in a brick factory, and provides laundry services for her neighbors, who know that she is an active, industrious, exemplary mother. This selfless woman’s wish is to have greater capital for her business. She is sure that with this loan, she will be able to increase her earnings and provide for her adorable children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Incarnación es una mujer humilde de corazón, desde que formó su hogar estuvo muy unida a su esposo e hijos, pero por necesidad su esposo tuvo que separarse e ir en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo con el fin de que su familia goce de una mejor calidad de vida.En tanto, Incarnación se esfuerza en sus labores, para ella no existe cansancio ni enfermedad con tal de trabajar y cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos, se dedica a la venta de verduras en forma ambulatoria, así mismo es obrera en una fabrica de ladrillo y eventualmente lava ropa de sus vecinos, quienes la reconocen como una madre ejemplar, activa y trabajadoraEl deseo de esta abnegada mujer es contar con mayor capital de inversión en su negocio, está segura que con estas proyecciones podrá mejorara sus ingresos y mantener sin privaciones a sus adorables hijos.

loans.use: Invest in vegetable business

loans.name: Mélanie

texts.fr: Mélanie B. est une femme mariée, mère de 08 enfants avec 02 autre dont elle a la charge. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour faire un commerce de fruits locaux saisonniers et plus particulièrement de mangues dont c’est la saison. Elle veut subevenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille et assurer de meilleures conditions de vie a ses enfants. <b>Elle va rembourser son pret au bout de six mois en une seule échéance <b/>.
texts.en:
Mélanie B. is married and the mother of 08 children with 02 others for whom she is responsible. She is requesting this loan to sell local seasonal fruits, and especially mangoes which are in season. She wants to provide for her family's needs and ensure better living conditions for her children. She will reimburse her loan after six months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and re-sale of seasonal fruits, especially mangoes.

loans.name: Gnagna

texts.fr: Gnagna D., 54 ans, mariée avec 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Bayouf Pout à Thiès depuis 3 ans. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce de fruits locaux (mangues et mandarines). Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Gnagna D., 54, is married and raising 7 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Bayouf Pout in Thiès for three years. She wants to bolster her little business selling local fruit (mangos and mandarine oranges). The income she makes from her business allows her to participate in paying the family's daily expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of local fruit

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin K. is a villager in Preal Village in Takeo Province. She is a breeder who raises ducks. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more duck food to feed her ducks. Her husband, Mr. Sum Sae, is a construction worker, who makes a small income to support his family. Mrs. Chin K. does not have any children. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more duck food to feed her ducks.

loans.name: Safia Abdul Majeed Group

texts.en:
Safia baji is a wife of A. M. and resides in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room, brick house and has been living in it for the past 16 years. She has no children. Safia baji is a very responsible lady who supports her husband by sewing clothes at home. She charges $2 per suit. Her neighbors come to her house have their clothes sewn. Safia baji’s husband buys seasonal fruits from the fruit market and sells them on his fruit cart. Safia baji is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits for her husband. 

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Parveen baji requests a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Another Parveen baji and Zahida baji each request a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shamim Akhtar baji requests a loan to buy seasonal fruits to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more seasonal fruits for reselling

loans.name: Lourdes Noa

texts.en:
Lourdes Noa B. D. M. is a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank.  Lourdes is 40 years old and married with 3 children. Lourdes runs a store from a rented space on Maravillas Street where she sells a variety of drinks and ceviche (raw fish cured with lime juice) in the mornings. On weekends, she sells traditional Peruvian meals.  Lourdes needs a loan of $300 to buy beer and soda.  Lourdes’s dreams are for her children to graduate with professional degrees and to open a more profitable business. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow.

loans.use: Buy beer and soda

loans.name: Mohammad Nzer

texts.en:
M. Nzer lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 7 children, and has a general store. He would like to make his business larger and stronger by adding more stock to his store.

He has requested a loan to expand and develop his business by buying the necessary materials to complete his stock in his shop. 

He is very happy to have the opportunity of a loan in Afghanistan, because it will provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs like him to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand and develop his buisness

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long V. is 39 years old and is a widow with three children attending the local school. Mrs. Long V. lives in Chorng Prey Bey village in the Kandal province.

Mrs. Long V. is a pig breeder and also owns a rice mill. She is requesting a loan to build a rice mill house for her rice mill business. She hopes to increase her income and improve the living conditions for her family with this loan.

loans.use: To build a rice mill house for her business.

loans.name: Jazmín Group

texts.es:
El inicio del presente comité fue la señora Sebastiana Z., quien ya habria pertenecido a un comite D. la misma zona D. donD. se retiró por cuestiones personales, invitó y organizó a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La señora Sebastiana Z. se dedica a la venta D. ropa, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. prendas en general y D. esa manera poder sutirse D. mecaderia.

La señora Hortencia Josefina A. se dedica a la venta D. bebidas y helados, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas y helados al por mayor para luego venderlas.

La señora Paola Beatriz Villamayor se dedica a la venta D. comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. insumo para la elaboración D. los comestibles.

La señora Lourdes Soledad C. se dedica a la venta D.  bebidas, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas al por mayor para luego venderlas.

La señora Crispina R. se dedica a la ventra D. bebidas, invirtió su dinero en la compra D. bebidas al por mayor y D. esa manera surtir su negocio.

La señora Nilsa Vicenta C. se dedica a la venta D. comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. insumo para su elaboración y ofrecer mayor calidad en su producto.

La señora Ruth Noemi Araujo  se dedica a la venta D. comestible,  invirtió el dinero en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboración D. los comestibles D. esa manera ofrecer mayor variedad

La señora Graciela Ramona Perez se dedica a la costura,invirtió el dinero en la compra D. elementos para su trabajo,  consiguiendo asi comodidas y mayor productividas.

La señora Pabla Elida J. se dedica a la venta D. mercaderias, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. azúcar, aceite, yerba, etc pudiendo asi ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y  aumentar su ingreso.

La señora Maria Crsitina L. se dedica a la venta D. lenceria,  invirtió el dinero en la compra D. esa prendas al por mayor asi ofreciendo mayor variedas a sus clientes

La señora Maria Benita Z. se dedideca a la venta D. ropa, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. prendas en general D. esa manera surtir mas su mercaderia para ofrecer a sus clientes

La señora Mabel Celeste Ramirez  se dedica a la venta D. comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboración D. los comestibles pudiendo asi ofrecer mas variedad D. comidas sus clientes.

La señora Emerenciana A. D. Rolon tiene una despensa, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. mercaderias varias azúcar, yerba, lacteos, bebidas, panificados para surtir su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientela.

La señora Nancy Corolina C. se dedica a la venta D. lenceria, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. esas prendas obteniendo mayor variedad D. prendas para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La señora Liz Natalia Cantero  se dedica a la venta D. Lenceria, invirtió el  dinero en la compra D. esas prendas al por mayor para luego reenvenderlas obteniendo  asi mayor ingreso.

La señora Rosa Cesarina G.  se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas varias pudiendo asi surtir su negocio y ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes.

La señora Johana Marieliz V. se dedica a la venta D. comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. insumo para la elaboración D. los comestible.
texts.en:
The founder of this group was Mrs. Sebastiana Z., who had already belonged to another group in the same area, from which she withdrew for personal reasons. She invited and organized her friends to form part of the Committee of Small Businesswomen program. Mrs. Sebastiana Z. sells clothing, and will invests the money in the purchase of garments in general and in this way can stock up on merchandise. Mrs. Hortencia Josefina A. sells drinks and ice cream, and will use the money to buy drinks and ice cream at wholesale prices to later sell them. Mrs. Paola Beatriz Villamayor sells food, and will invest the money in the purchase of ingredients to make food for sale. Mrs. Lourdes Soledad C. sells drinks, and will use the money to buy drinks at wholesale prices to sell. Mrs. Crispina R. sells drinks, and will use the money to buy drinks at wholesale prices in order to stock up her business. Mrs. Nilsa Vicenta C. sells food, and will use the money to invest in the ingredients used in preparing them so she can offer a higher quality product. Mrs. Ruth Noemi Araujo sells food, and will invest the money in purchasing ingredients to make the food she sells in order to offer better variety to her clients. Mrs. Graciela Ramona Perez is a seamstress, and will use the money to buy tools for her work, making it more comfortable and productive. Mrs. Pabla Elida J. sells staple goods, and will use the money to buy sugar, oil, yerba, etc. to be able to offer wider variety to her customers and increase her income. Mrs. Maria Cristina L. sells lingerie, and will use the money to buy merchandise at wholesale so she can offer a wider variety of products to her customers. Mrs. Maria Benita Z. sells clothing, and will invest the money to stock up on the merchandise she sells to her customers. Mrs. Mabel Celeste Ramirez sells food, and will use the money to buy ingredients to prepare the food so she can offer a better variety to her clients. Mrs. Emerenciana A. D. Rolon has a general store and will use the money to buy various merchandise, such as sugar, yerba, dairy products, drinks, and bread to stock up her business and offer better variety to her customers. Mrs. Nancy Carolina C. sells lingerie and will use the loan to buy merchandise to offer a better variety of products to her customers. Mrs. Liz Natalia Cantero sells lingerie, and will invest the money in buy merchandise wholesale to later sell it for a larger profit. Mrs. Rosa Cesarina G. sells drinks, and will use the money to purchase a variety of drinks, thus stocking up her business and offering better variety to her customers. Mrs. Johana Marieliz V. sells food, and will use the money to buy ingredients to make the food she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing, fabrics, eggs, flour, dairy products, drinks, meats, cold cuts, corn, bread, canned goods, yerba, oil, sweets, vegetables, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Mercedes López tiene 53 años, su estado civil casada. Doña Mercedes tiene tres hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña Mercedes es la elaboración y venta de refrescos naturales, hielo y bolsitas. Hace más de catorce años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que cada día busca el objetivo de enfrentar los gastos del hogar y tratar de mejorar cada día económicamente. Los propósitos de Doña Mercedes son de ampliar su negocio ya que le gustaría comprar una refrigeradora y elaborar más productos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que invertir en la compra de más productos para su negocio. Sus deseos son de contar siempre con la ayuda de los financiamientos ya que estos son de gran ayuda para ellos. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 5.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mercedes López is 53 years old and is married. Mercedes has three children, all of whom work. Mercedes' economic activity is the production and sale of natural drinks, ice and little bags of beverages. She has worked on this business for more than fourteen years and everyday seeks her objective to confront her household expenses and try to improve economically. Mercedes' goal is to expand her business as she would like to purchase a refrigerator and produce more products. The loan is for working capital as she has to invest in the purchase of more products for her business. Her wish is to always be able to rely on the help of loans as these are of great help for them. The amount that she is requesting is C$ 5.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mereane

texts.en: Mereane S., 39, is married with five children.  She has many years of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the villagers and public seven days per week. She has three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala. SPBD loans are Mereane’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used on her business and also to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers, chemicals, knives and to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en: Aliitasi N., 63, is married with ten children.  She has two years of experience in the bakery business. She sells to the general public seven days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~$200 US).  SPBD loans are Aliitasi’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour and sugar, a stove and pots

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. lives in Agusan Del Sur in Mindanao with her only child. She says, “When our hometown was affected by typhoon and flood, people saw the downturn in their businesses. Community Economic Ventures Inc. was the one who initiated help to rehabilitate the place. People (including me) were given capital to start again and rebuild their farm businesses."

Teresita is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. The loan will truly help her grow her income. By buying the needful farm necessities, Teresita believes that she will be able to increase her harvest.

CEVI provides not only loans to support businesses but also offers trainings and insurance coverage to make small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Dative, 38 years old. She is single and she has two children, 12 and 7 years old. She lives in Nyarugenge district of Kigali the capital of Rwanda.

Ms. M. owns a shop in Nyarugenge district and her shop sells drinks. She has been doing the same business since 2004. She hired one employee to help her in this business. She starts her daily business at 8:00 a.m. and finishes at 10:00 p.m.

She is requesting her first loan worth 400,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company and with this loan she will buy more drinks for her store.

Ms. M. has a monthly profit of approximately $455 and she will continue to reinvest the increased profit.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her store

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia ANTONIETA, es originaría de la provincia de Calca, ella vive en el sector denominado Huarán, ubicado en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los incas, poseedores de una zona bastante cálida y rica en productos, situado a 1 hora y 20 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de (10, 4) años, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la ganadería, nuestra socia se dedica al engorde y venta del mismo, también a los derivados de los productos lácteos, ella desea el préstamo para poder reinvertir en el mismo negocio y así continuar con su producción para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y el de toda sus familia. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete en cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Antonieta is from the province of Calca. She lives in an area known as Huarán, in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas, a warm, fertile region an hour and 20 minutes from the city of Cusco. This member is 30 years old, and married with two children, 10 and 4 years old. In addition to her domestic tasks, she also raises cattle, fattening them for sale, and produces dairy products. She is requesting this loan to invest it in her business and maintain production in order to improve her family's quality of life. She appreciates and is grateful for the support offered to her by these institutions and is committed to paying off all of her loan in the period agreed upon.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell livestock

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33 year old Josephine M. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, between the ages of 17 and 23 years old. Josephine has been running a café business since 2007. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. She works at the business for 12 hours per days per week and is assisted by two employees. Josephine currently earns about 200USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase beans, rice, wheat maize and cooking oil. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Josephine thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase beans, rice, wheat maize and cooking oil.

loans.name: Aurea Mercedita

texts.en:
Aurea Mercedita B. is 50 years old and from the city of Dipolog. She is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Aurea Mercedita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Aurea Mercedita is just starting this business.

In 2005, Aurea Mercedita joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Aurea Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be her seventh from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis es un joven muy emprendedor de 23 años de edad, es el tercer hermano de 8 y se ha propuesto forjar una carrera. Es soltero, estudia y vive en la casa de sus padres. Desde que adquirió la mayoría de edad, se dedica a sembrar y cultivar las chacras de sus padres para adquirir dinero y pagar sus estudios. Su siembra preferida son las arvejas, porque cosecha de dos a tres veces de una sola siembra y no realiza mucha inversión en abono. Por ello, puede sembrar alternadamente y generar muy buenas ganancias, con las que paga los gastos de la habitación que alquila en la ciudad donde estudia, la cual está situada a tres horas de su pueblo natal. En consecuencia, viaja sólo los fines de semana para estar los sábados, muy temprano, en  sus cultivos, cuyas cosechas termina comercializándolas directamente en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Luis está muy seguro se forjarse airosamente su profesión, y convertirse en un mecánico muy exitoso. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, debido a una invitación se ha incorporado a un banco comunal, donde se siente muy contento por la forma de trabajo y por el apoyo personalizado de la asesora de crédito. El dinero que viene solicitando lo piensa invertir en la compra de tres bolsas de arvejas para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Luis is a very enterprising young man, who is 23 years old. He is the third brother out of 8, and has decided to build up his career. He is single, he studies, and he lives in his parent's house. Since he became of legal age, he has sowed and cultivated his parent's small farm to earn money and pay for his studies.

His preferred sowing is peas, because he can harvest 2 or 3 times from a single sowing and it doesn't require much investment in fertilizer. With it, he can do alternating sowings and earn very good profits, with which he can pay the expenses of the room that he rents in the city where he studies, which is situated 3 hours from his native village. As a result, on weekends he travels alone very early in the morning on Saturdays to be with his crops, whose harvests he finishes with marketing directly in the wholesale market in the city.

Luis is confident that he will pursue his profession gracefully, and turn into a very successful engineer. This is his second loan with MFP. Because of an invitation, he became a member of a community bank, where he feels very happy with the form of work and for the personalized support of the loan advisor. The money that he is requesting he is thinking to invest in the purchase of 3 bags of peas for his next sowing.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peas for sowing

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas T. is from the village of Campo I, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 60 years old. Felicitas is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Felicitas owns and operates a sari-sari, or general store. Her main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Felicitas has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $135 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Felicitas joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Felicitas has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to invest in expanding her business. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. Felicitas plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sadick

texts.en:
Sadick K. is a Tanzanian man who is a small business operator and an entrepreneur. He runs a business buying and selling salt in wholesale to customers of different regions but he lives at Dar es Salaam. He purchases his business goods direct from the producers in Kigoma Region and supplies to his customers in different regions in Tanzania. He has been in the business for the past three years.

The business needs enough capital in order to meet his customers needs. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his business

loans.name: Maritt

texts.es: Maritt es una persona muy trabajadora, vive en distrito de Yarina Cocha, tiene 63 años y es madre de cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general y venta de bebidas, ella trabaja junto a su esposo en este negocio. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth” desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en golosinas, en la actualidad necesita un crédito de 2000 soles que será utilizado para comprar abarrotes en general y gaseosas. La meta de Maritt es implementar su tienda para obtener mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Invertirá en compras de abarrotes en general y gaseosas.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Rosales”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 52 años y es madre de 05 hijos, 02 que aun depende de ella.Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de juanes y anticuchos, ubicada en su misma casa.En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario la consumen y Flor los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 600.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceite en litros, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para preparar sus alimentos.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 25 years old and has four children, the eldest of whom is 6 years old. She helps her husband in their fishing business, and also does manicures and pedicures to add to her family's income. She joined Kiva partner CEVI a year ago to avail herself of its financial service. She stayed with CEVI because it offers a low interest rate on its loans. Now she is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to fund her fishing business.

loans.use: To finance her fishing business

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba H. is a married Tanzanian businesswoman. She runs a business at Tandika district in Dar es Salaam. She purchases and sells a variety of clothes to customers. The business goods are purchased from the wholesale and retail shops and then she resells to her customers. She has been in the business for four years and her business profits allow her to meet her daily needs. She needs a loan of  600,000 TZS to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: This is Nora D. C., a 39 year old entrepreneur from Dasmariñas, Cavite. Her husband, Edgardo, also 39, works overseas. Nora takes care of their only child who is now in grade school. Due to consistent consumer demand, Nora embarked on selling electronic load credits for mobile phones two years ago. She used to sell only a few phone accessories. Now, she is earning P46,000 in net monthly income. Nora is expecting a rise in the demand for new designs of phone casings and other accessories with the advent of the Christmas season. Traditionally, this is also a time when Filipinos call their relatives who are staying or working abroad and so the demand for load credits for mobile phones will also rise. Nora will seize this opportunity so she applied for a new loan in the amount of P50,000 as additional capital. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Marieme

texts.fr:
Madame Marieme D. est une femme mariée d’une trentaine d’années  qui gère 3 enfants et habite dans la localité de Camberene. Elle est parente bénéficiaire  et s’active dans le commerce de poissons depuis plus de 5 ans. Cette  dame a choisi cette activité  et juge que c’est une intéressante  source de revenu. Elle  a choisi le marche de Camberene pour acheter et revendre son poisson car c’est un lieu très fréquenté  par la population. Les  bénéfices  qu’elle gagne lui permettent de compléter  la dépense  quotidienne  assurée par son mari car ce dernier dispose de revenus faibles. Ainsi pour renforcer son commerce elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour augmenter son fond car le poisson constitue actuellement une denrée qui devient de plus en plus chère.
Madame D. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce à cette coopération, les parents  de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008 jusqu’au mois de juin  2009, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui ont  varie entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Marieme D. has been married for about 30 years, has given birth to three children and lives in the city of Camberene. She is a beneficiary parent in a development project and she has sold fish for the past five years. She has chosen this business and she believes that it is a good source of revenue. She has chosen the market place of Camberene to buy and sell her fish, because it is a very popular place. With this income she can support her husband to take care of the daily family expenses, since he has a low income. In order to improve her business she is requesting a loan of 150 000 frs to increase her operating funds, since fish is a product that is becoming more and more expensive. Madame D. is the beneficiary of a collaborative project between U-IMCEC and PDEF, the Program for Child Development and the Family (PDEF)Seydina Issa Laye. The goal of PDEF is to reduce poverty in the community and especially to protect children from impoverished families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents in such families can obtain credit at more flexible conditions. Since the program was launched in December 2008, until June 2009, 120 parents have received financing, ranging in size from 50,000 to 150,000 frs.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase operating funds.

loans.name: Guadalufe

texts.en: Guadalufe is a rice farmer. She is 47 years old, married and has three children. Her oldest child is now 27 years old. As a farmer, it is necessary that she work hard to maintain the farm that’s why she makes sure to be healthy and strong. She hopes to grow her business so she applied to CEVI to expand her business opportunities. She applied for a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will be used to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 30-year-old married man and has one child. Since 2003 he has been working as a sanitary repairman repairing toilets and faucets, with a previous ten years of experience in this occupation. Working on a freelance basis, he manages part of house projects in his region and its surroundings.

With the help of the requested loan of $600, Tarek managed to expand his business and take more projects by buying more tools that he needed.

loans.use: To buy more tools that he needed

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La Sra. Maria, tiene 53 años de edad se encuentra casada con don Manuel que es profesor de provincia, La Sra. Maria tiene como actividad la tienda de barrio además de ser tambien profesora, los dos viven en casa propia, tienes 4 hijos que se encuentran en escuela y tambien en la universidad, es una persona responsable y trabajadora y tiene que sacar adelante a su familia, su deseo es ver a sus hijos profesionales y tambien poder agrandar su tienda, el dinero del credito es para la compra de abarrotes al por mayor. La tienda de abarrotes se constituye en una agencia, ya que vende por mayor a gran parte de las tiendas de la zona de Tacagua. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion de creditos
texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old and is married to Manuel who is a teacher in the province. Maria has a neighborhood store as well as being a teacher. The two live in their own home, have four children who are in school and university. She is a responsible and hardworking person who wants her family to be successful. Her wish is to see her children become professionals and also to be able to grow her store. The money from this loan is to buy groceries for wholesale. The grocery store constitutes an agency because it sells wholesale to most of the stores in the Tacagua area. Maria is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidance the show in her by granting her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Jonard

texts.en:
Jonard B., age 45, is a farmer. He started his business in 1997. He has two children; the eldest is 17 years old. He owns one carabao and a 1-hectare farm. The income that he gets from growing rice is what he uses to support his family's daily needs.

He would like to grow his business. He would like a loan of 8,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). He will use the loan to buy farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.pt:
Silvestre C. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 40 anos de idade casado e pai de 5 filhos de 14, 13, 08 e gémeos de 4 anos de idade, destes os 3 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou porque foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família sustenta sua mãe vive com ele.
Saiu de Chibuto para Maputo no distrito de Boane quando esteve a cumprir com o serviço militar. Depois de desmobilizado começou a trabalhar numa escola tipo orfanato (casa do Gaiato) como estofador, actividade que aprendeu com o pai ainda jovem. Não possui nenhum empregado, conta com ajuda do seu filho e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
 Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu vizinho que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 13.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de (pregos, nadas, molas e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua actividade. O emprestimo anterior foi de 2.500.00mt, para serviços. 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na área comercial e concluir a sua casa, oferecendo melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Silvestre C. was born in the district of Chibuto, Gaza Province, in southern Mozambique. He is 40 years old and married. He has five children: a 14-year-old, a 13-year-old, an 8-year-old, and 4-year-old twins. The three older children attend school. He only finished 8th grade and left school to fulfill his compulsory military service. He lives in his own house with his family, and also supports his mother, who lives with them. He left Chibuto for Maputo in the district of Boane, where he remained to complete his military service. After leaving the military he started working in an orphanage school (Casa do Gaiato) as an upholsterer, a trade he learned from his father when he was young. He doesn't have any employees, and instead relies on his son's assistance. He brings in about 5000 meticals a month, which is enough to cover household expenses and also save a little in a bank account. He's never received loans from other banks. He learned about Hvuluku from his neighbor, who is also a Hvuluku client. This is his second loan, in the amount of 13,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase materials (nails, springs, etc.) to continue his work. His previous loan was for 2500 meticals. He'd like to request additional loans in the future, to be used in his business and also to finish his house and offer his family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for furniture repair (nails, springs, etc.)

loans.name: Thioro

texts.fr:
Madame Ba née Thioro N. est mère de 2 enfants âgés de 9 ans et 5 ans. Elle est couturière et s’active depuis 2002 dans le commerce pour, dit-elle, diversifier ses activités et suivre aussi les pas de sa famille qui compte de grands commerçants. Elle vend divers produits du genre produits cosmétiques, tissus, habits, poulets, produits aphrodisiaques…... etc. 
Elle est à sa quatrième demande de crédit au niveau de U-IMCEC et souhaitait  avec ce prêt compléter son approvisionnement en produits pour renforcer son commerce.
Enfin, Madame Ba née Thioro N. âgée de 30 ans trouve dans ses activités, une certaine indépendance financière.
texts.en:
Mrs Thioro N. Ba is the mother of two children, aged 9 and 5 years old. She is a dressmaker and has been in this business since 2002 because, she says, she wanted to diversify her business and follow in her family's footsteps of large merchants. She sells a variety of cosmetic products, cloth, clothes, chickens, aphrodisiacs, etc. She is requesting her fourth loan from the micro-finance group U-IMCEC and will use this all of this loan to purchase supplies for her store, in order to strengthen her business. Finally, at the age of 30, Mrs Thioro N. Ba has found a certain financial independence through her business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase diverse supplies

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 27 años, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su hija de 6 años, fruto de su primer compromiso. Actualmente vive con su nueva pareja, con quien tiene un hijo de 5 meses de nacido.     

Desde hace 5 años se dedica al cultivo de lechuga, maíz, papa y arvejas; su esposo sólo le ayuda en sus tiempos libres, pues trabaja en la municipalidad de su provincia.
Los terrenos que siembra son propios y algunos heredados por su padre, quien le enseñó todas las técnicas agrícolas que practica en la actualidad. A Elena le gusta plantar lechuga por lo rentable que resulta y la demanda que tiene en el mercado. Por lo que para el futuro se proyecta a construir una casa propia para que sus hijos tengan una adecuada calidad de vida, sin dejar de incrementar su producción.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y desde ya asegura que le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal, donde se compromete a pagar puntualmente cada cuota para no quedar mal con su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita comprará una bolsa de semilla de arveja y dos sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Elena is 27 years old. She lives in her parents’ home with her 6-year-old daughter (who was the child of her first marriage), her current husband, and their 5-month-old son. For 5 years Elena has made a living growing lettuce, corn, potatoes, and peas; her husband can only help her during his free time, since he works for their province’s council. She cultivates her own fields, including some that she inherited from her father, who taught her all of the agricultural techniques that she now uses. Elena likes planting lettuce because it is profitable and there is much demand for it in the market. In the future she plans to construct her own house to that she and her children will have an adequate quality of life, while also increasing her production. This is Elena’s first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she assures us that she likes working in the communal bank, where she promises to make each of her payments on time so that she won’t give the other members of her group a bad impression. She will use the 1000 soles she is requesting to purchase a bag of pea seeds and two bags of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth V. is from the town of Banga. She is 55 years old. Ruth is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Ruth plants, harvests, and sells rice. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 20 years.

In 2010, Ruth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure and seeds. This will be Ruth's first loanfrom CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure and seeds

loans.name: Reynold

texts.en: Reynold L. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 46 years old. Reynold is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Reynold operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing taxi services to local community members. Reynold has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Reynold joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynold is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Reynold from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 56-year-old, hard-working mother of six children ranging in age from 11 to 35 years old. One of her children goes to school, but the rest have finished high school. Two of her sons will advise her on how to use the loan. One of them is a motorcyclist and the other is a taxi driver, but is looking for work.

Virginia owns a store that sells food and household goods. With a loan, she plans to increase the products she carries. Using the profits, she hopes to buy a piece of land, enlarge her shop, and make a small restaurant. She is located near a school and believes she will have a steady clientele. 

About the bank:
Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) is a public limited company established to provide financial services as a ladder of opportunity to the poor and small entrepreneurs for whom access to formal financial capital is currently limited. UOB's vision is to be a sustainable financial institution achieving significant economic, social and spiritual transformational impact on the underprivileged of Rwanda through a variety of products and related training in a way that reflects the love of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in her store

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: K. Elisabeth est née en 1973 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AHOUANGAN Bonaventure, un chauffeur, Elisabeth est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Elisabeth vit avec sa famille au quartier Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis quatorze ans environs. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Elisabeth n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour assurer ses besoins et venir en aide à son mari, Elisabeth vend diverses boissons et divers autres produits à Gbogbanou à Cotonou. Elisabeth s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Elisabeth exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année et avait bénéficié quatre fois déjà de crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Elisabeth désire développer davantage son activité et augmenter ses stocks de produits pour mieux répondre à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter un cinquième prêt.
texts.en:
Elisabeth K. was born in 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Bonaventure AHOUANGAN, a chauffeur, Elisabeth is the mother of four school-aged children. She has lived with her family in the Agbalilamè neighborhood, in the Sèmè-Podji commune, for approximately fourteen years. The couple share the various familial responsibilities. Elisabeth did not go to school. In order to provide for their needs and to help her husband, Elisabeth sells various beverages and other products in Gbogbanou in Cotonou. Elisabeth gets her supplies in Dantopka, the international market of Bénin. She has engaged in this business for ten years and has already received four loans from ALIDé that she has repaid in full. Elisabeth would like to further develop her business and increase her stock of products so as to better respond to the increasing demand of her customers. That is what has led her to ask for a fifth loan.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beverages.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is from the city of Gango Ozamiz City. She is 44 and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine runs a motorbike transportation service. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair her vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair vehicle for better service

loans.name: Ndum

texts.en:
G. Ndum is a married mother of five who currently lives in Chuaku, Belo-Cameroon. G. is currently requesting her third loan from GHAPE. She has been with GHAPE since 2007, and she has demonstrated a creditworthy character exemplified by her repayments, consistent attendance at meetings, and support of her borrowing group.  

With this latest loan G. is hoping to continue the business practices supported by her prior loans. She has requested 165,000 XAF in order to purchase 10 bags of Irish potatoes for 120,000 XAF and palm oil for 45,000 XAF. She believes her business will succeed because of her prior success, ample client base, and increasing demand for her products. She hopes to use the profits from her business to pay her children's school fees, to purchase seeds for her farm, and to reinvest in her business. She will use this loan to manage current afflictions in her life such as the theft of a significant amount of money from her money and treatment for her mother who only has use of one eye.

G.'s loan would be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit nongovernmental organization based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and the alleviation of poverty through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase Irish potatoes and palm oil

loans.name: Rhesa

texts.en: Rhesa R. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old. Rhesa is widowed and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Rhesa runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop to sell a variety of different products in the local community. Rhesa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Rhesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rhesa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Rhesa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shirley Lorenis

texts.es:
En San Jacinto población del departamento de Bolívar, muy cerca a la carretera troncal de occidente vive Shirley, mujer de 29 años quien desde la edad de 13, aprendió a tejer mochilas con una vecina y en la actualidad es su actividad principal, porque  la artesanía  le permite ganar dinero y estar pendiente de las labores del hogar y generar ingresos, mientras su  esposo, profesor en un colegio de primaría, y  ella sueñan y trabajan persistentemente para sacar a sus cuatro hijos adelante, que están en las edades de 2 a 10 años.
 Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él   comprará  en mayor volumen hilos para tejer mochilas y bolsos, así ella, consiguiendo nuevos clientes, empieza a poner en marcha su sueño de tener un  almacén  de artesanías y de materias primas para la elaboración de las hermosas y autóctonas mochilas y hamacas, que son muy reconocidas y con su utilidad  aspira a generar mas ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, terminar de construir su casa  y en el futuro hacer de sus hijos unos profesionales.
 Shirley cuenta que en su negocio ha tenido muchos desafíos que la han enseñado, entre otros  la situación más difícil que vivió cuando dejó a  un cliente   una importante cantidad de  mercancía y este  nunca le pago, generando la  descapitalización de su negocio, por lo que tuvo que empezar de nuevo sus. Pero eso es cosa del pasado y ahora se esfuerza diariamente por tener clientes fieles y honestos.
texts.en:
Shirley lives in the town of San Jacinto in the Bolíar department, which is very close to the main road to the west. She is 29 years old, and when she was 13 she learned how to weave backpacks with a neighbor. This is currently her main activity because handicrafts have allowed her to earn money, take care of the household chores, and generate income. Her husband is an elementary school teacher. They dream and work persistently in order to get their four children ahead. The children range in ages from two to ten. This is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy a greater volume of yarn to weave the backpacks and handbags. That way she will be getting new customers, and she will start on her dream of having a handicraft place for storage. It will have the raw material for making her beautiful indigenous backpacks and hammocks, which are very well known. With the profits, she aspires to generate more income for her family’s well-being, to finish building her house, and that her children become professionals in the future. Shirley says that in her business she has had many challenges that she learned from. The most difficult one that she had was when she gave a customer an important amount of merchandise, and the customer never paid. This took capital from her business, and she had to start again. But, this is a thing of the past. Now she puts forth daily effort to have customers that are loyal and honest.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater volume of yarn to weave backpacks and handbags

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna P. is a married woman who lives in Brgy Cervantes, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a Carenderia or eatery  business.  Her husband Nonilo P., who is 41 years old, works as a Carpenter and Plumber to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 4 children who are 3 to 20 years old. 

Edna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Edna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 20000, which she intends to use to purchase of raw food ingredients to cook and sell in her carenderia or eatery so that she could continue to earn and  save up for future for the education of her children. Edna P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta, de 42 años, es una mujer alegre y muy colaboradora, convive con Roberto, de 44 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos Diana de 15 y Adán de 12 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa Centro Pumpuriani). Todos los días desde muy temprano se dirige a una pequeña vivienda que habilitó al costado de su terreno de cultivo; donde puede dedicarle mayor tiempo al cuidado de sus plantaciones.  Ahí Lorena siembra café, plátano, maíz y yuca; el tiempo es muy corto para ella, pues cuando termina de limpiar y aplicar abono a su terreno, se dedica al cuidado de sus gallinas. Desde  hace ya 30 años se dedica a la agricultura y está contenta, ya que disfruta mucho del tiempo que pasa con su familia, por eso ahora ya adquirió 4 cuadras de terrenos de platanales, donde piensa sembrar en grandes cantidades, con ello Violeta suma 5 cuadras de cafetal y 4 cuadras de terrenos listos para cultivar. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta agradecida con su banco comunal ya que aprende mucho en las charlas educativas que constantemente ofrecen. Con el crédito que recibirá, lo invertirá en la compra de 2 mil plantas de plátanos); que equivalen a S/. 70.00 nuevos soles cada uno.
texts.en:
Violeta is 42 years old and a very happy, collaborating woman.  She lives with Roberto who is 44 years old; they have 4 children together but they only live with 2 of them: Diana who is 15 and Adan who is 12.  They live in their own home located in the Peruvian jungle (in the Pumpuriani native community center).  Everyday, she goes to a small home on the side of her land; here, she can spend more time taking care of plants and her land.  Lorena grows coffee, banana, corn, and yucca; she has very little time because as soon as she finishes cleaning and fertilizing her land, she takes care of her chickens.  She has worked in agriculture for the last 30 years and she is very happy.  She enjoys the time she spends with her family.  She has purchased 4 blocks of banana fields where she would like to grow large amounts of bananas.  With this purchase, Violeta will have 5 blocks of coffee plants, and 4 blocks ready to be planted.  This is the 4th loan she will receive from MFP and she is grateful to the village bank since she has learned a lot in the classes that they offer.  With the loan she will buy 2,000 banana plants which cost about $25 each.

Violeta, de 42 años, es una mujer alegre y muy colaboradora, convive con Roberto, de 44 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos Diana de 15 y Adán de 12 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa Centro Pumpuriani). Todos los días desde muy temprano se dirige a una pequeña vivienda que habilitó al costado de su terreno de cultivo; donde puede dedicarle mayor tiempo al cuidado de sus plantaciones.  Ahí Lorena siembra café, plátano, maíz y yuca; el tiempo es muy corto para ella, pues cuando termina de limpiar y aplicar abono a su terreno, se dedica al cuidado de sus gallinas. Desde  hace ya 30 años se dedica a la agricultura y está contenta, ya que disfruta mucho del tiempo que pasa con su familia, por eso ahora ya adquirió 4 cuadras de terrenos de platanales, donde piensa sembrar en grandes cantidades, con ello Violeta suma 5 cuadras de cafetal y 4 cuadras de terrenos listos para cultivar. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta agradecida con su banco comunal ya que aprende mucho en las charlas educativas que constantemente ofrecen. Con el crédito que recibirá, lo invertirá en la compra de 2 mil plantas de plátanos); que equivalen a S/. 70.00 nuevos soles cada uno.

loans.use: Buy 2,000 banana plants

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie T., from the town of Sto. Niño, is 29 years old, married and has two children aged six and five. To make a living, Melanie owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Melanie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She also likes its microinsurance program. Melanie is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase seeds, fertilizers and farming equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and farming equipment

loans.name: Gilber

texts.es: Gilber, de 38 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. En la provincia de Chanchamayo, se encuentran las chacras de Gilber, sus tierras son amplias y con los cuidados que les brinda las ha convertido en uno de los cultivos mejores trabajados del poblado, es por eso que cuando lleva a vender sus plátanos y café al mercado de la ciudad de La Merced, obtiene muy buenos precios debido a la buena calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plagas que pueden afectarlos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras en otros poblados para así aumentar su producción y variar sus cultivos. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Gilber con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus mejorar sus tierras.
texts.en: Gilber, 38, is a hardworking and unassuming man who lives in his parent's house.  What he wants most is to improve his quality of life.  Gilber's farm is located in the Chanchamayo province; his lands are extensive and with the care he provides he has made them into some of the most productive land in the area.  For this reason, when he brings his bananas and coffee to sell in the market in the city of La Merced he gets very good prices owing to the good quality of his products.  What he enjoys most about his work is planting his fields and making them fertile.  He has been farming for 15 years, and what he considers most difficult is to protect his crops from the pests that can affect them.  Over time, he wants to buy more land in other villages so that he can increase his production and grow a greater variety of crops.  This is Gilber's 4th loan with MFP, and he knows that he has to make his payments on time if he wants to access credit in the future.  In his communal bank he is a very responsible member and is always aware of the decisions that are made by his group.  With the 2,500 Peruvian soles he requests, he will buy more organic and chemical fertilizers to improve his lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to care for his crops

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila C. is from the village of Barangay Mangayan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Prescila is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Prescila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. 

Prescila is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Mangayang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. Say B. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. Her husband also helps her in the same business, and he is a liquor maker as well, earning an income of approximately $3 per day. The couple has three children; all of them are single, living under their care. 

Say B. has raised a lot of piglets and she had hoped to sell them to buyers four months after she began raising them. Unfortunately, the pigs are not big enough, due to the lack of food. To help solve this problem, Mrs. Say B. has requested a loan of $1,100 that she will use to buy several sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs, with the rest of loan going towards the purchase of a few small pigs to feed.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs, and to purchase a few small pigs to feed

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang R. is a widowed mother who lives in the province of Kompong Chhnang. She has two children, both of whom are married but still living with her under her roof.
Hang Ro is good at making bamboo baskets to sell at the market. Besides this business, she is also a local farmer and has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Hang R. and her family, she has requested a loan to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel P. is from the village of Santa Isabel Sur. She is 31 years old. Maribel is married and has 3 infant children. To make a living, Maribel owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making general household furniture and selling to local businesses and community members. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maribel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more raw materials to make furniture to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Maribel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make furniture

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga es una mujer trabajadora, dedicada al comercio de venta de cosméticos, con varios años en las ventas para apoyar a su familia.
 Teniendo el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en albañilería.
Al iniciar lo hizo con pocos productos, luego con financiamiento de la institución logro aumentar sus niveles de ventas, la captación de clientes en donde vende sus productos al contado y al crédito. Tiene productos variados, pero invertirá más logrando mejores ingresos.
Con esta nueva solicitud será para invertir en perfumenes de dama, caballeros, polvo compacto, cremas, pinturas labiales entre otros productos de encargo atreves del catalogo.
texts.en:
Dominga is a hard-working woman who sells cosmetics.  She has been supporting her family with this business for several years.  She has the support of her husband who is a construction worker.

In the beginning, Dominga didn't have many products to sell but, through loans from the institution, she managed to increase her sales levels and attract customers who buy her products for cash or on credit.  She offers a variety of products but she will invest more, thereby achieving better profits.  Dominga will invest this new loan in buying women's and men's perfumes, compact powder, creams, lipsticks and other products that she orders through her catalog.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and perfumes for men and women in order to make better profits

loans.name: Hour

texts.en:
Mrs. Hour C., age 43, makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that her husband gives her or that she buys from other fisherman. She earns an average of US$4.70 a day, and she has been running her business for over ten years. Her husband is 44 years old and is a fisherman who works along a local river.

 Mrs. Hour C. is the mother of six teenage children; all of them are single. Currently, Mrs. Hour C. uses an existing motorcycle as transportation to sell her fish in the busy market. Unluckily, her motorcycle has broken down, and that may influence her fish selling business. Because of this problem, Mrs. Hour C. decided to request a loan to purchase a used motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle to replace her broken one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk, corn, rice, beans, cooking oil, bread, soft drinks, sweets and snacks

loans.name: Bayardo Enrique

texts.es:
Bayardo casado, hombre trabajador y responsable, todos sus hijos ya son mayores de edad, mejorar su condiciones de vida actual es una de sus prioridades, agricultor desde hace un gran tiempo, ha tenido problema de sequia en la finca, inicio a cosechar en sus tierra con el apoyo de la reforma agraria. 
Planes para su finca mejorar los suelos con la incorporación de abonos verdes.
El préstamo será invertido en la compra  de insumos y fertilizantes que será aplicado debidamente al suelo antes de iniciar a sembrar.
texts.en:
Bayardo is a married, hardworking and responsible man; all of his children are of age. One of his priorities is to improve his quality of life. Bayardo has been a farmer for a very long time and has had drought on his ranch and he began to harvest his land by the support of agrarian reform.

Bayardo’s plans for his ranch include improving his soil by using green fertilizers.

The loan will be used to buy materials and fertilizers to be used on the soil before he begins to sow his crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. is a 26-year-old single lady who runs a beauty shop in the King’eero area of Kangemi, Kenya. She has been in this business for 2 years and earns a monthly income of 20,450 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Esther has been a good client; this will be her fourth loan with KADET. She plans to use the loan to add more stock to her beauty shop. She hopes to make a good profit and buy another kerosene pump to add to the one she already has as a secondary business.

In the future, Esther hopes to operate a petrol filling station (gas station) and open up a beauty parlor.

loans.use: to stock a beauty shop

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” VILCANOTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba,  perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maruja; la socia tiene 44 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de frazadas para las camas ella vende de plaza y media y de dos plazas, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le trae muchas satisfacciones ya que mediante este trabajo ella saca a su familia adelante, la socia trabaja a pedido ella compra su mercadería para luego venderlo a sus clientes que son sus amistades, familiares y vecinos ,la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar de mas mercadería de frazadas para así poder tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "VILCANOTA" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Maruja is 44 years old, married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activity with the purchase and sale of blankets.  She sells twin and double bed sizes.  She has been involved in this business for several years and enjoys what she does while making a living to support her family.

She works on an order basis, buying the merchandise which she later sells to customers who are mainly friends, family and neighbors.  She is a cheerful, responsible person.

She is requesting a loan to buy more blankets to offer a wider variety to customers.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy more blankets and offer a wider variety to customers

loans.name: Trancito Piedad

texts.es:
La Señora Trancito T. es socia del banco comunal Fe y Alegría, vive en la parroquia  Baños, esta localidad  es conocida por sus piscinas de aguas termales las cuales son muy calientes, por la variedad de lugares turísticos y centros de diversión,asì como  por su gastronomía y calidez de su gente.

La Señora Trancito tiene 43 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 4 hijos de 25, 23, 20, 16 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados e independientes, su tercera hija trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar y su ultimo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es jubilado por invalidez por un derrame que sufrió hace algún tiempo, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Trancito se dedica a la venta de comida la cual la realiza en su casa, labora de lunes a viernes solo el medio día y lleva en este negocio 2 años.
 
Este es  su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en el pago del arriendo de un local que rentò para ampliarse con su negocio y vender mucho más sus deliciosos platos.

Su meta es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Ms. Trancito T. is a member of the Fe y Alegría (Faith and Joy) community bank. She lives in the Baños parish, which is well known for its hot springs, its tourist spots, its entertainment centers, its cuisine, and its people's warmth. 
Ms. Trancito is a 43-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 4 children ages 25, 23, 20, and 16. Her two eldest children are married and independent. Her third daughter works and helps with the household expenses, while her youngest son is attending a local school.
