Her husband has retired due to a disability caused by a hemorrhage that he had some time ago. They do not own a house, which is why they have to rent.  
Ms. Trancito sells foods in her home, working at noon from Monday through Friday. She has been in business for two years. 
This is her fourth loan from the community bank, and she will invest it in renting a business space so that she can increase sales and sell more of her delicious dishes. 

Her goal is to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: to pay the rent on a leased home

loans.name: Raufjon

texts.en:
Raufjon K. is 40 years old. He has 6 years of experience in the beef business. His wife is a housekeeper and Raufjon is the sole breadwinner in his family. Due to this way of life, this father works hard every day to support his family with the best quality of life he can afford. His butcher shop supplies large amounts of meat to the population that resides in their region. Raufjon buys cattle in the market and sells their fresh meat daily to his customers. Due to high demand, this man seeks a loan of 10,000 TJS to invest in more cattle so he can have enough product to meet his customers' demands.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Ravelyn

texts.en:
Ravelyn is a 25-year-old married woman from Surallah, South Cotabato. She has a 4-year-old child. Ravelyn is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She helps her husband till their land for growing rice. She also maintains a small backyard piggery. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market.

Ravelyn has requested a loan and plans to use it to buy pig feed, rice seeds and fertilizers. In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman. She also hopes for her child to have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 7 children, six of whom are in school.  She has a business selling old clothes.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Alice sells her products at the market.   

Alice has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.  She also generates additional income through rental rooms   The main business challenge(s) for Alice include the rainy season and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own business premises and also to educate her children up to University.   Alice lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of  second-hand clothes

loans.name: Ayubjon

texts.en:
Ayubjon is married and has three children. He makes a living selling foodstuffs in his grocery store. His location is very attractive and he serves many customers because he is willing to work late. Ayubjon has been in this business for 15 years and knows a good deal about it. Ayubjon is also a very punctual and detail-oriented person, character traits that help him in his business. Ayubjon can always figure out how many supplies he needs so there is enough on hand to meet customer needs and it is always fresh. Ayubjon has applied for a loan to increase his inventory of items to sell. He will spend the additional income made possible by this loan to improve his living conditions. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a new assortment of food to sell

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda is 35 years old, married, and has two children aged 12 and 11. Her husband is a farmer. Amanda helps her husband grow rice. She also raises pigs in their backyard. Aside from farming, Amanda also manages a sari-sari store (a small general shop) where she sells items like canned goods.

Amanda has requested a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizers, one sack of pig feed, and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a stable income that will sustain her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pig feed, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Hernan Luis

texts.es: El señor Hernan es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, hernan tiene un taller de soldura en las afueras de su casa, hernan se dedica a hacer puertas y ventanas andamios entre otras cosas, con su trabajo hernan ayuda en los gastos familiares, el dinero que esta solicitando es para comprar fierros, llaves entre otras herramientas que son esenciales para su trabajo, hernan como muchos jovenes tiene sueños uno de ello es formar su familia y hacer crecer mas su negocio,y asi mejorar su calidad de vida, hernan esta muy agradecido con la confianza que se le esta brindado
texts.en:
Hernan is single, and he lives in his parents’ house.  Hernan has a soldering shop outside of his house.  Hernan makes doors and window scaffolding, among other things.  With his work Hernan helps with the family expenses.

The money that he is requesting is to buy iron and wrenches, among other tools that are essential to his work.

Hernan, like many young men, has dreams.  One of them is to start his family and to make his business grow more.  This way he will improve his quality of life.  Hernan is very grateful for the trust placed in him.

loans.use: to buy iron and wrenches, among other tools that are essential to his work.

loans.name: Alcida De Jesús

texts.es:
Llegar a tener una producción constante de pollos de engorde es el sueño de Alcida oriunda del municipio de Rionegro en el Oriente de Antioquia, quien desde hace algunos años se dedica a este oficio como independiente motivada por la ilusión de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia conformada por sus tres hijos y por su esposo, pues con lo que el gana como empleado no les alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar. 

Actualmente Alcida necesita de un préstamo para construir un corral, comparar algunos pollos y el cuido necesario para iniciar el proceso de engorde de los mismos.
texts.en:
Alcida is from the town of Rionegro, in the east of Antioquia.  Her dream is to have a constant production of fattening chickens.  She has been working in this business independently for some years.  She was motivated by the desire to improve her quality of life and that of her family.  Her family consists of her three children and her husband.  What her husband earns as a company employee does not stretch far enough to cover their household expenses.

Alcida currently needs a loan to build a pen and buy some chickens and the feed she needs to start her process fattening the animals.

loans.use: to buy a pen, chickens and feed

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 62, married, and has six children aged thirty-four, thirty-three, twenty-seven, twenty-four, nineteen, and sixteen. He has been farming for thirty years and has a monthly income of 16,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy water pipes and repair his water pump. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his farming by purchasing a bigger farm. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children up to university level and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy water pipes and repair his water pump

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, provincia de Maputo ao sul de Moçambique, solteiro e não tem filhos. Fez a 12ª classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com sua familia e sustenta o seu irmão que vive com ele.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, trabalha como secretario dos recursos humanos na bananalandia a bastante tempo e tem um salario de 4.950.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que também é cliente e este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para sua obra DE CASA PARA HABITACAO ( areia, pedra, blocos, ferro, chapas, e outros ). O primeiro emprestimo foi de : 17.000.00mt,para dar inicio a sua obra.
Sonha em concluir a sua casa e mobiliar para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Antonio was born in the District of Boane, province of Maputo in the South of Mozambique, is single and has no children. He completed 12th grade and stopped his education due to a lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his brother who lives with him.

Antonio has never left Maputo,  has been working as a secretary in human resources at Bananalandia for quite some time and has a salary of 4,950 meticals (MZN) a month, which he uses on household expenses and saves in his bank account.

He has never had loans from other banks. He learned of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client and this is his second loan from Hluvuku for the amount of 10,000 MZN, with which he intends to purchase materials for the construction work on the house in which he lives (sand, stone, blocks, iron, sheet materials and others). His first loan was for 17,000 MZN to start the construction work.

He dreams of completing his house and furnishing it to provide greater comfort for his family, for which he intends to solicit more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase materials for the construction work on the house in which he lives (sand, stone, blocks, iron, sheet materials and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Musharraf

texts.en:
Musharraf is a 44-year-old woman. She is married with three sons and two daughters. Musharraf has a project raising sheep and benefits from selling their products. This is the only source of income for the family. Musharraf wants to buy fodder to feed the sheep better in order to increase their productivity and sell more of their products to generate more income. Musharraf does not have enough money to pay, so she needs to take a loan of JOD 700 from FATEN.

When Musharraf takes the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she can purchase sheep fodder and, therefore, increase the amount of sheep products she'll have to sell. Musharraf is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase fodder for the sheep she is raising.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 29 years old and married to Antony. They have two school-going children. Ruth has been operating a greengrocery shop for the last six years in Kangemi town.
Ruth was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a KADET client. She has paid her previous loans well and in good time. She intends to use this loan amount to buy ten crates of tomatoes, two bags of onions, Sukuma Wiki (greens) and one bag of cabbage – all for resale.
In the future, Ruth hopes to open a wholesale greengrocery shop.

loans.use: to buy ten crates of tomatoes, two bags of onions, Sukuma Wiki and one bag of cabbage.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a married woman with three children; two attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rented house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a restaurant business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer’s needs in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Deisi Marilin De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Deisi Marilin De Los Ángeles tiene cuarentainueve  años de edad es casada tiene seis hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de treintaidos, treinta, veintiocho, veinticuatro, diecisiete y trece años de edad en el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA VRC SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, Parroquia puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz.
Deisi se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol las compras y las ventas las realiza en san Jacinto. Solicita el Crédito para invertir en la agricultura, comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos y posterior venderlos a un buen precio.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá comprar los insumos agrícolas sin ningún problema porque va a contar con dinero.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuente son: la competencia, las plagas, enfermedades que se dan en los cultivos. El sueño para los próximos 5 años es seguir mejorando y no tener deudas para poder comprar un carro.
En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música, bailar y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Deisi Marilin De Los Ángeles, 49, is married and has six children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 32, 30, 28, 24, 17 and 13 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “San Nicolás” communal bank is located in Recinto San Nicolás, Puerto Pechiche Parish belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn farmers.

Deisi grows corn, rice and beans.  Her purchases and sales take place in San Jacinto.  She’s asking for the loan to invest in farming.  She will buy seeds and farm supplies like urea, Matamonte brand herbicide, fertilizer and weed killer to keep her crops in good condition and sell them at good prices.  The loan will be very useful because she will buy farm supplies problem free because she’ll have the money.

The challenges she faces are very frequent.  They are: competition, pests and crop diseases.  Her dream for the next five years is to continue improving and be debt free so that she can buy a car.  In her free time she enjoys listening to music, dancing and spending time with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 41 years old. He lives in the village of Ruispiri in the Kakheti Region. Gocha is married and lives with his family: two daughters (12 and 10 years old) and his parents.  The children go to school.  

Gocha’s mother trades in grocery products. His father is busy with agriculture, looking after 240 peach trees. Along with this work, the family also has a milk cow.   The harvested peach and dairy products are sold locally. The total average monthly income for the family is 1600 Laris. 

Gocha has a small vulcanization station in the village. He provides tire services to drivers in his and nearby villages. Gocha requested credit to purchase used tire-covers. He will repair them and sell them in his vulcanization station.  This will increase the income of his family, which will be used for the family's well-being.

loans.use: buy used tire-covers

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en las mejoras de la tienda, el actual préstamo lo invertirá en mercaderia como aceite, frijoles, huevos, boquitas, detergentes, para incrementar el negocio de una mejor manera. 

El préstamo anterior le ayudo para aumentar la capacidad del taller de carpinteria que atiende su padre.
Él esta satisfecho con este servicio, ya que le ha ayudado a desarrollarse y crecer como comerciante, ya que ahora administra una tienda de productos domesticos, Julio siempre esta trabajando como empleado de una ferreteria, este empleo lo tenia desde su primer prestamo, la fotografia publicada es en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Julio has decided on a new loan to invest in improving his store. The actual loan will be invested in merchandise like oil, beans, eggs, snacks, and detergents to expand the business in a better way. The previous loan helped him increase the capacity of the hardware store his father works in. 

He is happy with this service since it has helped him to develop and grow as a merchant and since now he runs a store with home products. Julio is always working as an employee in a hardware store, a job that he has held since his first loan, which is where this photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy oil, beans, eggs, snack, and detergents.

loans.name: Chérif  Dié

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié qui a à sa charge ses deux enfants et sa femme.Il exerce le métier de charpentier.Il achéte des troncs d'arbres aux bucherons et fabrique des objets d'art, des mortiers et divers autres outils qu'il vend sur le marché local.Son activité lui permet d'entretenir sa petite famille et de subvenir à ses propres besoins.Il sollicite un prêt de 200000f de l'UIMCEC pour renforcer son fonds de commerce.Il compte acheter avec ce montant 4 troncs d'arbres morts et du vernis.Son ambition est d'exporter ses produits vers les marchés de la sous- région et en occident.
texts.en:
Chérif Dié is a married carpenter with 2 dependent children. He buys tree trunks from woodcutters and makes sculptures, mortarboards and other tools which he then sells at the local market. His income allows him to take care of his little family and cover his own needs.

Chérif Dié is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs from UIMCEC to boost his working capital. He will use the money to buy 4 tree trunks and some varnish. He would eventually like export his products to sub-regional and western markets.

loans.use: to buy 4 tree trunks and some varnish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sneakers, easy wear, slippers, jeans trouser, neck trig, and baby tubs for her business

loans.name: Badeea

texts.en:
Badeea is a 57-year-old woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Badeea sells clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase clothes to sell.

Badeea is looking to customize a separate  room at her home so that she can sell her clothes from it.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sok Khorn

texts.en:
Sok Khorn, 27, is married and resides with her husband in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store and sells soft drinks at home. Her husband is a Khmer traditional musician. 

Sok Khorn is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to build a concrete house.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 31 years old and married with 2 children. He faces the challenge of price fluctuation which affect his business profits. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to move his business to a more permanent location. Robert needs a loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha, 35 years old, is married to Stephen and they have four children. Tabitha has operated a business buying and selling maize for 3 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Tabitha is taking out a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET ltd, which she intends to use to purchase more maize for sale. She will educate her children with the anticipated profit. Tabitha's hopes and dreams are to expand the business and have a stable family.

loans.use: to purchase more maize for sale

loans.name: Faustino Emilio

texts.es:
Faustino es un hombre de 47 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposa y sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con el apoyo de su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Faustino no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Veterinaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Faustino trabaja como obrero de campo en una empresa agrícola de su ciudad, adicionalmente también se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Faustino se encuentra agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina y utensilios para su hogar, ya que actualmente cuenta con una pequeña cocina que está en mal estado y presenta fugas, de esta manera Faustino brindara mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de de tener su propio negocio de venta de productos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Faustino, 47, lives in the city of Chincha with his wife and three children, whom he loves and are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who, together with the support of his wife, puts all his effort into moving his family forward. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources, and because he needed to work to meet his expenses, he was unable to study a professional degree in Veterinary Medicine, but he would have liked to be able to do so. In his free time, he likes to make a delicious Carapulcra con Sopa Seca (a pork and potato stew with noodles) to share with his family. 

On his own initiative, with lots of effort and dedication, Faustino works as a laborer in his city's agricultural business. In addition, he also works raising and selling livestock. He works every day, starting early in the morning, and he can work for about 10 hours. He is comfortable in his work and believes it is going well for him because of his good performance and the friendly way in which he treats others. Faustino is thankful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help given, he will be able to buy a stove and utensils for his home. He currently has a small stove that is in bad shape and has leaks. This way, Faustino will give his family greater security and comfort. He will keep working and making an effort to achieve his big dream of having his own business selling agricultural products.

loans.use: to buy a stove and utensils

loans.name: Martha Francisca

texts.en:
Mrs Martha is a married woman, has threes children, and her husband works in a factory. She is a hard working woman, always trying to improve her economic situation and give a better future to her children.

Six years ago she had hard times because her husband was fired and this forced her to work by herself, and then she decided to start a small business of selling clothes. This business has been growing and has let her contribute in an important way to the family income.

In this moment she is planning to buy seasonal clothing and be able to offer a great variety of styles to her clients. For that reason she is requesting a loan of $375 USD to pay in a term of 4-8 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Doña Martha es una mujer casada que tiene tres hijos, su ,esposo trabaja como obrero en una empresa, ella es un mujer muy trabajadora que siempre ha tenido en mente mejorar y brindar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Hace seis años vivió momentos muy difíciles, cuando su esposo se quedo sin empleo y esa fue la razón que la empujó a trabajar por su cuenta y fue entonces que se decidió a iniciar su pequeño negocio D. venta D. ropa, el cual ha ido creciendo y le ha permitido contribuir D. manera importante al ingreso familiar.

En este momento tiene planeado comprar una paca D. ropa D. temporada para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una buena variedad D. estilos, es por ello que requiere D. un préstamo por $ 375 USD a pagar en un plazo D. 4-8 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Ms. Susana D. Gonzales is a very enterprising person who has owned a novelty/gift shop for one year. Her business has been successful. To prepare for the upcoming Easter season, she needs to buy new merchandise. Therefore, she is seeking a loan in the amount of $1,200 with a 12-month repayment term.

Espanol: La Sra. D. Gonzales es una persona muy emprendedora, tiene mas de 12 meses con un negocio de novedades y regalos. El negocio a marchado bien, se esta preparando para la proxima temporada de Pascua y necesita comprar mercancia, por lo cual solicita un prestamo de $1,200 Dllr. El cual piensa pagar en un plazo de 12 meses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Mir Habas

texts.en: Mir Habas lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a shopkeeper. He has a dress shop. He has experience working as a shopkeeper and he wants to improve his business to make his shop bigger. Now he wants to take a loan and buy more clothes for the shop to find more clients and increase his business. It is one of his best wishes and also a good chance for him to work hard and further this business. He is sure that he can help his family now.

loans.use: To buy new clothes

loans.name: Leticia Del Carmen

texts.en:
Leticia is an enthusiastic and entrepreneurial woman. She separated from her husband six years ago. She receives absolutely no help from him to pay for the expenses and studies of her son. Therefore, Leticia as had to work hard to get ahead. The salary that she received as maid was very low and in order to pay for all household expenses, she started her own business three years ago, selling flowers and presents.

Leticia wants to give a new impulse to her business to increments her income. Her son is now studying in the University and has a lot of expenses. She wants her son to be able to finish his studies and therefore she is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to increment the variety of her business and to continue growing. She will repay this amount in 3 months. Please contribute to the growth of this business and become an important part in the life of Leticia and her son. They are very thankful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Leticia es una mujer emprendedora y entusiasta, está separada de su esposo desde hace seis años, no recibe ningún tipo de ayuda de él para el sostén y estudio de su hijo, por lo que Leticia ha tenido que trabajar y esforzarse mucho por sacarlo adelante, el salario que recibía como empleada era muy bajo y para poder cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar inició su propio negocio hace tres años, donde vende flores y regalos.

Leticia desea dar un nuevo impulso a su negocio para poder incrementar sus utilidades, su hijo ya está en la universidad y tiene muchos gastos, ella desea que su hijo pueda culminar sus estudios y para ello solicita un préstamo de $250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener mejor surtida su negocio y poder continuar creciendo, ella devolverá esta cantidad en 3 meses. Contribuye el crecimiento de este negocio y se parte importante en la vida de Leticia y su hijo, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Ikram

texts.en:
Ikram has 10 years of experience in the farming business. He is 37 years old , married, and has 3 children. He lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village.
He needs a loan of US$1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to increase his yield

loans.name: Abdulraman

texts.en: Abdulraman is married with six children and four of his children are in school.  Although he started his business more than five years ago, it was at a very small scale.  With his previous loan, he was able to expand the business and can now purchase six bales of clothing a month.  He still needs to expand the business more and is requesting a loan of $175 for this purpose.

loans.use: Increase the number of clothing bales he purchases to increase his profit.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Antonia sells clothes and footwear that she buys wholesale and then resells it. She began her business seven years ago with $8,000 that she was thankfully able to save up many years before her first loan. The idea to have this business occurred to her when she realized the necessity to have a source of income to support her family. Her clients include customers from the La Terminal market in Leon. Before she had this business, she sold food to homes. But thanks to the idea of having this business and with the help of the previous loans that she used to purchase products such as clothing and footwear, she has successfully moved forward with her business and, in particular, her family.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria Antonia vende ropa y calzado, compra al mayorista y realiza sus ventas al detalle. Lleva 7 años trabajando con este negocio, nos dice que su inversion inicial fue de $8,000 gracias a un ahorro que tenia de muchos años mas su primer prestamo. La idea de tener este negocio se dió al ver la necesidad de tener una manera de recibir ingresos para mantener a su familia. Tiene como clientela a la gente del mercado La Terminal en Leon para acceder a un medio de comunicación. Antes de tener este negocio, antes vendia comida a domicilio pero gracia a la idea de poner el negocio y con el apoyo que ha recibido a travez de estos créditos, que son para la compra de productos tales como ropa y calzado ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio y con su familia sobre todo.

loans.use: Purchase clothes and footwear to resell.

loans.name: Fiza

texts.en: “I live in the bustling city of Lahore in Pakistan along with my husband and four children. I send three of my children to school because they should learn and these days education is a major requirement for survival. My youngest child is a toddler. My husband and I need a loan so that we can purchase a new Rickshaw. We want to purchase a four stroke Rickshaw, which the government has recently introduced. We will sell our old Rickshaw and combine it with your loan so we can buy a new one. My husband provides transportation services in the city to people who use his services regularly. I also help generate additional income for our family by tutoring children of junior classes since I have studied up to tenth grade myself.”

loans.use: Purchase a new Rickshaw

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel Benitaz has owned a convenience store for 17 years. With this business he is able to care for his wife, Vitalina, and their four children who are still in school. The store is called, “Comercial B.,” and is situated in a good location and services a good amount of clientele. From his sales, Gabriel has recently bought a small truck to transport his goods and his family.

He continues to work to increase his number of customers. His business is becoming popular in the neighborhood, and through good references and personal relationships, the word is spreading about the great quality of his store. With a loan he will continue to help the business grow by improving the facilities, and buying a greater variety of goods to sell in his store.

loans.use: To buy various grocery items and merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Thi Hanh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hanh, 42 years old, has 3 children who have stable jobs. She’s been a street vendor and mills rice for long time. The family’s daily income is $6.25. She’s taken out loan before. All are paid off. She is applying a loan of 150USD at the Binh Minh since its terms are convenient. The funds is used to buy more rice to mill.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hanh, 42 tuổi, có 3 con đã có công việc ổn định. Chị làm nghề hàng xáo và xát gạo từ lâu. Thu nhập của gia đình chị là 100000đồng/ngày. Chị đã từng đi vay nhưng giờ đã trả hết. Giờ chị vay vốn 2006000 đồng theo Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì có thể được tham gia lâu dài và món tiền được vay tăng dần. Chị vay để đi mua thêm gạo bán.

loans.use: Buy rice to mill

loans.name: Genny Gabriela

texts.es:
Genny wants to contribute to the income of her household and help her husband with the expenses of her young daughter. 3 years ago, she began selling clothes to friends and family members. During this time she has had good results, however, she is now going through a difficult stage in her business. She can no longer count on the money necessary to acquire seasonal clothing, and the inventory that she has isn't enough to generate good earnings.

She is requesting a loan of $250 that she will pay back in three months. She'll use this money to purchase merchandise. With your help, Genny will be able to continue on with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Genny buscando contribuir con la economía familiar y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su pequeña hija, hace 3 años inicio la venta de ropa entre conocidos y familiares, durante este tiempo ha tenido buenos resultados sin embargo ahora pasa por una etapa difícil en su negocio ya que no cuenta con el dinero para adquirir ropa de temporada y el inventario que tiene no es suficiente para generarle buenas ganancias.

Ella solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para poder comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Genny podrá continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Boddy

texts.en:
Boddy S. sells palm oil in Kabala town of Sierra Leone and has been in business for more than 2 years. With her previous loan, her profit increased and she was able to complete the construction of her house.

Now, she would like to expand her business and is requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000 ($350 USD). Boddy would like to purchase larger quantities of palm oil for selling so that she can consistently meet her customers demand and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy palm oil to sell

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.es:
Con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida un grupo de señoras de la localidad Potrero en la ciudad de Carepegua decidió informarse acerca del programa de comité de mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya.

Motivadas por un futuro mejor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante formaron un comité mediante el cual ellas puedan recibir créditos para así tener capital para invertir y generar más dinero mediante la inversión de sus préstamos en su actividades comerciales.

Hace exactamente 26 meses se creó el comité y hoy día se encuentran en el sexto ciclo. Durante este tiempo los miembros del comité aprendieron a ser más responsables y puntuales con sus pagos, a invertir de manera eficaz, y sobre todo a trabajar en grupo.

Cada miembro se dedica a una actividad diferente, pero la mayoría se dedica a las artesanías. Otras también son tejedoras. Las señoras necesitan el crédito para poder comprar la materia prima para continuar con la producción de artesanías y tejidos. Los materiales que necesitan son hilo, aguja, crochet etc.

loans.use: compra de hilos, agujas, telas, entre otros.

loans.name: Thearoth

texts.en:
Mrs. Thearoth K. is a villager in Kveth Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store. Mrs. Thearoth K. used a previous loan to start her business.

Her husband, Mr. Mao Sin, sells coal door-to-door. Mr. Mao Sin’s business has improved, and he wants to expand it. Mrs. Thearoth K. is asking for a loan to buy a cart so her husband can transport the coal as he sells it.

Mrs. Thearoth K. is 34 years old and is the mother two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cart

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married with two grown children. She sells women's clothing in a market in Stryi, Western Ukraine. Alla launched her business on advice of her relative who is an entrepreneur, too. She set reasonable pricing policy and it became one of the reasons why many clients come to her for clothing. Alla has been in this business for 10 years. She already has about $2000 in inventory and owns a vehicle which makes her business a lot more mobile.

She is hoping to get a loan for 3000 Grivnas to purchase seasonal clothing, e.g. sweaters, for the upcoming chilly fall season. Alla is very sharp and manages her time very efficiently. We believe her determination and focused attitude will secure prompt loan repayment and further success of her trade. Moreover, we are hoping increased sales will help Alla generate additional income and make some savings for a much desired vacation in Egypt.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase 60 sweaters for fall season

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena V. was born in San Juan Nepomuceno city, she lives with José Asunción García and they have two children, Alexis and Jacqueline.

She sells food items in bulk and general merchandise, while José is a construction laborer. She began her business through the Businesswomen’s Committee until she was able to open her own business thanks to the foundation’s loans.

She is thankful to the Paraguaya Foundation for making her growth possible, with the education she has received from the committees she could manage her business better and today she now has a good income from her sales.

She is seeking a loan to invest in purchasing merchandise that will allow her to have a variety of products in stock at her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora. Magdalena V. nació en la ciudad de San Juan Nepomuceno, vive con José Asunción García con quien tuvo dos hijos Alexis y Jacqueline todos menores.

Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos comestibles, a granel y mercerías varias, mientras que José es constructor de obras. Se inicio en el comercio a través del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras hasta que pudo abrir su propio negocio gracias a los créditos de la fundación.

Ella agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por hacer posible su crecimiento, pues con las capacitaciones que recibió con los comités ella pudo administrarse mejor y hoy día ya posee un buen ingreso de ventas.

El crédito que ella en esta ocasión solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías que le permitirá poseer una mayor variedad de productos en su stock.

loans.use: Buy in bulk food items such as corn, green beans, peanuts, vegetables, fruit, canned goods, and general merchandise.

loans.name: La Puerta De La Esperanza Group

texts.en: Alba G. is the representative of this group of five named "La Puerta D. La Esperanza." This is a group of women who want to improve their lives, and all want to start their own small business. Alba is a dedicated mother of four older children, and has many hopes and dreams. One of Alba's dreams is to do well enough in her business to remodel her house. She plans to start a small business selling various small items, and hopes to have her very own store someday. On behalf of Alba, the group, and Esperanza International--- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Vendor of small crafts

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Mrs. Reth M. is 48 years old and lives in Preah Punlea Commune, Banteay Meanchey Province. She is married to Mr. Him Samut, 53, who transports water to sell to customers at home; he has been selling since 2000 and earns about $5 per day. Reth has seven children, two of whom are married and five of whom live at home. Two of her children run a money-exchange business.  Reth sells cooked rice with fried chicken and pork to customers in her area; she earns about $10 per day.  To increase her family's income, Reth needs a loan of $1,100 to purchase a store in which to operate her cooked rice business; she will use the remainder of the loan for her children's business.

loans.use: To purchase a store in which to operate her cooked rice business and to support her children's business

loans.name: Dosseh

texts.fr: Né à Aného le 24/07/1976, Mr Dosseh D. est marié et père de 3 enfants. Depuis trois ans, il s’est lancé dans la vente  de téléphones portables et de cartes de recharge en gros aux détaillants de la ville d’Aného. Pour faire face à la consommation qui ne cesse d’accroître, il sollicite un financement pour augmenter la quantité de ses commandes. Cela lui permettra d'accroitre considérablement son chiffre d'affaires, ses bénéfices et ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mr. Dosseh D., born on July 24, 1976, is married and the father of three. Three years ago, he began selling mobile phones and phone cards wholesale to retailers in the city of Aného. To address the ever-growing consumer activity, he is applying for financing to increase the quantity of his orders. This will enable him to improve his sale figures considerably, as well as his profit and living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell mobile phones and phone cards

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella es cosmetóloga y desde hace 5 años abrió su salón de belleza, al cual se dedica con mucho esmero y trata a su clientela de la mejor manera, lo que le agrada sobre todo, es realizar peinados muy novedosos, llamativos y muy elegantes. Esta  actividad es muy rentable, ya que todos sus vecinos visitan constantemente su  salón de belleza, lo cual le permite generar ingresos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de instrumentos para su salón, como  planchadoras, rizadoras y secadoras, que le ayuden a agilizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old, and lives with her husband and two children. She is a cosmetologist and, five years ago, opened her own beauty salon. She dedicates herself to her business with great care, and she treats her customers very well. What she enjoys the most is creating hairstyles that are very innovative, attractive and elegant. This activity is very profitable as all her neighbors visit her salon constantly which allows her to generate income. This is her first loan with MFP. The funds requested will be invested into the purchase of instruments for her salon, such as flat irons, curlers and hairdryers which will help her carry out her work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Pin

texts.en:
Pin L., 39, is married and lives with five of her children and her husband in Prey Chor, Kampong Cham province. Since 2006, she has been selling various kinds of vegetables in a busy market to earn a living and is able to make US$ 4 a day, while her husband who is a police officer makes US$ 2 a day.

This couple also gets support from three of their children who work as garment factory workers. Mrs. Pin L. is asking a loan of US$ 800 to purchase rice for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase rice for re-sale

loans.name: Phou

texts.en: Phou M. is 47 years old and is a farmer living in the Prey Veng province with her husband and two children. Typically, she makes $1.50 per day while her husband makes about $7 working in construction. This couple also has received support from both their children, who work as construction workers. Phou M. is requesting a loan so that she can purchase a sewing machine for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó con varias señoras del comité Mujeres Activas del barrio 3 de mayo el cual se disolvió, ellas decidieron formar el nuevo comité Mujeres Solidarias. Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el 7º ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y esta integrado por 15 señoras, las mismas tienen diversas actividades.

La señora Alba Rosa T. de Romero se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de remeras, pantalones, blusas, baqueros y otros al por mayor para su posterior venta.

La señora Leonora A. de Caballero tiene una despensa en su casa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderias para el incremento de su negocio.

La señora Silvina Vera B. se dedica a la venta de helados  e invirtió el dinero en la compra de helados al por mayor para su venta posterior.

La señora Feliciana L. se dedica a la venta de bebidas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de gaseosas y cervezas para su venta posterior.

La señora Victorina M. es modista y tiene un taller de costura en su casa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para su taller.

La señora Mirna Raquel R. se dedica a la venta de comestibles e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los comestibles.

La señora Evelia S. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderias para surtir su negocio.

La señora Rosa Marilina C. es modista e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para el incremento de su taller de costura.

La señora Nilda Karina M. se dedica a la venta de helados e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos al por mayor para su venta posterior.

La señora Nitalicia V. se dedica a la venta de bebidas e invirtió su dinero en la compra de gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor para su posterior venta.

La señora Mercedes S. se dedica a la venta de helados e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos al por mayor para su venta posterior.

La señora Juana Bernal se dedica a la venta de mercería e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos para el incremento de sus negocio.

La señora Nancy Mabel Díaz realiza venta de  mercería e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos para el incremento de sus negocio.

La señora Antonia Pabla M. tiene una granja e invirtió el dinero en la compra de alimentos para sus animales.

La señora María S. Hermosilla se dedica a la venta de lencería y cosmeticos e invirtió el dinero en la compra mercaderias para la venta de los mismos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of a number of women from the Mujeres Activas group of the 3 de mayo neighbourhood, a committee which no longer exists. These women decided to create a new group Mujeres Solidarias. This group which is made up of 15 women who have a variety of businesses is now in its seventh loan cycle with the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras programme. Alba Rosa T. de Romero sells clothing and has invested her share of the loan in the bulk purchase of T-shirts, pants, blouses, jeans and other clothing. She will retail the clothing which she has purchased in bulk. Leonora A. de Caballero has a store in her home and invested her share of the loan in the purchase of merchandise to stock her business. Silvina Vera B. sells ice cream and invested her share in the bulk purchase of ice cream for later resale. Feliciana L. sells refreshments and invested her share of the lon in the purchase of soft drinks and beer for retail. Victorina M. is a dressmaker and has a workshop in her home. She invested her share of the loan in the purchase of materials for her workshop. Mirna Raquel R. sells food and bought ingredients to prepare meals. Evelia S. has a store and invested her share of the loan in the purchase of merchandise to stock her business. Rosa Marilina C. is a dressmaker and invested her share of the loan in the purchase of material for her workshop. Nilda Karina M. sells ice cream and invested her share in the wholesale purchase of goods to retail later. Nitalicia V. sells refreshments and invested her share of the loan in the wholesale purchase of soft drinks and beers to retail later. Mercedes S. sells ice cream and invested her share in the wholesale purchase of raw materials for later retailing. Juana Bernal sells merchandise. She invested her share of the loan in the purchase of goods to stock her business. Nancy Mabel Díaz sells merchandies and invested her share in the purchase of goods to stock her business. Antonia Pabla M. owns a farm and invested her loan in the purchase of feed for her livestock. María S. Hermosilla sells lingerie and cosmetics and invested her share of the loan in the purchase of merchandise to retail.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, jackets, busos, shirts, flour, rice, noodles, sugar, bakery, tea, milk, ice cream, soda, beer, yarn, fabrics, meat, discs for empanadas, vegetables, oil, napkins, shampoo, belts, handbags, lingerie, cosmetics, among others.

loans.name: Manantiales Group

texts.es: Las socias de  la banca comunal "Manantiales", están representados por la señora Sonia y presentan un parentesco familiar entre la señora Asunta y Sonia que son hermanas, pero tienen ingresos independientes una de la otra, todas residen en el mismo barrio la Urbanización Gallito y el Recreo, tienen diferentes negocios algunos ya establecidos y otros ambulantes como la venta de cosméticos, pan, tienda de abarrotes y venta de comida, el socio participante es chofer con movilidad propia, todos tienen un movimiento económico diario. En cuanto a la competencia se puede decir que ellas están conscientes de la misma y saben como hacerle frente, comentan  que la administración del crédito, favorece para mejorar su negocio y la calidad de vida de su familia. El crédito que se les otorgó esta destinado a surtir sus tiendas, para las promotoras aprovechar las ofertas  y el socio para participante para comprar repuestos para su movilidad. Efectivamente las socias comentan que ya tuvieron créditos anteriores  en otras entidades financieras similares a la fundación Agrocapital y a otras van cursando su segundo ciclo juntas por lo que cuentan con capacidad para ala administración de fondos así como la voluntad y honestidad para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The members of the "Manantiales" communal bank are represented by Sonia. They include relatives--Asunta and Sonia are sisters--but they each have independent incomes. They all live in the same neighborhood, Urbanización Gallito and Recreo. They have different businesses, some established and some mobile, like the sale of cosmetics, bread, groceries and food. One of the partners is a driver with his own vehicle, so all of them have economical daily transport. As for the competition, they are well aware of it and know how to face it. The credit helps improve their business and improve the quality of life for their families. This loan will be used to supply their stores, take advantage of sales, and for the driver to purchase spare parts. The partners have had previous loans in other financial institutions similar to Agrocapital, and some of them are now in their second cycle together, so they have abilities in the administration of funding, as well as volunteerism and honesty to meet their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Abdullochon

texts.ru: Абдуллочону 59 лет, женат и воспитывает  6 детей. Основной его работой является выращивание скота дома. Ему помогают его старшие дети и его жена.  Кроме крупнорогатого скота выращивает коз, шерсть которых весной стрижет и продает. От коров получает молоко, которое часть употребляет в семь, а излишки продает и на полученный доход покупает комбикорм. Абдуллочон подал заявку на займ, так как планирует отремонтировать крышу коровника и прикупить сено.
texts.en:
Abdullochon is 59 years years old, married, and has 6 children. Raising livestock at home is his primary employment, and his wife and son help as well. Beside cattle he also raises goats, whose wool he shears and sells in the spring. Milk from the cows is used partly by the family; the surplus is sold and the profit used to buy animal feed. Abdullochon applied for a loan to repair the roof of the dairy shed and buy hay.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair and hay purchase

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is 52-year-old married woman with six children living in Borj El Barajneh in Mount Lebanon. She started her tailoring business in 1990. Today she is requesting to borrow $1,000 in order to buy a new sewing machine to increase her sales.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: 40-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en: Tú N. Thị (89) is a 55-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Tú is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 040-Quảng Hưng (18.03.040). Tú is married and has an adult child. Tú raises cattle for sale and has been engaged in this business for over seven years earning approximately 1,500,000 VND a month. In 2008, Tú joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Tú has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,626,900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND which will also be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her third loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tú plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. N. Thị Minh (86) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business. 2. H. Thị Chiêu (84) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business. 3. P. Thị Huyền (88) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food. That is 'Nem chua', a popular food in Thanh Hoa. It is made of pork with some garlic and special vegetables. 4. P. Thị Tính (87) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Tú N. Thị (89) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Tú là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 40 Quảng Hưng (18.03.040). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Tú thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Tú kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND. Vào 2008, Tú đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Tú đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.626.900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. Thị Minh (86) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. H. Thị Chiêu (84) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. P. Thị Huyền (88) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán nem chua. 4. P. Thị Tính (87) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Neide

texts.es:
La Sra. Neide tiene 27 años.  Ella es madre soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres en San Lorenzo, donde queda con su hija de 3 años.

La Sra. Neide se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de desodorantes para auto hace 6 años. Sus ventas lo realiza en las estaciones de servicio de distintas ciudades.  Esta actividad lo aprendio en el colegio.
Este credito es para la compra de mayor cantidad de insumos a precios mas bajos para la fabricacion de sus productos.

Es una persona que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradece a la Fundaciòn Paraguaya por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Neide is 27 years old. She is a single mother who lives in her parents' home in San Lorenzo, where she stays with her three-year-old daughter. Neide has been manufacturing and selling car air-fresheners for six years. She sells them in service stations in various cities. She learned this activity in school. This loan is for the purchase of a greater quantity of inputs at lower prices to make her products. She is a person that has progressed very much in her life and thanks Fundación Paraguaya for all it has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase scents, rings and rivets

loans.name: Pacocsiguan Group

texts.es: Los Integrantes del grupo pacocsiguan son originario de la comunidad de Poxlajuj del departamento de Totonicapan ellas viene trabajando desde hace mas de diez años y la cual siguen unidas en el trabajo, durante este tiempo, ha realizado la crianza  de aves, cerdos, siembra de hortaliza, hace un año recibieron una capacitacion de tejidos manuales y la cual lo aprendieron  hoy necesita de un credito  y la cual necesita el apoyo de la asociación ya que en el sistema bancario no es posible por el monto y los requisitos con dicho credito sera invertido para la compra de los materiales para realizar la fajas, y cortes tipicos
texts.en:
The members of the Pacocsiguan group are from the Poxlajuj community in the Totonicapán department. They have worked together for over ten years, and they continue to be united in work. During this time they have raised birds, raised pigs, and planted vegetables. A year ago they received training in weaving by hand, and they learned how to make woven items. They now need a loan and support from the association. The sum of money and the requirements of the banking system make it impossible for them. The loan will be used to buy materials to make typical skirts and the belts used to wrap around the skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 60-year-old woman and she is married with ten children. Four are in school and others are currently working. She is living with her husband in a family house at Sefwi in the Western Region of Ghana. She is supportive, determined and, above all, is very hardworking though she is old.

Monica is a petty trader who trades in cereals like bags of maize, beans, millet, groundnuts (peanuts), etc. She takes delivery of stock from the Northern Region of Ghana. Her kids are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home. Selling of foodstuffs has enabled her to rent a store in the marketplace where she distributes to her customers.

Monica wants to use the loan to buys more bags of maize, millet, beans and groundnuts to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of maize, groundnuts, beans, etc.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina E., from the village of Clari, is 32 years old and the married mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Lina raises crops, her main source of income coming from the planting and harvesting of fruits and vegetables for sale. Lina has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2001, Lina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase fertilizers, she is now requesting a new loan, her thirteenth from PMPC, to invest in expanding the business. Lina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Fazil

texts.en: Fazil A. has been dedicated to the business of cattle ranching for the last 11 years. This business requires a lot of dedication because it demands a lot of effort to carry out the breeding. This is also true due to the fact that it requires the strict control of every one of the animals, while at the same time feeding and caring for those that are older. It is necessary to emphasize that through this business. Fazil is able to maintain his family. Now he applied for a 2000 USD loan. The credit will allow him to buy more animals, which he will raise and sell in the market. We believe in his clear vision and with him good luck.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito A. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Charito is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Charito operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling Ready To Wear clothing items and beauty products in the local community. Charito has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Charito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charito is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Charito from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and support the educational needs of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eliseo Ramon

texts.es: El señor Eliseo P. es un hombre trabajador desde joven ha tenido que ayudar  a sus padres ya que ha sido de familia humilde que ha tenido que trabajar desde pequeño, tiene 41 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene 4 hijos dos mayores que trabajan junto con el y los otros dos no estudian debido a falta económica se le hizo imposible poder mandar a clase a sus hijos pues ha sido un año difícil. Su negocio es la venta de chatarra, cobre, aluminio. Anteriormente trabajaba como técnico automotriz el cual compro una camioneta para acarreo y ahora que vende chatarra, pues sus deseos es poder hacerle una casa digna a su familia ya que la que viven esta casi por caerse pero ha sido difícil poder construirla ya que lo que gana lo invierte en los alimentos y en lo necesario para el trabajo. Pero no pierde la ilusión de lograr tener una casa segura de concreto es por eso quiere invertir mas en la compra de chatarra, cobre, y aluminio para obtener mejores ganancia y comenzar a construir que es los anhelado. Da las gracias Afodenic por el financiamiento ya que lograra invertir en su negocio lo cual traerá beneficios a su familia.
texts.en:
Eliseo P. is a hard-working man who, since he was young, has had to help his parents since they are from a humble family that has had to work from a young age. He is 41 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. His wife has four children: the two eldest work with him and the other two cannot go to school due to financial reasons. It has been impossible to send his children to class because it's been a difficult year. His business is selling scrap, copper and aluminu. Previously, he worked as an auto mechanic. He bought a truck for hauling and now he sells scrap. His wish is to be able to build a dignified home for his family since where they live now is at the point of falling apart. It has been difficult to build since what he earns he invests in food and the neceessities for his job. But he has not lost the dream of achieving a safe concrete house. It is for this reason that he wants to invest more in the purchase of scrap, copper and aluminum in order to obtain greater income and begin building what is desired. He is thankful to Afodenic for the loan since it allows him to invest in his business which in turn brings benefits to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase scrap, aluminum and copper.

loans.name: Julia Lily

texts.es:
En el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Julia P. posee su propio negocio de venta de productos de madera como mesas, planchadores, utensilios de cocina, entre otros.

La razón por la que ella espera en Ceprodel es porque requiere el crédito para la compra de los productos de madera para comercializarla y así continuar adelante llevando el sustento a su familia.

loans.use: Compra de productos de madera

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina J. is 40 years old and married to a policeman. She has five children, two of whom go to school. Justina is currently in the business of brewing and selling alcohol, and is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials, such as pipes, yeast, etc. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up a bar at the market and purchase crates of beer to sell.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more brewing materials, such as pipes, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana Margarita M. D. T. D. 49 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad con su esposo y su hijo. Ana se dedica a la venta D. ropa, negocio que inicio hace muchos años, tras la necesidad y dificultades económicas que se encontraba la familia, ya que el esposo D. Ana se encuentra jubilado por su avanzada edad, para Ana es vital seguir con sus ventas ya que son su única fuente D. ingresos, ella venD. D. manera ambulante, ofreciendo su ropa D. casa en casa D. diferentes colonias y departamentos. El crédito que solicita es para surtir su inventario, para estar lista en los siguientes semanas que sus ventas aumentaran por la época naviD.ña.
texts.en:
Ana Margarita M. D. T. is 49 years old and lives in the department of La Liberad with her husband and son. She has been selling clothing for many years and started her business out of necessity due to hardships her family has experienced. Ana’s husband is now retired because of his advanced age, so it is vital for her to continue making sales in order to generate an income. She works as a street vendor, traveling to different neighborhoods and districts offering her products house-to-house. Her loan will be used to purchase more inventory since she expects her sales to increase during the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Minaw

texts.fr: Cette femme est une veuve qui a à sa charge l’éducation scolaire de ses 05 enfants ; en 1990, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de céréales, de sucre, d’huile d’arachide et de divers autres produits. Ce commerce lui permet désormais de se prendre en charge et de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Elle vend ses produits en face du marché de Dabarakondji à Lomé. Elle accueille bien ses clients qui viennent en tout temps effectuer des achats chez elle. En ce moment elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 sacs de maïs, 05 sacs de haricot, 02 sacs de sucres, 03 sacs de farine et divers autres produits.
texts.en:
This woman is a widow who has the responsibility of educating her five children. In 1990, she embarked on commerce in grains, sugar, peanut oil, and various other products. This business now allows her to support herself and to provide for her children. She sells her products across from the Dabarakondji market in Lomé. She does a good job accommodating her customers, who come to her at any time to make their purchases. Right now, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 5 sacks of corn, 5 sacks of beans, 2 sacks of sugar, 3 sacks of flour, and a variety of other goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains, oil, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Fernando Joao

texts.pt:
Fernando João José nasceu na cidade de Chimoio, capital da Província de Manica, no centro de Moçambique, tem 50 anos de idade, viúvo e pai de 2 filhos de 14 e 16 anos de idade, ambos vão a escola. Fez 11ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Chimoio em 1977 para a formação militar, depois de terminar a carreira militar entrou no ministério do interior onde trabalha ate então e faz 8 horas por dia. Tem um salário mensal de 16.434.00mt que aplica nas despesas familiares e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.500.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (portas e janelas) para dar continuidade com a sua obra.

Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para poder iniciar uma actividade comercial para auxiliar nas despesas caseiras, para tal compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo sem problemas.
texts.en:
Fernando João José was born in the city of Chimoio, the capital of the province of Manica, which is in the center of Mozambique. He is 50, a widow, and the father of 2 children who are 14 and 16. Both of them go to school. He studied through 11th grade and didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his children and doesn't support anybody else. He left Chimoio in 1977 to complete his military service. After he finished his military career, he joined the Ministry of the Interior where he still works 8 hours a day. He has a monthly salary of 16,434 meticais, which he applies to his family's expenses and saves some in his bank account. He has never had a loan with another bank. He became familiar with Hluvuku through colleagues. This is his first loan in the amount of 10,500 meticais, which he will use to buy construction materials (doors and windows) to continue building his home. In the future, he would like to request more loans to be able to start a business to help with his home's expenses, so he promises to pay back this loan without any problems.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (doors, windows, etc.)

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben S., 26, is married and lives with her husband and two young children in Phnom Penh. She sells gas, ice and sugar cane juice and also works as a tailor. She is able to make about US$7 profit every day. Her husband provides a service washing motorbikes. On average, he makes US$3 per day. Ben S. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase more cloth so that she can expand her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth.

loans.name: Alexandrine

texts.fr: A. Alexandrine est née le 19 Octobre 1956 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Alexandrine vit depuis 11 ans à Allomey à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Alexandrine est mariée à ANATO Etienne, un militaire retraité. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés. Alexandrine vit  avec seulement deux des enfants. Alexandrine n'a fait que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux des enfants, Alexandrine vend depuis environs 11 ans de la nourriture ("atassi" : mélange de riz et de haricot ; et aussi de "l'akassa" : aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) à Allada. Alexandrine s'approvisionne également à Allada. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de l'institution. Tous les trois crédits ont été bien remboursés. Alexandrine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, dans le but d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande des clients.
texts.en:
A. Alexandrine was born on October 19, 1956 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Alexandrine has lived in Allomey, in Allada, in the Atlantique Department of Benin for 11 years. Alexandrine is married to Anato Etienne, a retired military serviceman. They have six children, all educated; two of them still live at home.
Alexandrine only has a primary school education. To provide for her needs and those of her chidlren, Alexandrine has sold food (atassi, a mix of rice and beans, and l’akassa, a local dish made with corn starch) in Allada for roughly 11 years. Alexandrine also gets her supplies in Allada.
She is a long-time Alidé client, having already received and repaid three loans. Alexandrine is requesting a fourth loan from Alidé in order to improve her business and to better respond to customer demands.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer
