loans.use: Buy 1 bag of flour, 2 bags of rice, 1 container of peanut oil and seasonings

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 25-year-old single man who helps his father support the household. He has owned an electric car repair shop in his town since 2006. Today, Ibrahim is asking for a loan of $1,200 to expand his business by buying new tools needed.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying new tools needed

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es viuda y se dedica al comercio de comida (Vivandera), tiene un puesto de venta.  Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la mantención de su familia; tiene 2 hijos y uno esta a su cargo con la  edad de 21 años. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Rio Seco Las Viviendas   de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de material de construcción (cemento, estuco) para la refacción de su vivienda para poder vivir mejor. 
 
Es su segundo crédito con Impro. El buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Teodora is a widow engaged in the business of selling food as a street vendor. She has a stall from which she sells. This business is her principal source of income with which she supports her family. She has two children. One, age 21, is in her care. Her home is located in the Rio Seco Las Viviendas zone of the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used for the purchase of construction material (cement and stucco) for the renovation of her dwelling so that she will be able to live better. This is her second loan with IMPRO. Her good conduct in making payments permits her to apply for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement and stucco for the renovation of her home.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora GUILLERMINA G. S., tiene 72 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo , departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES AL PROGRESO.
La empresaria es analfabeta, refiere que por falta de recursos económicos empezó a trabajar desde niña. La socia es casada  y tiene 4 hijos todos mayores e independientes. GULLERMINA se dedica a  la venta de productos alimenticios en la tienda de comestibles que tiene en su casa.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de productos alimenticios.
Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para la compra de mas productos alimenticios para abastecer su tienda como arroz, fideos, azúcar, menestras, etc.
Ella sueña con abastecer su tienda y tener todos los productos que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en:
Señora GUILLERMINA G. S.,72, lives in the district and province of Trujillo, La Libertad department, Peru. She belongs to the communal bank MUJERES AL PROGRESO. She is illiterate and has worked since a child because of economic necessity. She is married with 4 children, all grown and independent. Gullermina sells food products from the food shop in her home. Her first loan of $100 was used to buy food products. With this loan of $300 she will buy more food supplies, stocking her shop with rice, noodles, sugar, vegetable stew, etc. Her dream is to have a well-supplied shop with everything her clients need.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grocery stock

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel C. is from the village of Kinangay Norte. She is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns and operates a business offering transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport services. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2006, Raquel joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle so that she can offer a better service. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her existing vehicle

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina sells retail items such as pantyhose, stockings, and socks in one of the markets in her home town. She has been running this enterprise for 12 years. She has invested about 100,000 Grivnyas in this business.

Georgina is seeking a loan of 11,000 Grivnyas to offer a better selection of merchandise ranging from cheaper brands to more exclusive and quality ones. Georgina can be characterized as a stable and solvent borrower. She has repaid all her previous loans without any delinquencies. 

She is married with two children. Her family lives in Mukachevo in western Ukraine.

loans.use: To invest in offering a better selection of merchandise

loans.name: Sriyani

texts.en:
Sriyani is a 30-year-old married woman living in the town of Akurassa, in the Galle District of Sri Lanka, with her two sons and husband.

Sriyani has been managing her business by herself, which consists of cultivating a flower garden. She devotes her full effort towards cultivating her flower garden, step by step, and uses the income to help support her family.

Sriyani has managed her business for three years by herself. In her business she works hard and enjoys high quality land for flower growing and favorable weather in her region of Sri Lanka.

Sriyani has asked for a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to pay labor costs and to purchase chemicals to promote the fertility of her flower garden.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase chemicals and help pay labor costs

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia F.  una señora de 55 años que vive con su madre de 83 años en una comunidad de Costa Rica llamada Buena Vista de Rivas de Pérez Zeledón; está comunidad se destaca por estar ubicada en el Valle del General. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería, la agricultura, Turismo y  comercio estos últimos han crecido en gran manera brindando nuevas oportunidades de trabajo

Debido al desarrollo del turismo Rural  que ha tenido la zona de Perez Zeledon Doña Cecilia ha decido sacarle provecho a una hermosa Catarata que tiene en su finca, y crear un pequeño complejo  turístico alrededor de ella.

Doña Cecilia están segura  de que el proyecto será un éxito, ya que la Catarata es todo un atractivo turístico, para iniciar el proyecto ella necesita un préstamo de ¢666,000 
(seiscientos sesenta y seis mil colones) para la construcción de los estanques para la  cría  de trucha. Con el que espera que explotar de una manera sana e inteligente los recursos naturales de sus terrenos.

Ella   es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal VISTABAN S.A, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito, pero asegura que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito podrá tener éxito en su proyecto.
texts.en:
Cecilia F., 55, lives with her 83-year-old mother in a Costa Rican community called Buena Vista de Rivas de Pérez Zeledón. This community is located in the Valle del General, where the principle economic activities are cattle, agriculture, tourism, and commerce. Tourism has grown greatly, bringing new opportunities for work. Due to the growth of rural tourism in the area, Cecilia has decided to take advantage of a beautiful waterfall on her farm and create a tourist complex near it. She is sure the project will be a success as the waterfall is a tourist attraction. To begin the project, she will need a loan of 666,000 colons for the construction of tanks to raise trout. With this, she will use the natural resources of her land in a healthy and intelligent way. Cecilia is a member of the VISTABAN communal bank, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, but she is certain that, thanks to this type of organization that facilitates credit, her project will be a success.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of trout hatchery

loans.name: Kanha

texts.en: Mrs. Kanha C. is a 27 year old married woman.  She lives in Lieb village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Vuthea San, are farmers who own 4 hectares of land on which they cultivate rice. Mrs. Kanha C. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming operation. In addition to being a farmer, Mr. Vuthea San is a construction worker and also owns an agri machine to transport soil for selling. This couple has three children; two are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to study or work. The couple are pictured together.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean M. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old. Mary Jean is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jean owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling gold in the local community. Mary Jean has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Mary Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: MATERIALS TO REPAIR THE CHICKEN HOUSE (WOOD, NAILS, GLUE), AND  BUYING FEEDING-TROUGHS

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO  VIRGEN D. FATIMA

Este grupo esta conformado por tres señoras la representante del es Claudia Elizabeth Y.  D. 26 años, tiene 3 hijos   menores D. 10 años,  su negocio es una tienda  que se encuentra ubicada en la casa D. su mamá, su tienda la tiene desD. año y medio y fue con la  ayuda con su esposo que pudieron establecer este negocio, solicita este crédito para poder surtir su tienda con más productos   para poder ofrecer a sus clientes, ya que en la aldea en la que vive es pequeña y está alejado del pueblo. Doña Ana Paulina C.   es viuda y tiene  2 hijos pequeños,  ella se dedica a la venta D. tamales  3 veces por semana desD. hace dos años, ella venD. sus tamales en su casa y ya sus clientes la conocer y la buscan,  su gran sueño ahora sacar adelante a sus hijos y poder darles una vida digna, Berta Mariana Y. se dedica a la venta D. productos D. desechable en Ciudad Quetzal donD. alquila un pequeño local  tiene 6 hijos,   3 mayores D. edad  y 3 menores D. edad, su plan para este crédito es comprar  más productos ya que en la cercanía no hay tanta competencia por lo que es importante tener  variedad D. productos desechables que sus clientes le piden.  Estas mujeres han demostrado ser muy trabajadoras y que a pesar D. contratiempos que han tenido siguen adelante y tienen muchos planes que involucran el poder mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias y el hecho D. que KIVA les apoye con un crédito para poder lograr sus planes y sueños, es algo que ellas aprecian mucho
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three women, who are represented by Claudia, 26. She has three children under 10 years old. Her business is a store located in her mother’s house. She has had her store for a year and a half. With help from her husband she was able to establish her business. She is requesting a loan in order to stock her store with more products to offer her customers, since the village she lives in is small and far from town. Ana is widowed with two small children. She has sold tamales three times a week for two years. She sells tamales in her home and her customers already know her and seek her out. Her dream now is to raise her children and to give them a good life. Berta works selling disposable products in Ciudad Quetzal where she rents a small shop. She has six children, three adults and three children. Her plan for this loan is to buy more products since there isn’t that much competition in the vicinity so it is important to have a variety of disposable products that her customers ask for. These women have proven to be hard workers and in spite of setbacks have continued to move forward and have many plans that involve improving the quality if their families’ lives. The fact that Kiva supports them with microloans in achieving their plans and dreams is something that they greatly appreciate.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest More in Their Businesses

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro T. is from the village of Southwestern Pob. Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 39 years old. Alejandro is married and has five school-age children. To make a living, Alejandro owns and operates a specialized retail store in which he sells a variety of products such as shampoo, milk sachet, and powder soap for laundry in the local community. Alejandro has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Alejandro joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandro has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Alejandro is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Johanna Alexandra

texts.es: Johanna H. es una joven mujer que vive en el barrio la Reconquista de Bogotá, lugar de ubicación de  su taller de confecciones, donde  ella trabaja mediante el sistema de maquila, es decir recibe prendas cortadas previamente que ella ensambla, desde su casa donde tiene ubicada su maquinaria;   últimamente le han salido unos contratos directos para confeccionar la línea deportiva y de dotación  y por eso recurre a su credikiva pues quiere comprar la maquina collarína que le permite reducir los tiempos por operación de prendas. Este es justamente su primer crédito a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que conoció a través de su asesor de crédito y de personas que también tienen crédito y les ha ido muy bien; por ahora sigue pagando a destajo pero sueña con invertirle a su negocio, para que crezca y le genere la estabilidad económica con la que sueña y también que esta pueda generar empleos a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Johanna is a young woman who lives in the Reconquista de Bogota district where her garment workshop is located. She works under a "maquilla" (an assembly company) system. She receives pre-cut clothing to assemble from home where she has her machine. She has received some direct contracts to sew the sports and uniform lines lately. This is what prompted her request a loan from Kiva. She wants to purchase a collar sewing machine which will reduce the time it takes her to sew the clothing. This is her first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, organization she became familiar with through her loan advisor and people who have also requested loan and have been happy with it. For now she will continue to do piece work but she dreams of investing in her business for it to grow and generate the economic stability she longs for. She also wants to create jobs for the community.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a collar sewing machine

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Yin M. is 36 years of age and a married woman. In order to meet the needs of the family, Yin M. sells a little grocery inventory out of her home. She has eight years of experience in this sector and is earning approximately $5.33 per day. To help contribute to the family, her husband built a small workshop where he provides a vehicle washing service.

This couple has been married for years and they have three kids who attend school. Yin M.’s husband normally uses a machine for pumping water to clean up any vehicles but unfortunately, the machine is not processing well and it may need repairs. Because of that, Yin M. has asked for a loan to repair an old pumping machine.

loans.use: To repair an old pumping machine for the vehicle-washing business

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es: El señor Cristobal es un hombre muy trabajador, el se fue como muchos Mexicanos a Estados Unidos a trabajar y mandarle dinero a su esposa para el sustento de su familia, el señor Cristobal solicita este credito para reparar el techo de su casa,para que su familia este mas segura, ya que en la temporada de lluvias se daño mucho.
texts.en:
Cristóbal is a very hard working man. Like many Mexicans he went to the United States to work and send money to support his wife and children. Cristóbal is asking for this loan to repair his roof so that his family will be safer since it is damaged very much during the rainy season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For roof repair.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Mi Pequeño Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Mi Pequeño Esfuerzo está integrado por 3 socias (Ángela, Iris y Maria), las cuales residen en diferentes barrios del municipio de La Unión y realizan diferentes actividades económicas. La coordinadora del grupo es Ángela Margarita F., tiene 56 años, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de las siguientes edades 37, 28, 27 y 22 años. Ella es una persona luchadora,  que se levanta muy temprano todos los días desde hace 4 años para ir a trabajar a su puesto de verduras ubicado frente al parque central de la comunidad. Es una persona muy conocida y cuenta con buenas referencias de parte de sus clientes y compañeras de grupo. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera surtir de más y variadas verduras de la temporada. Su meta es mejorar el estilo de vida de ella y su familia. Su compañera de grupo Iris necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en su puesto de golosinas y María invertirlo en la compra un fardo de ropa de segunda mano y tener más y variados estilos que estén a la moda. Hace 5 años son clientes de FAMA y con los préstamos obtenidos han podido tener una fuente de ingresos que les permite llevar el sustento a sus hogares.
texts.en:
The village bank Mi Pequeño Esfuerzo (My Little Effort) is composed of 3 members (Ángela, Iris y Maria) who live in different neighborhoods in the city of La Unión and work at different trades. The coordinator of the group is Ángela Margarita F.. She is 56 years old, a single mother, and has four children who are 37, 28, 27, and 22 years old respectively. She is hard-working. She has risen very early every day for the past four years to go to work at her vegetable stall, which is located at the front of the central park of the community. She is well-known and has good references from her customers and the members of her village bank. With the help of this loan, she hopes to purchase a greater quantity and variety of seasonal vegetables. Her goal is to improve the standard of living of herself and her family. Her companion from the bank, Iris, needs this loan for investment in her stall, which sells sweets; and Maria will invest in a bundle of second-hand clothing and will have more clothing and varied styles that are currently popular. They have been customers of FAMA (local lending institution) for five years, and their previous loans have helped them obtain a source of income, which has permitted them to bring sustenance to their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de verduras

loans.name: Jenny Marisol

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne cada quince días  el Banco Comunal San José este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
La señora Jenny tiene 35 años de edad, está casada hace 20 años y tiene 4 hijos uno ya es mayor de edad y esta en la Universidad mientras que los menores aun están en colegio, lo que para la socia y  su esposo que es chofer de transporte particular es una carga muy pesada.

Es así como hace unos años atrás decidió entrar en la venta de productos de AVON (productos de belleza, perfumería y bisutería),  todos los días en las tardes ofrece  sus productos,  los hace por pedidos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días lo cual aprovecha para ofrecer otra vez sus productos.
 
Ahora ha decidido dedicarse a la cría de chanchos, esta es la razón por lo que solicito este crédito ya que quiere compra chanchos pequeños para criarlos por un tiempo hasta que tengan un peso razonable y luego venderlos.

Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio, es socia fundadora y siempre le ha gustado por las charlas que le ayudan mucho en su vida diaria.
 
Sus metas son que sus hijos sean profesionales y salir  adelante en sus negocios.
texts.en:
In Manabí province we find the 24 de Mayo canton [subdivision].  It is here that the San José Communal Bank meets every fifteen days.  The canton is known for its beautiful landscapes and hard working people, dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry.

Jenny is 35 years old and has been married for 20 years.  She has four children, one is an adult in university.  The younger children are still in high school, which is a heavy burden on Jenny and her husband, who is a driver transporting private goods.  This is why a few years ago she decided to sell AVON products (beauty products, perfume and miscellaneous items).  Every evening she advertises her products and takes orders.  She accepts credit and charges every fifteen days, during which she takes the opportunity to again showcase her products.   

Now she has decided to dedicate herself to raising pigs, which is why she wants this loan.  She wants to buy small pigs to raise until they reach a reasonable weight, then she will sell them.

Jenny has been in San José Communal Bank since the beginning, she is a founding member and has always liked the chats that help her a lot in her daily life.  Her goals are that her children become professionals and that she comes out ahead in her businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of small pigs for sale.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie G. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. She is 41 years old. Gerlie is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Gerlie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Gerlie has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gerlie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Gerlie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Gerlie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the communal bank "Santiago the Patron Saint," located in the district of Santiago de Pupuja, the province of Azángaro and the department of Puno. She is 46 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are independent. She studied until the fourth year of her secondary education.

Lorenza has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. The first loan she got was for 300 Peru Nuevos Soles (PEN), and she used the money to increase the capital of her business selling meat and yogurt. 

She is now asking for a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be used to buy merchandise for her business selling meat, yogurt and cheese. 

Her dream is to have better machinery to be able to make dairy products and to have more capital to be able to bring meat to the mines. 

Her favorite things about working with the communal bank are the loan terms, the punctuality and the responsibility.

loans.use: Merchandise for her business selling meat, yogurt and cheese

loans.name: Fall

texts.en:
As fish is the main fresh food to everyone in Mrs. Fall S. F. family, they depend on fishing and fish selling. Her main income depends on selling fish at the local market. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or that she buys from her wholesale supplier. Mrs. Fall S. F. is a humble mother who has been blessed with six children, five of whom are single, and the other one is married. 

Mrs. Fall S. F. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time when engaging in her business activities. As a result of the increasing needs of her clients, Mrs. Fall S. F. is applying for a loan so she can purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 30 years old. He is married to Judy Kipkiton and he has two children who are 6 and 2 years old. He runs a hotel and a carpentry workshop, and also has rental houses. He has been in business for two years and his monthly income from the business is Kshs 10,000.

He is borrowing a loan of Kenya shillings 27,000 as his second loan to renovate his rental houses. He will use the anticipated income from the business to build more rental houses. 

Stephen dreams of buying more land that he will develop into commercial buildings as an investment for his family.

loans.use: Renovate rental houses

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20211020054) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ngô Nội 02 (2).

H. is married and has 2 adult-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns and operates a furniture making business venture in the manufacturing sector.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị Nghị (0) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


4.  Đặng Thị N. (0) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Nguyễn Thị (20211020054) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm H. trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính T. của nhóm vay này là Ngô Nội 02 (2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương T. tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (0) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị Nghị (0) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  Đặng Thị N. (0) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Rosegene

texts.en:
Rosegene N. is from the village of Sta. Isabel Sur. She is 29 years old. Rosegene is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Rosegene raises and sells pigs. Rosegene has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP for each animal.

In 2008, Rosegene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosegene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. Rosegene is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Rosegene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase young livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro, tiene 30 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Se dedica a la elaboración de juegos artificiales, pirotécnicos.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos químicos para la preparación de juegos artificiales. Hermelinda, trabaja junto con su esposo, está en Finca desde hace varios años, le gusta porque se practican los valores, reciben charlas sobre la familia, matrimonio, manejo del ahorro y créditos.    
Su sueño es poder ahorrar para construir su casa y que sus hijos puedan estudiar y ser profesionales.
texts.en: Herlinda is a member of the Futuro ["Future"] Community Bank. She is 30, lives with her partner and has 3 children. She makes fireworks. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of chemical supplies for making fireworks. Hermelinda works with her husband. She has been a member of Finca for several years, and she likes it because they promote values and have talks about families, marriage, and savings and credit management. Her dream is to be able to save up to build her house, and for her children to be able to study and be professionals.

loans.use: the purchase of chemical supplies

loans.name: Mary Jelagat

texts.en:
Mary Jelagat S. is a single mother of four children. They live in Tuiyo in the outskirts of Eldoret. She buys and sells maize around the same area. She has been in this business for two years now and she gets a monthly income of 5,000 shillings.

This will be Mary's first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the entire loan to buy maize stock and, with the income that she will get, she plans to diversify her business to poultry keeping. 


In the future, she would like to grow her own maize rather than buying and selling and to educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock like maize for resale

loans.name: Florienne

texts.en:
Florienne is 45 years old and is married with 2 children aged 14 and 18.  She also cares for 2 dependents who are 12 and 13 years old.  Florienne started her banana-selling business because she knew it would be profitable.  She now employs one other person and has been in operation for 3 years.  The shop is open from 6am until 9pm.

Florienne will use her loan to purchase more yellow bananas.  She plans to use the money she makes for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more yellow bananas to sell

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda de 33 años, es una madre de familia de 2 hijos que vive en compañía de ellos en su casa propia. Hace más de 8 años decidió emprender su propio negocio, es así que decidió vender carne, queso y animales menores que trae de su pueblo natal a la ciudad donde actualmente radica. Viaja constantemente a su pueblo para suministrarse de mercadería y que luego son llevados a la ciudad. Sus ventas son al contado lo que garantiza su ganancia. En ocasiones  recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero la mayor parte del tiempo es ella quien lo realiza, pues le agrada trabajar ya que su fin es cubrir la múltiples necesidades de su familia; por ello se ha propuesto incrementar su capital de trabajo para tener más ganancias. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar más mercadería en quesos y también comprará carneros para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Herlinda, 33, is a mother of two children living with them in her own house.  Over 8 years ago she decided to go into business for herself.  She decided to sell meat, cheese and small farm animals that she brings from the town of her birth to the city where she currently lives.  She travels constantly to her town to stock up on merchandise to take to the city later.  Her sales are cash which guarantees profits.  Sometimes her children help her but most of the time she does all the work by herself because she enjoys working since her goal is to meet her family’s multiple needs.  Because of this she has proposed to increase her working capital in order to have more profits.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support since she’s always been responsible with her payments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.  She thanks all those people who will fund the loan she’s requesting that will be so useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the loan to buy cheese and will also buy sheep to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy cheese and sheep.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 47 years old and is married with three children who are between 10 and 22 years old. Beatrice makes her living by sewing different styles of clothes.  She has been in business for one year.. She operates her business from 8am until 6h30pm every day. 

Beatrice is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. to purchase two sewing machines and some clothing items. Thus, she will create two jobs for the people in her community.

By expanding her business and adding more equipment and workers, Beatrice will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow her to create other areas of the same business. In addition, she and her family will be able to get their own shelter.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and cloth.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine I. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Josephine is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, breads, candies, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. She also buys and sells rice per kilogram, generic drugs, and multivitamins. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase an additional sack of rice and a variety of junk foods for her store. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional sack of rice and a variety of junk foods

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Teresa, tiene 40 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque el banco es una gran ayuda ya que con los créditos personas como ella pueden ganarse la vida de una forma honesta.

Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la casa de sus padres, allí además de vender productos  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, también vende helados, sodas, y ciertas medicinas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00, los productos para surtir su negocio los compra en  Montecristi y Manta  pero la mayoría los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva en su negocio ya por 18 años.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad.
 
Su meta es tener un carro en el futuro.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles (The Three Angels Communal Bank) meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place renowned for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its arts and crafts, celebrated both at national and international level. It is also the homeland of the famous Toquilla straw hats.

Here is where we meet Teresa, aged 40, who is single and lives in her parents’ house. She has been a member of the Communal Bank since the beginning, and she likes it because the bank is of great help to her as, thanks to the loans, people like her can earn a living in an honest way.

She runs a grocery store in her parents’ house where, on top of selling products such as rice, sugar, oils and detergents, she also sells ice-creams, fizzy drinks and some medicines. She works every day form 6 a to 10 pm, and to supply he shop she buys some of the products in Montecristi and in Manta, even though the majority are delivered to her shop. She told us she has been running her shop for 18 years.

She will use the loan she is requesting to purchase more supplies for her shop. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other basic necessities.

She wishes to own a car in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other products to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
The name says it all… “Que Rico!”

Flor has always been a wiz in the kitchen. When her husband lost his job she decided it was time to take her Puerto Rican culinary skills to the streets with her own food cart. She splits her time between the food cart and her office job, with her husband filling in on days she is in the office. They are both convinced of their ability to turn this food cart into a thriving business after their success on Miami’s Carnival de Calle 8. 

With her loan from ACCION USA, Flor will be buying flyers to help promote her food cart. She will also be buying more inventory so that the cart can operate for longer periods during the day. 

This is just the beginning of “Que Rico”! Flor ultimately wants to be able to purchase a food truck. And, like she says, once people try her food they think better access to her Puerto Rican food is a great idea!

loans.use: to create flyers for the business and purchase inventory.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a resident of the Kitale area in Western Kenya, aged 61 and married with five children all adults save for the last-born. She has been doing  mixed farming for  over 30 years with her produce of milk, maize and beans going to the local market.

Annah has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry for her farm. She says she wants to rear both broilers and layers at the same time to ensure consistent production. She says the income will go into meeting other family needs like food.

Annah says poultry diseases are their greatest worry in the business.

loans.use: To pay for more poultry.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en: Sera is married and has two children. For the past two years, Sera has operated a cafe business, cooking beans, rice, and flat breads. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Sera faces a major challenge of competition from other cafe operators in the area. Sera is requesting a loan for 35,000 KES, which she will use to purchase food stock, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cereals. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. The family owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

loans.use: To purchase food stock, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour. and cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with one parent and one sibling. She has owned a shoes and bags shop in her town since 2004. She only sells women's shoes and bags. She always tries to offer the new trends and collections to her customers. She is well known in her town and neighboring villages and she is thankful for her business income, which allows her to satisfy her family needs. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products to sell. In the future, she is planning to open a new branch.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 55 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Sari-Sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like sardines, sugar, coffee, groceries, etc. to sell.

Dominga has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Sari-Sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from salted cashews and peanuts.

Dominga aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business selling cosmetics and growing guava

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Eusebio tiene 53 años de edad, natural de la comunidad de Palmapampa anexo del distrito San Miguel, convive con Tomasa de 48 años, y fruto de es relación tienen 06 hijos por quienes vela por brindarle una buena educación. Eusebio es un hombre sacrificado, se esmera por dar lo mejor a su familia por lo cual trabaja arduamente sus tierras, en donde siembra cacao, café y plátanos, en total cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno. Tiene ya 22 años de experiencia trabajando en el campo, sin embargo cuando es temporada de cosecha, el trabajo es muy más arduo, por eso cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de los jornaleros que contrata, para que se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los productos recolectados hasta cierto tramo para luego ser transportados con animales de carga a los centros de venta. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo, porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas tiene un buen desarrollo, y eso le va a favorecer en la cosecha y por ende en las ganancias. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo  para poder cumplir sus objetivos y por lo cual se siente comprometido por cumplir con el pago de su crédirtos puntualmente. Con el crédito solicitado comprará estiércol de animales y sacos de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus tierras y con el tiempo volverlas productivas.
texts.en: Eusebio is 53 years old and is from the community of Palmapampa, which is part of the district of San Miguel. He lives with Tomasa who is 48 years old.  They have six children together whom they want to provide with a good education. Eusebio is a man who has made many sacrifices. He strives to give the best to his family. He works hard on the land growing cocoa, coffee and plantains. He has four hectares of land. He has been farming for the past 22 years. At harvest time the work is very hard. He is glad to have the help of his children and day laborers that he hires. At this time of year he has to harvest the crops and also take them to a certain place where they are transported by animals to the marketplace. He feels very committed to his work, because, thanks to his day-to-day work, today he sees that his plants are doing well. This means he will have a good harvest and good earnings. This is his second loan with MFP. He would like this small loan in order to complete his objectives. He promises to pay his loan on time. With the loan that he is requesting he will buy cow manure and sacks of organic fertilizer in order to fertilize his land and have it continue to be productive.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, 39 years old and married to Nelious, is the father of a seven-year-old. Wilson has been in the spare parts business for three years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Having repaid his previous loan, he is now requesting a second loan from KADET to add a stock of spare parts to his shop. With the anticipated extra profits, Wilson will expand his business. His dream is to own a big wholesale shop for spare parts which will help him improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to add a stock of spare parts to his shop.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 55 years old. She is married and and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband. They run a store in front of their house to sell a range of basic goods, foods, beverages and milk. 

Lien started her business in 2000 in order to generate a stable daily income for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity and range of products such as confectionaries, milk and beverages for her business. She hopes that through the loan, her business will be able to attract more customers and generate a higher income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy confectionaries, milk and beverages as stock for her general store

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Marilou has operated a shop selling fish such as sardines and mackerel for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fish to sell. Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 49 years old and married with 3 children. Alberta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (variety store) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, groceries, etc to sell in her sari-sari store.

Alberta has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 6 years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Alberta aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additionals stocks to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok, 28 years old, is buying a cow to resell. She earns $4 per day. Her husband is a blacksmith who earns $4 per day. They have two children who are six and two years old. Every month she has to spend $33 on food, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a cow to resell. She doesn’t want to change her career because she can make a good profit from this business, and she plans to buy more cows to sell when she has more money. For her children, she wants to send them to study at the university.

loans.use: To buy a cow to resell

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a shoe business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Halima dreams of establishing a stall to sell her products in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: El Sr. Héctor  es una persona  muy trabajadora  y  responsable,  que   día  con día   a luchado  por  acondicionar  su  vivienda  para  poder   brindarle  a su  familia   un  espacio  cómodo  donde  puedan  vivir,  en  este  momento  el  requiere  colocar   vitropiso  en  su  vivienda ya  que  con el que cuenta actualmente  esta  muy  deteriorado, es  por  ello  que   acudió  con  nosotros  para  que lo apoyemos  en la realización de  su proyecto,  agradece  el apoyo   brindado  para    hacer   de  su sueño realidad.
texts.en: Héctor is a very hardworking, responsible person who struggles daily to be able to furnish his house and provide his family with a comfortable place to live.  At the moment he needs to install ceramic tile flooring because the current floor in his house is in poor condition.  He, therefore, called upon us for support to carry out his project.  He’s grateful for the support provided to make his dream a reality.

loans.use: to install ceramic tile flooring.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Vilma: es soltera y la socia sigue teniendo su tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productros de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,el socio trabja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Vilma is single and continues running her grocery store.  She sells basic staples like rice, sugar, milk and cookies.  She works from 8am until 7pm and is able to get ahead thanks to this business.  She wants to expand the grocery store.  She’s happy for the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store at wholesale.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 32 years old, married with three children, and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Juvy owns and operates a business project in the agricultural sector raising domestic animals, like pigs. She sells her raised pigs to her buyer to earn a living. In consequence, Juvy attains a quality income. She earns 1,800 PHP every month doing this type of work.

Juvy has been in this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pigs for fast growth and better nourishment. Juvy has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. Juvy's future plans are to be able to support the education of her children until they finish their college degrees and to make her business flourish.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs for fast growth

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Thoeun (in the photo) is 49 years old and his wife, Sam ol is 42 years old. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have six children--two sons and four daughters. Three of his children attend school. Two are in high school, one is in a university, one is a hair dresser, and the others are still young.
 
Thoeun and his wife are farmers and they also raise pigs at home. He is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his son, who is in the university, to get to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his son to get to school.

loans.name: Khurshedjon

texts.ru: Хуршедджон занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он выращивает овощи и  продает на местном рынке. Ему в бизнесе помогает жена и брат. Они вместе дружно работают. Каждый имеет свои обязанности. Хуршедджон хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль на улучшение семейных условий. Хуршедджон запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов для переработки земли.
texts.en: Khurshedjon works in agriculture. He grows vegetables and sells them at the local market. His wife and brother help him in this business. They work together amicably; each has their own responsibilities. Khurshedjon wants to expand his business and make good profit in order to improve his family's livelihood. He is applying for a loan in order to purchase mineral fertilizers and pesticides for his plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fetilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Maria Ramona

texts.es:
María, 37 años de edad originaria de Granada, madre de tres hijos, casada, habita en la ciudad de Granada, de oficio comerciante. Ella le gusta ser muy emprendedora, dinámica y proactiva en los negocios ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos, chinelas alquila video juegos de Play Station. Empezó poniendo el negocio de Play Station en casa pues notaba que la mayoría de los jóvenes en su barrio le llamaba la atención este tipo de recreación su esposo la apoyo  desde un inicio , su esposo se dedica a vender  chinela y zapatos en el mercado de la ciudad . 
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar chinelas y zapatos que parte de la mercadería que mas vende pues son de mucho uso en la población que no tienen acceso a otro tipo calidad de zapato. Por lo pronto uno de sus planes es reforzar su tramo para guardar y mantener su mercadería más segura.
texts.en:
Maria is a 37 year old married woman, who is originally from Granada, and has three children. She lives in Granada and is a business woman. She likes to be very entrepreneurial, dynamic and proactive in business.  She makes a living selling shoes and slippers as well as renting Play Station video games. She started her Play Station video game rental business since she noticed that most young people in her neighborhood were attracted to this form of entertainment.  Her husband supported her from the beginning. 

Her husband sells slippers and shoes in the city market. She is requesting this loan so she can  buy slippers and shoes, which are the items that she sells the most,  since these type of shoes are widely used by people that do not have the means  to buy better quality footwear. In the meantime, one of her plans is to reinforce her business location security to keep her merchandise  more secured.

loans.use: to buy slippers and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Firuzjon

texts.ru: Фирузджон родился 08 декабря 1989 году. Он очень умный и целеустремленный юноша. После успешного окончания школы поступил в Технологический Университет, где учится на отличные оценки. По специальности финансы и кредит. Он  во всех мероприятиях университета принимает активное участие. В свободное время увлекается футболом. Фирузджон запрашивает займ для оплаты обучения университета. Он  благодарен вам за вашу поддержку и доброту. Он очень надеется на вашей поддержке его в получении образования.
texts.en: Firuzjon was born on December 8, 1989.  He is a very smart and goal-oriented young man.    After successfully finishing school, he entered Technological University, where he earns excellent grades.  His specialization is in finance and credit. He takes an active part in all the university's events.  In his free time he plays soccer. Firuzjon is requesting a loan to pay his tuition at the university.  He is grateful for your support and kindness.  He is greatly relying on your support to receive his education.

loans.use: To pay for his education

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Juana  Antonia   se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos desde hace dos años, ellas nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es  cocinar ya que tiene un buen sazón.
Tiene la cantidad de tres hijos quienes la ayudan a comprar  lo que necesita  para  preparar la comida.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar :chile,cebolla,acite,ajo jitomate, pechuga  de pollo y verdura.
Le da las gracias a dios por todo y por la ayuda de fundación.
texts.en:
Juana Antonia has sold Mexican snacks for some 2 years now. She says that what she likes most about her business is to cook, since her dishes have such good flavor.

Juana Antonia has 3 children who help her buy what she needs to prepare the food. She is requesting a loan to buy chiles, onions, cooking oil, garlic, jitomates, chicken breast, and vegetables.

Juana Antonia gives thanks to God for everything as well as for the aid of the Foundation.

loans.use: buy food supplies for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en: Felistus is 38 years old, single, and has one child. She owns a general shop, which has been in business for two years. She describes her business environment as busy due to many customers who visit her daily. She also describes herself as hardworking. She hopes to expand her business to wholesale in the future. She has applied for 20,000 KES to buy six bundles of maize flour, one sack of sugar, and beans.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar, and beans for resale

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Abeer prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Abeer is a 35-year-old married woman who has four family members. She is from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She wants to buy a new refrigerator and some of households. 

In the future, she would like to improve her family’s socio-economic status.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en:
My name is Guillermina, I sell Jafra cosmetics from door to door through a catalog. I am 63 years old and for the last 30 years I have done multiple activities to earn income such as: rent rooms and buy a taxi and hire someone to drive it, I also rent a truck for a Mexican TV talk show called Laura Bozzo. My slogan is: "Beauty comes first"My biggest accomplishments has been being able to buy a house, a taxi, a truck but most important is sending my kids to college.  

I want the loan to pay some loans from a pawn shop, get back my jewelry and stop paying extremely high interest rates. 

I am a persistent woman and always pay my loans.

loans.use: to get her jewelry back from a pawn shop and pay lower interest rates

loans.name: Minata's Group

texts.fr: Minata qui se trouve sur la photo s’arretant à droite, est membre d’un groupe de 10 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Diensobala au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Minata, âgée de 52 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants âgés de 12 à 28 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Minata à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 45 ans. Minata cultive l'aracide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et de main d'œuvre. Minata entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison des formations et techniques agricoles et de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro, ainsi que de l'image positive de myAgro dans les villages avoisinants. Cette année Minata effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Minata cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Minata planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage, cultiver plus  d’arachide, riz et d'étendre la surface cultivée . Enfin Minata espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Minata, who is standing on the right in the photo, is a member of a group of 10 farmers who are members of myAgro, living and working in the village of Diensobala in the southeast of Bamako, Mali. 

Minata, aged 52, is the mother of eight children aged 12 to 28, of whom two are presently in school. The family tradition is centered around agriculture, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency for the household, and also of Minata's family, which has moved Minata to do this activity for 45 years now. 

Minata grows peanuts and rice on her plot, but as a farmer she has to face such difficulties as lack of rain, of agricultural tools, and of laborers. 

Minata is beginning her first year with myAgro and she joined because of the training and agricultural techniques and with the perspective of increasing her harvests  through the services proposed by myAgro, and also the positive image of myAgro in the neighboring villages. 

This year Minata is making the payments to buy a myAgro package of openly pollinated seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts so as to increase her harvest on her plot of 0.0625 hectares. Minata has been growing peanuts for 20 years for their nutritive value. She explains that peanuts can be eaten directly by the family, are used as a base for sauces in cooking, and are also a money-earning crop when sold. 

Minata plans to increase her output and her income so that she can raise livestock, grow more peanuts and rice, and expand her cultivated surface. Ultimately, Minata also wishes to pay school fees for the children as well as ensuring food self-sufficiency for her family.

loans.use: to acquire a package of OPV (openly pollinated) seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts so as to increase the agricultural productivity of her land productivité agricole de sa parcelle

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth sells clothes in a local market for tourists in Guayaquil. Her husband works in the tile industry for a large company but his wage is very low. They have three children but one of them is mentally handicapped and therefore requires more of a financial and time commitment from his parents. Janeth has been a sales woman in this market since she was 20 years old when she began selling at the market named “Bahia” with her sister. She specializes in selling women’s clothing but it is very difficult for her because she only has $50 in working capital. Her busiest days are on the weekends in the market and during the week she tries to sell to locals in her neighborhood. She is seeking the loan in order to buy more clothing in bulk.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy women's clothing at larger quantities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rhoda would like to buy household goods for her shop

loans.name: Zulema Margarita

texts.en:
Zulema is married and has two small children ages 2 and 5. Her husband's salary didn't meet the needs of her growing family so two years ago she began selling hamburgers on the weekends. Later, her mother-in-law asked her to help make and sell tamales. She has now set up on her own and is growing her business little by little, driven on by her love for her family. To meet demand for her tamales, Zulema needs a loan for $375 to buy ingredients. To serve her customers well and grow her business, Zulema would very much appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Zulema es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos de 2 y 5 años de edad. Hace dos años al ver que los gastos familiares se incrementaban y que el salario de su esposo no alcanzaba a cubrirlos, decidió iniciar con la venta de hamburguesas los fines de semana, después tuvo la invitación de su suegra a ayudarle en la elaboración y venta de tamales, actualmente decidió independizarse y cuenta con numerosos pedidos de tamales, poco a poco ha visto crecer su negocio y el amor hacia su familia la han incentivado a esforzarse cada día más.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de los productos que Zulema elabora, ella requiere de un préstamo por $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración de los tamales. Para poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y hacer crecer su negocio, Zulema necesita de tu ayuda, ella y agradece tu generosidad y cariño.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea has been married for 7 years and has 2 children, a son and a daughter. She runs a grocery store at home. Her husband Mr. Sou Thoeurn sells ice from village to village with his father's small truck. He has been selling ice for more than 6 years. He plans on buying a small truck with the money he has saved and the loan he receives from MAXIMA. In addition, his family has a small machine for grinding rice. 

With the requested loan amount of $700 Sothea intends on purchasing ice, grocery, rice grains for grinding and a small truck. Their family's standard of living is getting better and they will not have a problem repaying the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing ice, grocery items  rice grains and a small truck.

loans.name: Kuruthum

texts.en:
Kuruthum is a 51-year-old strong and energetic mother of 3 and a resident of the Buguruni area, a Dar Es Salaam city suburb.

Her business is one of the most challenging and time-consuming in Dar Es Salaam, a city with an unplanned solid waste management system. She collects solid waste from the households and takes it to the collection center before the car that collects for the city council comes for it. The waste from the household is packed in plastic or polythene bags and she picks them up for a fee depending on the weight.

She has employed three people in her business, and she wants to open up more collection centers and employ more people, because solid waste is increasing. She is currently in need of USD 550 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Open up more collection centers

loans.name: Gregoria Daysi

texts.es:
This woman works selling soft drinks, juice and sweets in the León bus station market. She has run this business for more than 30 years, first from the sidewalk outside San Juan church. Fifteen years ago, she moved to the new location (also on the sidewalk) where she could have better sales.

It has been very difficult for her to expand her business, progress has been slow due to her family which depends on her. She has 7 children, the 3 youngest still live at home. She began by selling sweets from a small crate and then successfully added juice and soft drink sales. She is married, and her husband is a security guard. He helps with the family expenses, but his income is low. She has been working with CEPRODEL for more than 3 years.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Esta señora posee un pequeño puesto de ventas de gaseosas, jugos y golosinas ubicado en el mercado de la terminal de buses de la ciudad de León. El negocio tiene más de 30 años de existencia ya que originalmente el negocio inicia en las aceras de la Iglesia San Juan, pero luego se traslada a este espacio (que también es en la acera) en donde hay una mayor afluencia de compradores, desde hace mas de 15 años.

A esta señora se le ha dificultado mucho el poder hacer crecer su negocio, su desarrollo ha sido más lento debido en buena medida a la pesada carga familiar que posee, con 7 hijos en total, de los cuales aún tiene 3 menores a su cargo. Ella inicia con la venta de golosinas y un pequeño canasto y posteriormente agrega la venta de jugos y gaseosas, con buenos resultados. Ella es casada, su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad y aunque él le ayuda con los gastos de la casa su sueldo es muy bajo. Tiene más de 3 años de trabajar con CEPRODEL.

loans.use:
Purchase of merchandise to increase inventory

Compra de mercaderia para hacer crecer inventario

loans.name: Kamin Agha

texts.en: Kamin Agha lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single, and he lives with his family. He is the only one who helps his family. He has a cosmetics shop, and he has been working in this business for more than 5 years. He wants to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new kinds of cosmetics materials. He wants to buy products especially for the young generation to attract more clients and make a good income to help his family. He is happy, and he would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy new kinds of cosmetics materials

loans.name: Petrona Del  Carmen

texts.es:
For the past 15 years, Mrs. Petrona has worked selling fruit and vegetables. She started with a capital of $200, from her previous job being terminated.

With the hope of making progress little by little in her business, she requests loans from CEPRODEL, which offers her a helping hand and supports her unconditionally. In this way, she has developed her business, offering her products at a better price and in consequence increasing her income.

The continual work of Mrs. Petrona allows her to support her children. Her greatest dream is that they go to college and achieve a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Petrona se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 15 años inicia con un capital inicial de $200, producto de su indemnización al quedarse sin empleo.

Con la esperanza de ir progresando poco a poco en su negocio solicita prestamos a CEPRODEL quien le extiende su mano amiga y le ayuda incondicionalmente ha logrado el desarrollo de su negocio , ofrece a un mejor precio sus productos y con ello obtiene un poco mas de ingresos.

El trabajo continuo de la Sra. Petrona le permiten el sustento de sus hijos y el que coronen una carrera universitaria es su mayor sueño y que logren mejorar su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (En compra  de  mercadería)

loans.name: Marvin Francisco

texts.es:
Before selling groceries and accessories, Marvin L. dedicated himself only to his studies. However, because of his family’s financial needs, he chose to look for a way to gain employment. Upon not being able to find a job, he decided to invest what little savings he had in purchasing merchandise to put up for sale.

During these difficult economic circumstances, he established his business in his own dilapidated house in the city of León. Nevertheless, Marvin has been investing in his business space over the years.

For two years, Marvin has obtained several loans from Ceprodel in order to improve his business space and to purchase accessories. These loans have greatly benefited him, and he says that with the help of Ceprodel, he will be able to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur in the jewelry market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Marvin L. antes de tener su negocio de venta de bisuterías y viveres, solamente se dedicaba a estudiar, pero por la necesidad económica que atraviesa en su familia, decide buscar la manera de obtener un empleo, pero al no encontrarlo decide invertir sus pocos ahorros en la compra de los productos para la venta.
