En medio de difíciles circunstancias económicas, al inicio se establece en la ciudad de León en su propia casa de habitación en malas condiciones, sin embargo a medida que los años pasan invierte poco a poco en la infraestructura de su localidad.

Desde hace dos años atrás, Marvin ha obtenido créditos en Ceprodel para invertirlos en el mejoramiento de su local y también en la adquisición de las bisuterías. Estos créditos le han beneficiado grandemente y según comenta seguirá trabajando con Ceprodel para realizar su sueño de ser un gran comerciante en el mercado de las bisuterías.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and jewelry

loans.name: Wakaliga C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Gidah N.. She is currently in the business of running a dry cleaning and is requesting a loan to purchase more laundry machines. Gidah is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 5 children ranging from age 2.5 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Gidah makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the loan. Gidah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in order to buy clothes and add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Gidah is joined in her small group by Kato T., Sarah N., Aidha K., and Prossy N.. Kato T. has a business selling bananas and wants to expand the business. Sarah N. is currently operating a business selling used shoes and wants a loan to stock more shoes. Aidha K. operates a business of used clothing sales and wants to boost business. Prossy N. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal.

loans.use: To add capital to laundry business

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen started a business selling food 3 years ago because of the difficult economic situation she was going through. Her husband worked in construction, which was a seasonal job, and facing a lack of steady income and increasing expenses for her 3 little ones, she began selling food from her house so that she could give her children an education and a better quality of life.

The business prospered due to her efforts. Now she needs a loan of US $350, which will be repaid in 4 months, to invest in the purchase of supplies so she can offer variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Maria del Carmen inicio un negocio de venta de comida hace 3 años porque atravesaba por una difícil situación económica ya que su marido se dedica a la construcción siendo este un trabajo temporal, ante la carencia de un sueldo seguro y el incremento de los gastos de sus 3 pequeños fue que empezó a vender comidas en su casa para poder darle educación a sus hijos y así brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

Actualmente el negocio ha prosperado debido a su esfuerzo, requiere US $350 que pagara en 4 meses, dinero que invertirá en la compra de insumos para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase supplies.

loans.name: Sinisie Group

texts.en:
Kormaslaia is a village in the Koinadugu district of Sierra Leone where most of the country's vegetables are grown. Sinisi group members have been engaged in vegetable and other food production, but at a very small scale.

Sarah D. is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She is the group leader and a very active member of the community.

The group members would like to increase their productivity and are, therefore, requesting for a loan of Le.2, 500,000 ($875 USD) to purchase farm inputs and hire labour. The Sinisie group intends to use the loan to buy inputs and hire labourers that will help them to increase their production of vegetables.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and hire labourers to increase their production of vegetables

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina started her business by her own initiative out of enjoyment of the profession and economic necessity when she needed to contribute to the expenses of the house and education of the children and also for her own personal self-improvement. She began 10 years ago with the help of a friend who helped her by teaching her to manicure and cut and style hair. Later she became independent.

She needs a loan of $675, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy materials to make new hairstyles and a variety of dyes and cosmetic products (lipstick, blush, foundation, etc.)

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Guillermina inició el negocio por iniciativa propia ademas de gusto por esa profesion y necesidad economica ya que necesitaba contribuir con los gastos de la casa, educacion para los niños y ademas por superacion personal. Comenzó hace 10 años con el apoyo de una amiga que la ayudo a iniciarse enseñandole desde manicure hasta cortes y peinados y posteriormente se independizo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US$675 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material para hacer nuevos cortes de cabello, variedad de tintes y productos cosmeticos ( labial, rubor, maquillaje, etc.)

loans.use: To buy materials for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: Georges, 53 and married, works hard to guarantee a better life for his 2 children. Georges lives in the suburbs of Beirut. In view of the high cost of living, the low income afforded by Georges' small shop selling "manakish" (a traditional open-faced sandwich)  does not suffice for the requirements of his family. Therefore, he needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to help him to purchase a car to use as a taxi and ensure a second source of income. This is the first time that Georges is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: USD 1,200 to purchase a taxi car

loans.name: Afi Holali

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi Holali A. was born in Kamina, a small village in Togo, on June 20, 1980. She is married and the mother of two children. She currently lives in Lomé and sells health products. Since 2004 she has been involved with the American products GNLD. Seeing the profit in this product range, she stopped selling other products to specialize solely in the sale of GNLD products. In terms of marketing, she already has a clientele whom she supplies from her own home. She also makes sales by walking around, which means the products run out quickly. She would like to have a greater selection of products and for this she needs to increase her capital, hence the request for this first-time loan.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Afi Holali est née à Kamina, un petit village du TOGO le 20 juin 1980. Elle est mariée et est mère de deux enfants. Elle vit aujourd’hui à Lomé et revend les produits de santé. Depuis 2004, elle y associa les produits américains GNLD. Voyant la rentabilité de cette gamme de produit, elle abandonna la vente des autres produits et se spécialise uniquement dans la vente des produits GNLD. Pour la commercialisation elle disposait déjà d’une clientèle qui se ravitaille chez elle à la maison. De plus elle est ambulante ce qui fait que ses produits s’écoulent rapidement. Elle voudrait diversifier ses produits et pour cela elle a besoin d’augmenter son capital d’où la demA. de ce premier prêt.

loans.use: To buy GNLD health products

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor is a producer of cow's milk. He has a commercial relationship with PIL Andina S.A. which a distributor of dairy products. They pay him every two weeks. Victor also works inseminating cows. This business is his main source of income and it supports his three small children.

He lives in the Comunidad Tipampa, Provincia Omasuyo, Departament de La Paz (three hours away from the city of El Alto).

The loan will be used to purchase a medium quality dairy cow so he can increase his production.

This is his second loan with Impro, his previous paying record qualify him for a second loan.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Victor es productor de leche de vaca, tiene relación comercial con PIL Andina S.A. empresa que distribuye productos lácteos y le paga quincenalmente. El cliente también trabaja como inseminador de vacas. La actividad lechera es su principal fuente de ingreso y cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos pequeños.. Vive en la Comunidad Tipampa Provincia Omasuyo del Departamento de La Paz (a tres horas de la Ciudad de El Alto). El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, así se incrementará su producción. Este es su segundo crédito con Impro, su buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar otro préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Don Luis Enrique Sequeiro es un pequeño comerciante del Mercado Oriental de Managua. Tiene 51 años de edad, habita en el barrio Rubén Darío, es soltero, tiene dos hijos de 32 y 23 años de edad quienes le ayudan con el negocio. Tiene un tramo en este mercado, en donde vende cosméticos, hace algunos meses el mercado sufrió un fuerte incendio que acabó con gran parte de los tramos, y entre éstos tramos afectados ésta la del señor Luis Enrique Sequeiro quién perdió casi la totalidad de su mercancía. Está haciendo mucho esfuerzo por volver a levantarse, es por eso que solicita el préstamo para compra de nueva mercadería y así poder empezar a formar su inventario nuevamente.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique Sequeiro is a small vendor from the Oriental Market of Managua. He is 51, lives in the Ruben Dario neighbourhood, single, has two children ages 32 and 23 who help in the business. He has a section in the market, where he sells cosmetics. Months ago the market suffered a strong fire that destroyed large part of the sections, including Mr. Sequeiro’s, who lost most of his merchandise. He is working hard to get his business up again, reason why he requests a loan to purchase merchandise and build his new inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renew Inventory

loans.name: 2052 Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Theresiya has been selling dresses in Zanzibar since 2005. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day and earns approximately $45 in profit each month. She is taking out her first loan through BRAC Tanzania and is looking forward to using it to expand her inventory and increase her profit.

Theresiya is 30 years old, single, and has 3 children, ages 1, 10 and 14. She will be sharing this loan with her group member, Cecilia, who also owns a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more dresses to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Shazia Kosar Shoqat Ali Group

texts.en:
Shazia kosar baji resides in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She is26 years old. Her husband name is S. A. and he has a scrap business. Shazia baji has three children: two boys and one girl. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Shazia baji has been sewing clothes for the past 2 years. People in her community come to her to have their clothes sewn. She saves her earnings for her children’s school fees. Shazia baji has a two-room, brick house where she lives with her children and her brother who is a butcher. Shazia baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy to buy animals (goats) for her brother's meat-selling business. 

She is joined in her loan group by three more members. Naseem baji requests a loan to buy tools for her workshop. Syedan baji requests a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Farzana baji requests a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animal stock for butcher business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus  tres hijos. DesD. muy temprano entra a su cocina a preparar los deliciosos platillos que  venderá durante en día, la misma rutina todos los días desD. hace 3 años, y gracias a su buenísima sazón tiene acogida por los visitantes y vecinos que desD. que abre su local la esperan para recibir su atención. La cocina es una actividad muy  agradable D. realizar para Vilma, ya que no tiene que salir D. casa, sino que su trabajo está en casa, lo difícil es preparar grandes cantidades D. comida para todos sus comensales. Este es su 10mo crédito con MFP, y hasta la fecha no tiene problemas en los pagos.Con el dinero solicitado mejorará el ambiente D. su hogar donD. tiene su pequeño restaurante, y comprará los utensilios necesarios para su actividad.
texts.en:
Vilma is 49 years old and lives with her husband and three children. For the past 3 years, she has awoken very early in order to prepare the delicious food that she sells during the day. Thanks to her fantastic cooking, her restaurant is always very crowded with visitors and neighbors who arrive as soon as she opens. Vilma enjoys cooking since it doesn't require her to leave her home since she runs the restaurant out of her house. The challenging part of her job is preparing such large amounts of food for her many customers. This is her 10th loan with Prisma Microfinance and she has yet to have any problems in making her payments. She will use the loan to improve the atmosphere of her home where she operates her small restaurant and she will purchase the necessary cooking utensils for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the atmosphere of her restaurant and buy cooking utensils

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Leng S. is the leader of a four-person loan group. The group members live in Veal Ta King Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. 

Mrs. Leng S. and her husband, Mr. Choem Sok, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. With their farm, they can earn money for their rice, but it is not enough to support the family well. Although they try to work hard, their family members still live in an old house in poor conditions. 

To provide better conditions, Mrs. Leng S. has decided to ask for a loan, which she will use with her savings, to build a new house for her family. Mrs. Leng S. is 41 years old and the mother of two children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory. The youngest one attends the local school. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to maK. payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients maK. their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build a new house for her family.

loans.name: San

texts.en: San N. is 42 years old and lives with her four nieces in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2005, she has been selling grocery products to earn a living and is able to make about US$3 of profit everyday. She hopes to use this loan to purchase more grocery items to satisfy her clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her store

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Doña Flor de María, es soltera,  trabaja en el hospital Jacinto Hernández en Nueva Guinea desde hace 25 años como auxiliar de enfermeria, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad que a pesar que no estan a su cargo  económicamente viven con ella en su casa y le ayudan con los gastos familiares del hogar,  ella es madre y padre para sus hijos los enseñó a trabajar y a estudiar para ser personas de bien, su hija mayor de 28 años trabaja como analista de crédito en la Curacao y el menor de 25 años trabaja como docente.  Flor de Maria esta solicitando su 7mo crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en pintar la casa y hecharle el piso a la cocina, es una mujer muy querida en Nueva Guinea y en su centro de trabajo por ser una persona de buen vivir, responsable, trabajadora y  sociable en su comunidad, su sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y llegar a conocer a sus nietos, tener salud y que su familia siempre permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Flor de María is single and has worked a the Jacinto Hernández Hospital in Nueva Guinea for the past 25 years as a nursing assistant. She has two grown-up children who, even though she's not their economic provider, live with her in her home and help with household expenses. She is mother and father to her children and taught them how to work and study so they would be good people. Her eldest daughter is 28 years old and works as a credit analyst in Curacao, and her youngest son is a teacher. Flor is requesting her seventh loan through Kiva partner AFODENIC to invest in painting her home and reflooring her kitchen. She is a woman well-liked in Nueva Guinea and at work she is known as a person of clean living, responsible, hard-working and sociable in her community. Her dream is to improve her home, come to know her future grandchildren, be healthy and for her family to always stay united.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paint her home and refloor her kitchen

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua el señor Marvin V. se dedica a su actividad agropecueria en una comunidad llamada San Cayetano donde a diario se esfuerza por salir adelante y llevar el sustento a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge e hijos.

La razón única por la que el señor Marvin ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la actividad agropecuaria como lo es la compra de terneras para su desarrollo y crianza. Esta le servirá de mucho beneficio porque al dedicarse a la crianza de ganado y a la vez a la agricultura logra continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar que tanto necesita de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the community of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua, señor Marvin V. works as a farmer in a town called San Cayetano. Her strives every day to get ahead and provide food for his family, which is made up of his wife and kids. The only reason señor Marvin has come to Ceprodel is to receive the benefit of a credit so he can purchase calves to raise. This will benefit him a lot because if he raises livestock and farms at the same time, he can continue to support his home which needs his help so much.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Ni Putu Murdani

texts.id: Putu Murdani baru saja menyelesaikan pinjaman periode pertamanya di Dinari. Uang dari Dinari tersebut digunakan untuk memperbaiki lantai kandang babinya yang sudah rusak. Sisanya digunakan untuk membeli pakan babinya. Saat itu Murdani memelihara 4 ekor babi penggemukan. Dari 4 ekor babi tersebut Murdani mendapatkan keuntungan kurang lebih Rp. 500.000,- Sekarang Murdani baru memelihara 1 ekor babi saja. Rencananya Dia akan memelihara 2 ekor lagi. Untuk itu Murdani mengajukan pinjaman lagi ke Dinari. Supaya Dia bisa membeli bibit babi lagi. Sisanya akan digunakan untuk membeli pakan babinya.
texts.en:
Putu Murdani just completed her 1st Dinari loan. She used that loan money to improve the flooring of her pig hut and also on the pig feed. At that time she was raising 4 piglets. From them she earned a total of USD 44.

At this moment she has only 1 piglet. She is planning to buy another 2 piglets. Therefore she wants to participate in her 2nd Dinari loan. She will use the money to buy more piglets and pig feed.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feeds and piglets

loans.name: Eucharia

texts.en: Eucharia is 24 years old and married without a child. She sells provisions and foodstuffs to make a living. She hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Ihtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтияров Ихтиёр-мужчина 29 лет.  Женат отец одного ребёнка. Ихтиёр занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота. Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Жена занимается переработкой молока, сметаны и продает ее на рынке, и еще помогает по хозяйству дома. Этим она помогает мужу, чтобы их семейный бюджет улучшился. Ихтиёр в свою очередь хочет увеличить количество своего скота.
texts.en:
Ihtiyor B. is a 29 year old man. He is a married father of one child. Ihtiyor fattens and sells large livestock and small livestock. He purchases livestock at the market, fattens it for 2-3 months and sells it at the same market. His wife processes milk and sour cream and sells them at the market and she also helps with the animals at home. This way she helps her husband so that their family income improves. Ihtiyor would like to increase his livestock count.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten and sell livestock

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia G. is sixty years of age. She is married and has given birth to ten children – seven daughters and three sons. Some of the children are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Afia is a trader. She sells maize. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities and sells it in the community market. She supplies maize to food vendors in her community and treks to other towns to sell.

Afia has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is Afia’s desire to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La señora Paulina,  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Urkupiña” ubicado en el distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chuchito, Departamento D. Puno. Tiene 60 años, es viuda y madre D. 6 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (3ro D. primaria), vive en el Barrio Pacifico.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. la fundación del Banco Comunal, con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para compra y venta D. artesanías. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo D. S/. 2700.00, para la compra D. golosinas como: chocolates, dulces, yogurts, jugos y otros. Además D. insumos para artesanías en miniatura (casas, autos, etc.) los cuales los venD. en ferias a nivel nacional.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros que realiza su banco comunal.
texts.en:
Paulina belongs to the Virgen D. Urkupiña Community Bank, which is located in the Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is a 60 year old widow with six children. She has a third graD. education. She lives in the Pacifico neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos since its foundation. She used her initial loan of 300 PEN to buy and sell handicrafts. She is currently asking for a loan of 2,700 PEN to buy sweets such as chocolates, candy, yogurt, juices and others. These are in addition to supplies for miniature handicrafts (homes, cars, etc.), which she sells at national fairs. Her biggest wish is to continue working. She likes the savings and the meetings that her Community Bank has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets (chocolate, candy, yogurt, and others) and miniature handicrafts

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda, es natural de Patria, ubicada en la provincia de kosñipata, pertenece al departamento de Cusco, ubicado a 9 horas desde Cusco, esta es la puerta a la amazonía peruana.

Nuestra socia es conviviente, tiene 31 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos (14 y 12) años, ella alterna sus labores del hogar con el cultivo de tierras, ella siembra arroz y coca, desde los tiempos de los inkas el cultivo de la hoja de coca, fue una actividad primordial, ya que posee proteínas y vitaminas, esta fue una planta sagrada, utilizado en zumos de té, es digestiva, de preferencia se usa 4 hojas de coca en agua caliente. La socia necesita el préstamo para poder limpiar su terreno y abonar sus tierras y así plantar su nueva producción.

La socia se encuentra muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado y de la misma forma se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de sus deuda en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilda is originally from Patria, situated in the province of kosñipata, in the department of Cuzco. Located 9 hours from Cuzco - it is the gateway to the Peruvian Amazon. She is married, 31 years old and has 2 children (14 and 12 years old), she alternates her domestic duties with working the land, she cultivates rice and coca. Since the time of the Incas, the cultivation of coca leaves has been a fundamental activity because it possesses proteins and vitamins. The Coca is a sacred plant used in teas, it is a digestive - usually people use 4 leaves of coca in hot water. Hilda needs a loan to clean and fertilize her land in order to plant her new crops. She is very grateful for the support given to her and in the same way promises to fulfill the terms of her loan in the established time frame .

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds to sow coca, plantains and rice

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina T. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Justina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Justina operates a business venture in clothing sales. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling clothing in the local community. Justina has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (about $105) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Justina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Justina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Justina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Justina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La señora Justina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en el Barrio Alto Bellavista  Jr. Los Manzanos.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 10 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para comprar lanas de alpaca. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra lana de alpaca, lana de alpaca bebe, para elaboración prendas de vestir, chompas, chalinas y accesorios.

Su deseo es seguir con su trabajo y construir su casa.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Ms. Justina belongs to the communal bank, “3 of May II” which is located in the district of Puno, in the province of Puno, in the Department (State) of Puno. She is 38 years old, is married, a mother of 3 children and has completed her primary education. She lives in the neighborhood of Bellavista Jr. Los Manzanos. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 10 years. She obtained an initial loan of PEN 300.00 (Peruvian Nuevo Soles), which she used to buy alpaca wool. Right now she needs a loan of PEN 500.00 to buy alpaca wool and baby alpaca wool for the production of garments, sweaters, shawls and accessories. She wants to continue her work and to construct her own house.

She likes the savings and the punctuality at the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool and baby alpaca wool

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna G. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Edna is married and has five school-age children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for her business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community, and she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities. Edna has been engaged in her business for over twenty-one years.

In 2009, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kantutas Group

texts.es:
“Kantutas” es el nombre de la asociación perteneciente al Centro Focal Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto, este grupo cuenta con 12 socias que a lo largo del tiempo y con mucha dedicación ya llevan 6 años en la organización, dedicándose no solo a ser amas de casa, sino también fungen como las generadoras de recursos para el sustento de sus familias. Para este fin realizan todo tipo de actividades, desde la venta de cosméticos, comercializando prendas de vestir, e incluso la venta en puestos móviles de infusiones mates, café y té en las ferias de su barrio.

Todas si excepción precisan incrementar su capital para poder variar e incrementar su mercadería, solo de ésta forma podrán incrementar  la rentabilidad de sus emprendimientos y mejorar la calidad de vida de ellas y de sus familias.
texts.en:
"Kantutas" is the name of an association belonging to the Exaltación Regional Office in the city of El Alto. This group consists of 12 members who, with great dedication sustained throughout their six years with the organization, have not only run their households but have also acted as breadwinners for their families. To achieve this they engage in a wide range of activities from marketing cosmetics and clothing items to selling mate infusions, coffee and tea from carts at their local street markets. Without exception, all of these women must increase their capital to be able to diversify and increase their merchandise; only in this way will they be able to increase the profitability of their enterprises and improve their own and their families' quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Julleta

texts.en:
Julleta B. is from the village of Sto. Nino,  Manolo Fortich Bukidnon. She is 42 years-old and married and with eight grown-up children. To make a living, Julleta runs a specialized retail store which sells ready-to-wear items as well as used clothing in the local community. She has run her business for over a year, and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Julleta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julleta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new stock to expand. Julleta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Julleta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence N. is a 35 year old married woman with three children ages 12 to 16 years. All her children go to school .She owns a two room house where she stays with five people.  Florence also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Florence works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.  She owns a restaurant on Lubaga road and buys her raw food from the Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda.  She pays transport costs to and from shopping. Florence is faced with the challenge of increasing prices of food  due to persistent droughts faced by many areas of Uganda. Florence sells to all categories of people both on retail and wholesale and works six days a week  She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same groupmates. She wants to use this new loan to buy more raw food and sacks of charcoal for her restaurant.  She has hope of seeing her business grow bigger and of owning an established home.

loans.use: To buy more raw food for her restuarant

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 52 years old and happily married to Julio. They have three children.  Two of them are already married and their youngest is Ma. Joy Bernadette is 18 years old and a 2nd year college student.  They are residing in the village of Calao West, Santiago City. She hopes that her daughter can finish her schooling.

Luz would like to expand her store by borrowing a loan from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 12,000.  This will be very helpful in purchasing additional merchandise for her store. With her income, she can continue to support the education of her daughter and also assist her husband with their daily needs.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita M., 73 years old, and her husband are making portable folding beds for a business. They have been using plastic rattan which is one of the most common materials used in making living room chairs and tables as well as other house accessories in the Philippines.  This kind of furniture and accessories are salable to class C and middle-class people, like most of the people living in Antique province. Given the opportunity of having more capital through a loan, Conchita’s business could grow much further because they could have plenty of costumers. The proceeds will enable her to support her needs as well as her husband’s and grandchildren's.  At least, when her life ends, she will have prepared her children and grandchildren as well as husband to face their own lives and have the possibility of changing it through the business she worked hard for.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase necessary materials for making portable folding beds.

loans.name: Artimiza Ernesto

texts.pt:
Artimiza M. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 35 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 5 filhos de 17, 14, 12, 10 e 1 anos de idade, todos vão a escola menos o mais novo. Fez 4ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família no bairro da Matola- rio e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Chibuto para Maputo em 1988 com seus pais, devido a guerra de destabilização. Tem um negocio próprio e dono do mesmo a mais de 8 anos, trabalha com sua esposa cerca de 10 horas por dia. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 8.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum no Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa) mensal com as amigas.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu vizinho que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 8.000.00com o qual pretende comprar produtos (frangos, refrescos e cerveja) para reforçar o volume de negócio.
No futuro, pretende alastrar o seu negócio para outros locais e compromete se a reembolsar o presente empréstimo para poder aceder a mais créditos.
texts.en:
Artimiza M. was born in the district of Chibuto, Province of Gaza, in the south of Mozambique. She is 35 years old, single, and the mother of 5 children with ages 17, 14, 12, 10, and 1. All of them go to school except the youngest. She went to school until the 4th grade and did not continue because of her poor financial conditions. She lives in her own home with her family in the Matola-rio neighborhood, and she does not support anyone else. She left Cibuto for Maputo in 1988 with her parents due to the destabilization war. She has been the owner of her own business for eight years, and she works with her husband around 10 hours per day. She is able to earn around 8,000MT per month which are applied to home expenses, and she is still able to save a little in Xitique (traditional system of rotary savings) monthly with her friends. She has never had loans through other banks, and she came to know Hluvuku through her neighbor who is also a client of the institution. This is her first loan for 8,000MT with which she intends to purchase products (chicken, soft drinks, and beer) to increase the volume of her business. In the future, she intends to expand her business to other locations and is committed to paying back the current loan so she can accept more credit.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of soft drinks, beer, and other products

loans.name: Choub

texts.en: Choub T., 23, is married and lives with her husband in the Phnom Penh. She operates a small grocery store and also works as a tailor from home. She typically makes US$2 of profit a day, while her husband is a construction worker and is able to make US$3 a day. Choub T. is asking for a loan of US$200 that she needs to fix her leaking roof which is very difficult during raining season.

loans.use: To fix leaking roof.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blás tiene 39 años de edad está casado con Gabriela Benítez, de 32 años, quien trabaja como empleada pública, aportando para los gastos del hogar.
Blás primeramente trabajó con su padre como chofer desde muy temprana edad, luego de varios años pudo adquirir  para su propio camión con el objetivo de independizarse y realizar su actividad de fletero por cuenta propia, su servicio es muy solicitado por el bajo costo y buena atención que le presenta a sus clientes.
Necesita del préstamo para la compra de cubiertas para poner en buenas condiciones la herramienta de trabajo ya que en esta época se requiere mucho de camiones fleteros para el traslado especialmente de frutas como banana y piña hasta el central de abasto Asuncion.
texts.en:
Blas is 39 years old. He’s married to Gabriela Benitez, who is 32 years old and works as a public employee, providing for household expenses. Blas has primarily worked with his father as a driver since he was very young. After several years, he was able to purchase his own truck with the goal of becoming independent and realizing his work as a truck driver on his own. His service is often requested because of the low cost and the good service which he gives his customers. He needs a loan to buy tires to put his work tool in good condition, as in this era a lot is required of freight trucks for transportation, especially of fruit such as bananas and pineapples to the supply center of Asuncion.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Merilin

texts.es:
Nuestra socia MERILIN, pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”, la socia vive en la ciudad de Cusco, en el barrio de san jerónimo ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad.

Nuestra socia tiene 34 años de edad ella es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 12, 8 años, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia tiene un stand propio en el centro comercial el paraíso, ella  vende todo tipo de accesorios de todos los celulares y también celulares, nuestra socia desea reinvertir en su propio negocio, ella solicita el préstamo para así poder viajar y traer mercadería en relación a los diferentes celulares que existen en el mercado, como mascaras de celulares, audífonos, memorias, fundas, etc.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Merilyn belongs to the Sol de Oro Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cusco in the San Jerónimo neighborhood, which is 15 minutes from the city. She is 34, in a common law marriage, and has three children; 14, 12, and 8. She alternates her activities between the home and her small business. She has her own stand in the Paraíso commercial center. She sells all types of accessories for all cell phones. She also sells cell phones. She wants to reinvest in her own business. She is asking for the loan to be able to travel and get the different cell phone merchandise that exists in the market. She will get things like cell phone skins, headphones, memory cards, and covers, etc. She values and is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay her debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cell phone accessories

loans.name: Rudy

texts.es: El Sr. Rudy S. A. trabaja en el minsa  es micro copista, tiene 20 años de trabajar para esta institución el crédito los solicita para ampliación de vivienda compra de materiales de construcción como piedra cantera, zinc, hierro, estribos, cemento y pago de mano de obra. Es casado le tienen dos hijos los dos en edad escolar. Y si el crédito anterior le ayudo a levantar su casa y ahora necesita terminarla y si está agradecido con ceprodel ya que estos créditos es una forma de ayudarnos a nosotros los pobres que no podemos construir nuestra de una sola vez tenemos que ir poco a poco.
texts.en:
Rudy S. A. has worked as a microscope technician for the Ministry of Health for 20 years. He needs funding to enlarge his home. He needs to buy building materials like: paving stones, zinc metal sheeting, iron, beams, cement as well as pay labor costs. He is married and has two, school-age children. The previous loan made it possible for him to build his house; now he needs to finish it. He is grateful to CEPRODEL because "these loans help us poor people to help ourselves," "we can't build our houses all at one time, we have to go bit by bit."

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, gravel and cement.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 42-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their seven children. Mouhamad has owned a grocery store since 2004. He sells candies, drinks, household cleaning products, canned food like tuna, hot dogs, beans, corn, etc… 

Mouhamad is special in his work because he offers a big variety of products to his customers. His customers are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his third loan and he has always repaid on time. 

When Mouhamad first started his business, he had some financial issues and couldn’t expand his stock and diversify his merchandise; however, his previous loans allowed him to do this. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job, as well as due to his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 42 and married with five children. She sells diesel fuel — a job she loves because of the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more diesel to sell and to expand her business. As a hard-working woman with the determination to excel, she hopes to lift her business and family out of poverty. She is married with 5 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more diesel to sell

loans.name: Xaver

texts.en:
Xaver G. is 58 years old and is married with a child. She and her family live in Absheron region.

Xaver has been in her business for ten years. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy cakes, biscuits ,candy, and other items to sell in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy cakes, biscuits, candy, and other items to sell

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma tiene de 27 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, con ellos y sus hermanos menores. 
Esta joven trabajadora se dedica a la siembra de papa junto su familia. La labor agrícola es cansada debido al constante cuidado que necesitan las tierras, ante las diversas amenazas que perjudican la siembra, como las plagas o los factores climáticos. Aun así ella se esfuerza por vigilar muy bien los cultivos, sobretodo durante los fines de semana, ya que se turnan con el resto de los miembros de su familia.
Paralelamente, de lunes a viernes, se dedica al comercio de papa en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, donde tiene un pequeño puesto. Para ello, todos los días debe madrugar, ya que los compradores empiezan la comercialización con los primeros rayos del día. Enma sabe que el esfuerzo diario vale la pena, pues las ganancias de ambos negocios son considerables. 
Para más adelante, quiere estudiar una profesión y para lograrlo está juntado dinero, además quiere aumentar su producción de papa para lograr mejores ventas en el mercado. 

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todos los que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando para lograr salir adelante. Enma tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de papa para continuar trabajando sin problemas. También adquirirá fertilizantes para asegurar sus tierras para las futuras siembras.
texts.en:
Enma, 27, lives with her parents and younger siblings. Together with her family, she farms potatoes. Farming is exhausting because of the constant care the fields require to safeguard them from various threats they face like pests and weather-related factors. Even so, she makes the effort to watch over her crops, especially during weekends, which is when it’s her turn to do so. From Monday through Friday she sells potato in her city’s wholesale market where she has a small sales stand. In order to do so, she must get up at daybreak daily because buyers start to arrive with the rising sun. Enma realizes that daily effort is worth it because earnings from both businesses are considerable. For later in the future, she would like to study a profession and is saving money to do so. She also wants to increase potato production to obtain better market sales. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she is very grateful to all who make the loan possible that will allow her to stay in business. Enma plans to use the requested funds to buy larger amounts of potato so that she can continue to work problem free. She will also buy fertilizer to insure her future crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes and fertilizers.

loans.name: Henry Kipsang

texts.en:
Henry Kipsang L. is a married man, 35 years old and blessed with one beautiful child. He is a maize farmer and lives in Sinonin in Eldoret. He sells maize after the harvest and gets a monthly income of 3,000 Kenya shillings. Henry has been farming for 10 years now. He also owns a posho mill in the same area. 

Henry came to know about KADET through other groups in the area where he lives.

This will be Henry's first loan with KADET, and he plans to use the entire loan to buy fertilizer and maize seedlings, and hire help to plow his land. His dream is to become a better farmer and to farm a bigger land, eventually increasing his two-acre plot of land to six acres so that he can increase his monthly income and raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and hire help to plow his land

loans.name: Ma. Rizza

texts.en:
Ma. Rizza B. is a hard working entrepreneur determined to improve her family's standard of living. As a busy entrepreneur, she has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for almost two years.  Building her business, Ma. Rizza would like to receive a loan of 15,000 PHP to increase the inventory of goods sold in her sari-sari store.  She is planning to purchase additional products such as cases of soft drinks, sugar, cooking oil, liquors, salt, shampoo, and other supplies.  Ma. Rizza believes that offering a wide assortment of goods to customers will increase traffic to her store and maintain customer loyalty in the village.

Her long term goals are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her store, and start a savings account for her children’s future to secure for them a decent life.  Through hard work and determination, Ma. Rizza is focused on improving her quality of life with the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products such as cases of soft drinks, sugar, cooking oil, liquors, salt, shampoo, and other supplies.

loans.name: Macetitas Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA  MACETITAS, PORQUE SE DEDICAN A LA ELABORACION DE MACETAS DE BARRO ESTA  UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE PUEBLA EN MEXICO, MUY CERCA DE LOS LÍMITES CON EL ESTADO DE MORELOS. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 9  INTEGRANTES.
LA SEÑORA CAMILA A. ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO. TIENE 48 AÑOS Y SOLO ESTUDIO LA PRIMARIA, ELABORA MACETAS DE BARRO. LLEVA 15 AÑOSDEDICANDOSE A LA  ALFARERIA, YA QUE ES UNA TRADICION FAMILIAR, SU MAMA LE ENSEÑO EL OFICIO CUANDO PERDIO SU TRABAJO DE EMPLEADA DOMESTICA, VIVE CON SU MAMA Y SU HERMANO.
SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA  QUE UTILIZA PARA LA ELABORACION DE LAS MACETAS, LAS MACETAS LAS VENDEN SIN HORNEAR, YA QUE NO CUENTAN CON UN VEHICULO PARA TRASPORTAR SU PRODUCTO Y SOLO LO VENDEN CON SUS VECINOS,  SU SUEÑO ES CONSTRUIR UN CUARTO  DE LAMINA PARA PODER ALMACENAR SUS MACETAS YA QUE SE ACERCA EL TIEMPO DE LLUVIAS.

EL NOMBRE DE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPOS Y SU ACTIVIDAD SON:
IGNACIA S.                    ALFARERIA
MARIA MERBI G.                ALFARERIA
GREGORIA SABEL A.             ALFARERIA
ERNESTINA O.                  ALFARERIA
JUANA C.                      ALFARERIA
MERCED G.                     ALFARERIA
LEONOR ESTELA M.              ALFARERIA
CLEMENTINA C.                 ALFARERIA
texts.en:
This group is called Macetitas, because it focuses on making clay pots. It is located in Mexico in the state of Puebla, very close to the border with the state of Morelos. The group consists of nine members. Camila A. is a member of the group. She is 48 years old and only has a grade school education. She makes clay pots. She has dedicated herself to pottery for 15 years, as it is a family tradition. Her mom taught her the trade when she lost her job as a domestic servant. She lives with her mom and her brother. She asks for the loan to be able to buy raw materials to use to make pots. She sells the pots without kilning them, and as she has no vehicle to transport her product, she only sells to her neighbors. Her dream is to construct a room with plate to be able to store her pots as the rainy season is approaching. The name of the members of the group and their job are: IGNACIA S. Pottery MARIA MERBI G. Pottery GREGORIA SABEL A. Pottery ERNESTINA O. Pottery JUANA C. Pottery MERCED G. Pottery LEONOR ESTELA M. Pottery CLEMENTINA C. Pottery

Translated from Spanish by Gerrit Larsen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials to use to make pots

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is an individual loan client with Esperanza and his story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. He is located in Puerto Plata, a northern port town where the economy is based around tourism and where running water (none of which is potable), and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his long term partner and their three children.

Nelson is excited to be taking his third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in running a small cafeteria by purchasing rice, cooking oil and other ingredients. He will use the profits to invest in his home by changing the walls from wood to cement block: a major improvement in the termite-infested and hurricane-prone DR.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia T. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old and married with seven adult children. To make a living, Eufemia owns a business manufacturing and selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members. Eufemia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eufemia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC which was used  to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Eufemia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Eufemia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Manantial De Vida Group

texts.es: Doña Clediberta es una social que ha trabajado durante varios años con nosotros inicio su negocio cuando trabajo en Patzicia, hoy en día su negocio venta de ropa típica ha crecido y por lo tanto necesita tener mas mercaderia, también tiene la idea de poner una venta de papas fritas para incrementar sus ingresos y poder sacar adelante a su hijo que aún depende de ella, por otro lado esta Doña Sofia que también tiene una venta de ropa típica pero desea que la misma este mas surtida, y finalmente esta Doña Ana que también tiene una venta de ropa tipíca ella si no cuenta con un puesto ni local, y se dedica a hacer su venta de casa en casa ofreciendo su producto, ella también desea surtir mas su mercaderia.
texts.en:
Clediberta has worked with us for several years. She started her business when she worked in Patzicia. She now sells traditional clothing in her business. Her business has grown, and that is why she needs to have more merchandise. She also plans to start selling potato chips so she can increase her income and be able to get ahead with her son, who is dependent on her. Also in the group is Sofia, who sells traditional clothing as well and wants her business to be better stocked. Finally, there is Ana, who also sells traditional clothing. She doesn’t have a stand or premises for her business, but makes a living selling her products door-to-door. She also wants to stock up more on her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise for their traditional clothing businesses

loans.name: Maqboolan's Group

texts.en:
Maqboolan is married to M. H. and has lived in a city called Borewala in Pakistan for the last 20 years. She is a 49-year-old lady who does embroidery to earn a living for her family. She has a reputation as being excellent in her art and gets regular orders. 

Her husband is a daily-wage labor. He doesn’t get regular work, that’s why Maqboolan has to work full-time to support her husband financially and to run the finances of the family smoothly.
 
She is the mother of three sons and three daughters. Her eldest son is a tailor and the second one is an electrician. Her youngest son is in 2nd standard. Her daughters are also studying, except the eldest one, who couldn’t get an education due to financial reasons. 

Maqboolan has applied for a loan from Asasah for her elder son. With the loan amount, he will buy a sewing machine and also hire a worker who will help him in fulfilling larger orders on time. 

Maqboolan is hopeful that she will be able to improve her family’s financial condition with the help of increased profits from her son’s business. She is in her second loan cycle and has proven to be a responsible loan user of Asasah.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine for a tailoring business

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con el fin de  capitalizar su actividad y otras para emprender actividades productivas, de ahí que coordinamos la reunión para interiorizarse sobre el programa, les resultó muy fructíferas  e interesantes por los beneficios brindados por el programa.
El comité lleva por nombre La Amistad debido a que todas son amigas, vecinas y por medio de este emprendimiento fortalecerían el lazo entre ellas, actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 17  emprendedoras señoras, quienes ponen lo mejor de si para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias.
 Todas las integrantes son luchadoras, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Una de ellas es la señora Viviana quien se dedica a la cofeccion de ropas para damas y cabelleros, ella es una mujer trabajadora y dedica gran parte de su tiempo al dia a la cofeccion de ropas que ella recibe con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Agradece por la ayuda que encuenta en la Fundacion, y solicita el prestamo para la compra de telas para los pedidos con que cuenta actualmente.
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguari, a group of women got together, some with the goal to capitalize on their activity and the other to undertake productive activities, a meeting was organized to get a good understanding of the program and it resulted productive and interesting because of the benefits the program provides. The committee's name is “La Amistad” (the friendship), the name came about because they are all friends and neighbors and through entrepreneurship they will strengthen the bond between them. La Amistad is composed by 17 lady entrepreneurs who do their best to increase their income and provide the best they can to their families. All the members are hardworking and have invested the loans in their respective businesses. One of the members is Mrs. Viviana who does dressmaking and tailoring, she is a hardworking woman and uses large part of her time making clothing to fulfill client orders. She is thankful for the help she finds in Fundacion Paraguaya and requests a loan to buy fabric to finish the current orders.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other materials for dressmaking and tailoring

loans.name: San Cayetano Ii Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Cayetano II, se conformó en fecha 03 de febrero del 2010, y actualmente han mejorado sus actividades gracias al apoyo crediticio recibido de la Fundación  Paraguaya por medio del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
 Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación  Paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra Domitila quien posee una tienda de venta de ropas, al cual se dedica hace ya bastantes años, por lo que es conocida en la zona y posee buena clientela formada.
Durante la temporada otoño-invierno le fue muy bien con la venta de ropas abrigadas, asi también desea que con la llegada de la nueva estación pueda seguir comercializando sus mercaderías.
Para solicita nuevamente el prestamo para la compra de prendas de vestir primavera - verano como remeras, vestidos, camisas, blusas y otros.
texts.en:
The committee of women with the name San Cayetano II was formed on the date of the third of February, 2010. Currently, they have improved their work thanks to the financial support received from the Fundación Paraguaya through the program, Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women). All of them perform fundraising work and mutually help each other to achieve their common objectives which they all have in the group and with the Fundación Paraguaya. One of the members is Domitila who owns a clothing shop, to which she has been dedicated for several years since it is well known in the area and has a good, established customer base. During the autumn/winter season, sales of warm clothing were good and she hopes to continue selling her merchandise with the arrival of the new season. She is requesting a loan to purchase spring/summer clothing such as shirts, dresses, blouses among other items.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire spring/summer clothing at wholesale prices for resale.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es: Norma Isabel tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La señora se dedica al negocio de compra-venta de cosméticos. Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace 10 años y tiene. Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Fundación León 2000 para ser invertido en la compra de productos Avon, ya que actualmente posee bastantes pedidos, por lo que todos los días sale a buscar a sus clientes en el ardiente calor y sol, pero esto no la detiene a seguir adelante. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una tienda grande ubicada en el mercado.
texts.en: Norma Isabel is 35 years old, she is married and she has 2 young children in her care. She dedicates her time to the buying and selling of cosmetics. She started this business 10 years ago. She requests a loan of Fundacion Leon 2000 to invest in the purchase of Avon brand products. She has a large number of orders to fill. Every day she seeks out new customers in the blazing heat of the sun, put this doesn't stop her from finding success. Her dream is to have a large store located in the market.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora R. is from the village of Minlagas, San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old. Leonora is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of vegetables and other raw ingredients for home cooking in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and for working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and for working capital

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre  Kuña Guapa, se conformo en fecha 24 de agosto del 2009 en  de J. A. Saldivar, gracias a  la actual Directora de Finanzas la Sra. Francisca F. quien ya formó parte de otro grupo, que se desintegró por mal de pago de algunas compañeras, luego invitó a otras vecinas para conformar un nuevo grupo y  logró conformar un grupo,  actualmente se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto,  ya  en el 5º ciclo, trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria quien se dedica a la elaboración y ventas de tortas. 

Ella es una mujer muy activa y trabaja mucho por el bienestar de su familia y la de sus hijos y de esa forma se encuentra trabajando con pedidos de bocaditos pero especialmente de tortas para acontecimientos especiales. 

Por la calidad de sus productos ella cuenta con pedidos constante, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingrediente que ella utiliza para la elaboración de tortas.
texts.en:
This group of women called Kuña Guapa was formed on August 24, 2009 in the region of J. A. Saldivar with help from the Director of Finance Sra. Francisca F.. She had started another group which broke up as several members failed to make their loan repayments. Then she invited other neighbours to form a new group which has been working successfully. It is now in its fifth loan cycle, and everyone is getting on well and supporting each other.

One of the members is Sra. Maria who makes and sells cakes. She is an active woman who works hard to support her family. She takes orders for snacks, but more especially for cakes for special occasions. As the items she bakes are of high quality, she has a constant stream of orders. Maria is seeking a loan so she can buy more ingredients for the cakes.

loans.use: to buy cake ingredients

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut N. is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Ketut is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Sari Karya (PK-10362).


Ni Ketut is widowed and has three children, two have already finished their education in Senior High School and the other one is still in Elementary School.  To make a living, Ni Ketut owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Ketut has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month from these activities.

Ni Ketut N. now has no husband. Her husband died three months ago because of illness. Although she has been left a widow, Ni Ketut N. did not grieve too long; she kept the spirit of doing business. She still pays for the school needs for one of her children. The two children who have graduated from school are still looking for a job. She hopes that with the help of a loan for her business, she will be able to support her family.


In 2010, Ni Ketut joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Ketut has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from MUK.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Ni Ketut plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Ketut N. (0) merupakan 46 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Ketut adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Sari Karya (PK-10362).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Ketut sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut menghasilkan sekitar 0,300 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Ketut bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Ketut telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.500.000 IDR dari MUK.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk berinvestasi dengan mengembangkan bisnis.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.500.000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Zamaddin

texts.en:
Zamaddin N. is a 54-year-old entrepreneur who has sold various home products for the last seven years. Zamaddin`s shop is very popular among brides as the products he sells are dowry items.

Zamaddin is married and has three children. His elder son helps him sometimes, but this is his family's only source of income. He has applied for a loan in order to increase his income. He wishes to diversify his stock to include home furniture.

loans.use: To purchase home furniture for sale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 47 years old. Emma is married and has one 12-year-old child. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Emma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Emma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik A. is an owner of a grocery shop catering to the locals villagers' needs. Together with her husband, she trades in fruits and vegetables, food, and household appliances. It has been already 12 years that the couple works with devotion and enthusiasm, making their only shop in the village very popular. Hasmik wants to enlarge the family business. She plans to put up additional shelves and bring more appliances, and introduce clothing to meet the clients’ demand.

loans.use: Expanding the business

loans.name: Norma Mercedes

texts.es:
Norma, tiene 45 años, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la provincia del Cusco y actualmente vive junto con algunos de sus hijos en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Norma es profesora en la institución educativa “Primero de Enero” en el distrito de Santiago, ella por las horas libres se dedica a  dictar clases particulares y a elaborar material educativo para decorar salones. 
 
Norma espera recibir $ 1200 USD de crédito y utilizará este dinero para comprar materiales de librería como por ejemplo cartulina y telas. El sueño de Norma es abrir una academia en su domicilio.

Norma pertenece al banco comunal “Velasco Astete” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el noveno año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Norma, 45, is divorced and has three children.  She was born in Cusco province and currently lives in Cusco with some of her children.

Norma is a teacher at “Primero de Enero” School in Santiago district.  In her free time she gives private lessons and makes educational materials to use in decorating classrooms.

Norma expects to receive a $1200 USD loan that she’ll use to buy materials like construction paper and fabric.  Norma’s dream is to open an academy in her house.

Norma is a member of Asociacón Arariwa’s “Velasco Astete” communal bank which is in its ninth year of operation and is well run by its board of directors.

loans.use: To buy bookstore supplies like construction paper and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing a box of notepads, a bag of sugar, and a bag of rice for resale

loans.name: Ka Muyu - Iii Group

texts.en:
Wara K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. This is the first loan that Wara and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Wara was born in Malal village about 42 years ago. She is married and has five children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. 

For seven years now, Wara has been selling cooked rice. Wara is going to use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to develop her cooked rice business by buying cooking ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To develop her cooked rice business by buying cooking ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Abena Akyiniba

texts.en:
Abena Akyiniba A. is a single parent taking care of 7 dependents. Abena is into multiple businesses such as baking, smoking fish, selling maize and selling corn dough at Kokowada near Elmina in Cape Coast. A loan will enable her to buy more bags of maize so she can supply all her customers who request maize. She has been in this trade for 10 years.

 As part of her responsibility,  Abena contributes to the general up-keep of the home. The new profit from the money will be used to buy a plot of land. In this picture, she is showing the wet corn she will be using for the corn dough.

loans.use: buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his coffee store

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira B. is 40 years old, married, and has two children ages 18 and 12.  In 2005, she established her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week, eight hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy groceries.  In the future, Mira hopes to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margain.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates at BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team, BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her shop

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en:
Vergenia Y. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Vergenia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, cultivating fruit trees and harvesting their fruit to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $940 a month for these activities.
