In 2004, Vergenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Vergenia is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance. This will be her 19th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan she hopes to receive will be invested into the sale of food items.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud H. is a 58-year-old hardworking man who is supporting a family of six members. He lives in a rented house in Marka.
Mahmoud was able to open his own shop where he makes different kinds of sweets and sells them. He has been working in his shop for six years now and maintains a good reputation in his area and between his competitors. Now Mahmoud has applied for a new loan to expand his shop and to add other kind of sweets to his product line.

loans.use: To purchase more sweets for his shop

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 29 years, married and has two children. He has been a farmer for the last five years.

He learned about KADET LTD through advertisement done by KADET. He applied his fourth loan of KES.50,000 with KADET which he plans to buy farm supplies. He plans to use the proceed from the loan to plough back into the farm.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Zibora

texts.en:
Zibora is a hardworking lady who weaves baskets and ropes. She is very artistic and makes good baskets. For this reason, she has sustained her business for ten years. Apart from weaving baskets, she does farming to boost her income.  
Zibora hopes that, someday, she will open another shop to sell baskets and ropes. Her dream is to export her products. She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy threads, leather and sisal to make baskets.

loans.use: To buy threads, leather and sisal for making baskets.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a vegetable and spices vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 24,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetable and spices to sell for her vegetable and spices vending business.

Elma has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from rice farming.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Winstone

texts.en:
Winstone, a 37-year-old, has been operating a retail shop for the last three years. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has learned how to save, and to manage his business well. 

Previously, he was employed by a telecommunications firm. In the next five years, he hopes to expand his business into wholesale. 

He wants a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Racar Bajo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Racar Bajo está formado por 3 hombres y 5 mujeres, quienes son en su mayoría familiares y se dedican a trabajar en una misma actividad que es la elaboración de tejas y ladrillos, este trabajo artesanal  lo heredaron de sus padres y abuelos. Viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  es conocida por su belleza natural y arquitectónica, por su gastronomía, por la cultura y tradiciones de su gente quienes son amables y de un corazón cálido. 

Una de las socias es la Señora. Delia, vive por el sector Racar en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 29 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 9, 8, 6 y 4 años de edad, sus tres primeras hijas estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la elaboración de tejas, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña Delia trabaja en un taller que es de su mamá en donde fabrican tejas y ladrillos, en este trabajo está desde que tenía los 13 años de edad, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. También se dedica a la criar chanchos y pollos.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir para compra de arcilla  para la fabricación de tejas y ladrillos. 

Su meta es  tener su casa propia y ganado para criar.
texts.en:
The “Racar Bajo” communal bank is made up of three gentlemen and five women, most related to each other, who work together making bricks and tiles, a craft they learned from their parents and grandparents.  They live on the outskirts of Cuenca, a city known for its natural beauty, its architecture, food, culture, and for the traditions of its people, who are very friendly and have warm hearts.

Delia is one of the bank’s members and lives in the Racar sector of Cuenca.  She is 29 years old, married, and has four children, ages 9, 8, 6, and 4.  Her three oldest daughters attend the little school in the city.  Her husband works making tiles.  They don’t have a home of their own, but live with her mother and share the household expenses.

Delia has been working in mother’s bricks and tile workshop since she was 13 years old.  She works Monday to Saturday from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.  She also raises hogs and chickens.

This will be her second loan through the communal bank and she will use the money to buy clay for manufacturing bricks and tiles.  Her goal is to have her own home and livestock.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine, aged 37, is a single mother of three children aged eighteen, thirteen and four. She runs a restaurant that has been in operation for five years.The business earns her a monthly income of KES.110,000. This is her third loan term with KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. Catherine will use the funds to buy food stuffs like baking flour, maize flour, vegetables and rice. She hopes to educate her children and own a modern hotel in the future.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs e.g baking flour andvegetables

loans.name: Dolores Cruz

texts.es: Dolores Cruz de treinta y cinco años de edad habita en su casa con su esposo de 38 años y querida madre.  Ella se dedica  a la venta de lociones y prendas de vestir. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante en las principales zonas  donde ella habita. Trabaja duramente para sacar adelante a su familia y no se cansa de recorrer la zona ofreciendo sus productos con el objetivo de lograr vender toda su mercadería y llevar el pan de cada día a su familia. Es muy conocida en la zona y gracias a su carisma ha logrado establecer muchos clientes fijos que siempre solicitan sus productos ya que  cuenta con variedad y con precios accesibles. Su sueño es ver florecer su negocio,  abastecer a una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar sus niveles de venta y por lo tanto sus ingresos. Esto la ha hecho tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de lociones y prendas de vestir que le permitan lograr su objetivo y así poder aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dolores Cruz is thirty-five years old, and lives in her home with her ​​husband, aged 38, and beloved mother.  She sells lotions and clothing.  She makes her sales as a street vendor in the main areas where she lives.  She works hard to move her family ahead in life, and does not get tired of traversing the area offering her products, with the goal of selling all her merchandise and earning the daily bread for her family.   She is well known in the area. and thanks to her charisma she has many regular customers who always request her products because she provides variety and affordable prices. 

Her dream is to see her business flourish, and to stock up for increased demand that will allow improve her level of sales and therefore her income. This is why she has made the decision to apply for this loan through INTEGRAL, so as to buy a variety of lotions and clothing that will allow her to achieve her goal so she can aspire to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lotions and clothing.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. For the past 5 years, Pacita has operated a retail shop selling clothing and beauty products from Natasha, Avon and Fullerlife. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy clothing and beauty products to sell. Pacita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Mariama Husain

texts.en:
Mariama is 37 years old and married with two children, ages 5 and 9, who are currently in primary school. She runs a building materials store in Lumley, in the western part of Freetown. 

Mariama has owned this business for 12 years and sells nails, shovels, pans and cement at her store. She also earns an income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuation and competition among sellers.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more building materials. Mariama says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. In the future, she would like to import building materials from around the word.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials such as nails, pans and shovels.

loans.name: Antony Munyao

texts.en:
Antony is a 26-year-old married man. He has a son who is four months old. Antony describes himself as pragmatic and a strategic thinker. 
Antony operates a boda boda transport service. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a trading center. He describes his biggest business challenges as poor road infrastructure and environmental conditions that affect his health unfavorably. He will use his 70,000 KES loan to purchase another motorcycle. He hopes that, in the future, he will be able to venture into real estate and own shares in blue-chip companies.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 30-years old and lives in the town of Pakwach in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. For the past 16 years Stephen has been working hard to manage his retail shop where he sells snacks and common household items. 

To help expand his business, Stephen has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food to sell in his shop and will help Stephen to generate greater profits, pay medical expenses, buy land and build a house. Stephen hopes that in the future he will be able to start another side business. 

Stephen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stephen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Manuel Alberto

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 20 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y su bebe de dos años de edad, en la casa que le dejo su mamá.

Él se dedica desde hace tres años a la venta de mariscos (conchas y curiles), fue su mamá quien le enseño esta actividad ya que ella se dedico a eso toda su vida. Hoy  Maule es quien atiende a los clientes que dejo su mamá y a hecho otros más. Tiene un gran mercado, ya que vende a dos de las ciudades más grandes del país. 

En la actividad que realiza Manuel, su producto es extraído del mar y para eso tiene a seis personas que salen todos los días a recolectar las conchas, en dos lanchas propiedad de Manuel de 6:00 a.m. a 11: a.m.  También él compra los curiles y conchas a los habitantes de la zona que se dedican a la recolección. Todo este producto Manuel lo carga en un vehiculo y lo trasporta a los mercados donde los vende, él se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para realizar esta actividad.

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar más cantidad de conchas a las personas que las venden y también para mejorar las lanchas, y para contratar a más personas que le ayuden a recolectar conchas, ya que se acerca la época en que estas se escasean. De esta forma él podrá tener más producto y satisfacer la demanda de los clientes y expandir su negocio a nivel nacional. Con esto Manuel podrá brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a su pequeña hija y a su querida esposa.

Manuel tiene dos objetivos bien definidos: el comprar su propio vehiculo para transportar la mercadería y el hacerle mejoras a su casa para que su familia viva en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Manuel is 20. He lives with his life partner and their two-year-old baby in the home that his mother left him.

He has sold seafood (conches and curiles-- a type of clam) for three years. His mother, who worked selling seafood her whole life, taught him this business. Maule now serves his mother's former customers and has obtained others as well. He has a large market, since he sells in two of the country's biggest cities.

In Manuel's business, his products are harvested from the sea. In order to do this, he has six people who go out on his two fishing boats to collect the conches. They work every day from 6:00 am to 11:00 am. Manuel also buys curiles and conches from the local residents who harvest seafood. Manuel packs his products into a vehicle and transports them to the markets where he sells them. He gets up at 4:00 am to go to work.

He is requesting a loan from Fundacion Campo to purchase more conches, to improve his fishing boats, and to hire more people to help him harvest conches; the season in which conches are scarce is approaching. This way, he will be able to have more products and satisfy his customers' demand and expand his business on the national level. With this investment, Manuel will be able to offer his beloved wife and little daughter a better quality of life.

Manuel has two well-defined goals: to buy his own vehicle for transporting his merchandise, and to make improvements to his  home so that his family can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more conches and to improve his fishing boats.

loans.name: Duo Solidario Santa Ana Group

texts.es: Carmen Lucrecia,D. 46 años D. edad y tiene un hijo,ella se dedica a la venta D. refacciones desD. hace 13 años ella es la lider D. este duo y nos cuenta que gracias a Dios le ha hido bien en su negocio,y por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materiales para elavorar refacciones,al igual que la siguiente socia tambien se dedica a la misma actividad el sueño D. ellas es darles lo mejor a sus hijos y que tengan mejores oportunidades D. superarse.
texts.en:
Carmen Lucrecia is 46 years old and has one child. Her business is selling snacks, which she's done for 13 years. 

Carmen is the leader of this two-person team, and they tell us that, thanks to God, their business has done well. For this reason Carmen is asking for a loan in order to buy goods to make snacks; Maria Ofelia, the second woman in the group, is also in the same business. 

Their dream is to give the best to their children and for them to have better opportunities to improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy materials to make snacks.

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.ru:
Зинаида замужем. Она проживает в небольшом городе Павлоград, где и ведет свой бизнес.

Зинаида имеет свою торговую точку на центральном рынке города.  Она продает мужские свитера и куртки. Зинаида старается постоянно увеличивать ассортимент и привлекать новых покупателей.  Она энергичная и трудолюбивая.  Этот бизнес - единственный источник доходя для ее семьи.

Зинаида просит предоставить кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на приобретение новых свитеров и курток к зимнему сезону.  Кредит поможет ей расширить бизнес и увеличить доход.
texts.en: Zinaida is married and lives in the small city of Pavlograd, in eastern Ukraine, where she runs her business. She owns a market stall at the central town market where she sells men's clothing, such as sweaters and jackets. Zinadia always tries to expand her inventory in order to attract new clients. She is energetic and hardworking. This business is the sole source of income for her family. Zinaida is hoping to take out a loan of 20,000 grivn in order to purchase new sweaters and jackets for the winter season. The loan will help her expand her business and increase profits.

loans.use: to purchase new winter sweaters and jackets

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica sells saucepasn at Kokoado in Elmina.  She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. Veronica has been selling saucepans for 10 years. She is responsible for assisting her husband in educating their children. Her loan will be used to buy saucepans. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a store for her business.

loans.use: to buy saucepans

loans.name: Anahit

texts.ru:
Анаит 49 лет; она родилась и выросла в городе Каджаране, а сейчас проживает в городе Капане. 
Анаит замужем и у нее двое детей: сын и дочь. Муж Анаит работает руководителем одной из Капанских обшин, сын учится на четвертом курсе  Капанского политехнического института, а дочь вышла замуж и сейчас живет в Ереване. 
С 2008 года  Анаит занимается частным предпринимательством: продает женскую, мужскую одежду и обувь. Раз в два месяца Анаит сама ездит в соседнюю страну и приобретает товары для своего бизнеса. Анаит работает без выходных и у нее много постоянных клиентов. Анаит всегда очень дружелюбна со своими покупателями и всегда помогает им советом, если есть такая необходимость. Благодаря своему бизнесу, Анаит помогает мужу содержать семью и платить за обучение сына. 
Анаит необходим кредит на сумму 500.000 армянских драмов для приобретения пальто, зимних курток и сапог для своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Anahit is 49 years old, she was born and raised in Kajaran and now lives in the town of Kapan. Anahit is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband works as a head at one of Kapan's municipalities, her son is in the fourth year of Kapan Polytechnic Institute, and her daughter got married and now lives in Yerevan.

Since 2008 Anahit has been running her own business: selling women's and men's clothing and shoes. Anahit goes to the neighboring country once in two months and purchases goods for the business. Anahit is working seven days a week and she has many loyal customers. She is always very friendly with her customers and always helps them with advice if needed. Through this business Anahit helps her husband to support their family and pay for their son's education.

Anahit needs a loan in the amount of 500,000 drams to purchase coats, winter jackets and boots for her business.

loans.use: to buy coats, winter jackets and boots for her business.

loans.name: 24 De Mayo (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte que se encuentra al Norte de la Ciudad de Portoviejo, se  reúnen cada quince días las 10 socias y 2 socios del Banco Comunal 24 de Mayo. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir adelante en la institución.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mariana, tiene 53 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tiene 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el menor de 14 años que  estudian en colegio, tres de ellos aun vive con ella.
 
Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos desde hace varios años se dedica a la preparación y venta de dulces, los cuales prepara  todos los días y luego los entrega a comerciantes de la zona y estos venden en otras ciudades, lo que más le piden sus clientes es el manjar de leche que es delicioso y por esto la prefieren.

Este crédito lo va  a invertir para comprar ingredientes útiles para preparar los dulces como: azúcar, leche, frutas, etc. Es su primer crédito y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir el crédito.
 
Su sueño es que su hijo menor termine sus estudios y sea un profesional.
texts.en:
The ten female and two male members of the “24 de Mayo” communal bank meet every two weeks in Rocafuerte Canton located in the north of the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for the delicious sweets the residents make that are famous nationwide.  The members carry out a variety of activities like general commerce and services, among others.  They joined forces to access benefits from Fundación Espoir.  This is their first cycle in the communal bank and they expect to be responsible in order to continue forward with the institution.

We met Mariana, 53, here.  Her husband died several years ago and she has five children.  Four of them are adults now and the youngest is 14 years old and they go to school; three of them still live with her.

She is a very good mother and housewife who in order to support her children has been making sweets to sell for several years now.  She makes them every day and then sells them to local merchants who then resell them in other cities.  What her customers request the most is “manjar de leche” which is delicious and this is why they prefer it.

She will use this loan to buy useful ingredients to make the sweets like: sugar, milk, fruit, etc.  This is her first loan and she likes it because of the speed in getting it.  Her dream is that her youngest son finishes his schooling and becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 48 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Monina runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snacks, noodles, and school supplies. 

In the future Monina would like to save enough to rent a space at a public market.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de trois enfants.Pour améliorer les revenus de la famille, elle s'active dans un commerce de tissus et de produits de mercerie.Elle achète en gros des tissus dans la capitale et les revend à crédit à ses clients qui paient au bout de deux mois. Elle parvient à subvenir à certains de ses besoins et à participer aux besoins alimentaires et sanitaires des enfants.Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite auprès de UIMCEC un pret de 200 000f pour acheter 10 rouleaux de tissus. Son ambition est d'acheter une cantine au marché central de sa ville.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married woman, mother to three children. 

To improve the family's income, she sells fabric and notions. She buys fabric wholesale in the capital city and resells it for credit to her customers who pay after two months. She manages to meet some of her needs and to contribute to the food and health needs of her children. 

To strengthen her business, she is requesting a loan of 200,000f from UIMCEC to buy 10 rolls of fabric. Her goal is to buy a canteen at the central market of her town.

loans.use: to buy 10 rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN COPACABANA DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Aquilina; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de jugos, ella vende jugo de naranja, jugo de papaya, jugo de plátano entre otros jugos, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es terminar de construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, yeso y pintura.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Aquilina, 46, belongs to the “Virgen Copacabana de Ollantaytambo” communal bank located in Ollantaytambo District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.  She is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business selling juices.  She sells orange, papaya and banana juice among others.  Through these small businesses she supports her children.  Her dream is to finish building her house.  She is asking for the loan to buy building materials like cement, sand, plaster and paint.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 45-year-old married woman with 3 children; 2 attend school while the other completed school. Her husband Gabriel is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Martha has operated a dry fish selling business for the past 6 years; her potential clients are her neighbors and passers by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 44,892 she wants to purchase more stocks of dry fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Drissa  est âgé de 39 ans et vit avec ses huit enfants et ses époux à Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
Drissa  n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de son cousin maternel, qui  vivait de commerce de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le deuxième prêt il est à son troisième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 5 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de Dongorona et environnants qu’elle gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, Ouelessebougou.
Drissa espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 120.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat de céréales

loans.name: Maize Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a member of Maize Group in Chwele District. She is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 7 women and 3 men. Sarah is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of land for sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Sarah first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Sarah joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for her family and use the increased profits to send her children to school.

Sarah reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 2 bags of maize per acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 13 bags per acre. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and possibly buy some cattle. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Sarah’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Doris Azucena

texts.en:
My name is Doris Azucena and I have had a grocery store located in the center of my community for a few years. My business generated enough income to cover family expenses, educate my children and build a house. Now, I need to resupply my business because Christmas is near and the volume of sales increases in this season.

Loan Use: Purchase butter, rice, sugar, beans, soap, coffee, flour, instant soups and other products

Mi Nombre es Döris Azucena, cuento con una pulperia ubicada en el Centro de mi comunidad, con varior años de experiencia en este negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y de educacion de mis hijos con este negocio he construido mi casa, actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio ya que se aproxima la Navidad y el volumen de ventas aumenta.

loans.use: Compra de manteca, arroz, azucar, frijoles,jabon, cafe, harina, sopas instantaneas y otros

loans.name: Levale

texts.en: Levale T. is a hard-working woman who believes in herself.  She is fifty-seven years of age, and she has six children.  Levale specializes in making pork buns because of the experience she has. She has the most popular pork buns within her village.  She sells her products at her village school and at her home everyday of the week except for Saturday.  She has good support from her two daughters who help her out with processing.  Levale is looking for a permanent stall at the flea market where she can develop her business because it is a really good place for selling.  She earns 100 tala (USD 30) a day or more from the sale of her goods.  She uses her loan to buy flour and other stuff she needs to make her pork buns.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients, steamers, and other cooking utensils

loans.name: Miliana

texts.en:
Miliana is married, and her husband is a miner. Her husband’s pay is low and, thus, she decided to open her own ceramics and plastics business. This was a familiar business since her mother, the person from whom she learned the trade, had worked in the same field. Little by little her business grew and she began to sell various merchandise. This work has allowed her to obtain a better way of life and improve her economic position, providing a future in which she can have a family and supply them with everything they need.

Miliana is seeking a loan for 475 dollars to increase her stock and diversify her merchandise. She intends to pay back this loan within 6-12 months and appreciates your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Miliana esta casada y su esposo es minero y como trabajador su sueldo es bajo, por ello es que ella decidió abrir su propio negocio de compra y venta de cerámicos y plástico. Este negocio lo conoció ya que su madre se dedicaba a lo mismo y ella aprendió. Poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo y comenzó a vender otras mercancías en su negocio. Este trabajo les ha permitido obtener una mejor calidad de vida y poder mejorar cada vez económicamente para así en un futuro poder tener una familia y brindarles todo lo que ellos necesiten en su momento.

Miliana esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 475 para incrementar su inventario y tener mayor mercancía que vender a sus clientes ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en un tiempo de 6 a 12 meses y les agradece su ayuda.

loans.use: To increase and diversify stock

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Five years ago, Olga opened a small diner in the tourist area of Borislav, Ukraine. A widow and mother, Olga decided to use her experience and excellence in cooking and baking to support her small family. Olga’s diner is located in a picturesque area of Borislav and she enjoys a reputation for being the best cook in the area. Many tourists and residents of Borislav have become loyal customers of her diner.

Olga is personable and kind hearted. She offers not only excellent food, but outstanding service as well. She is a dedicated and hard working entrepreneur, often sacrificing her health to ensure the growth and productivity of her business. Currently, Olga is seeking a loan for $1000 to buy additional supplies and food items for her diner. With the profits, she plans to remodel her dinner and create more space for her fast growing business. In turn, she hopes to continue to serve loyal customers and attract new ones – offering all the opportunity to enjoy traditional Western Ukraine cuisine.

loans.use: Purchase food supplies

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan (pictured left) works with two of her sisters, Sang (pictured right) and Hai.  Loan has proven to be a trustworthy business partner.  She has received a loan from Kiva before and has repaid the loan on time. Her previous loan has increased her profits to 20-25,000 VND per day ($1.25-1.56).  With the increased profits, she was able to buy a used motorbike to help her carry the bananas and banana leaves from the banana plantation to her home and then to the bus stop.  Loan and her sisters sell the bananas in Phan Thiet, a city about 100km away.  They must take the bus to the city to sell their products.  She would like to request a new loan in order to continue to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and banana leaves to sell

loans.name: Gudelia Satalaya

texts.es:
Gudelia lives in the San Martín area of the Mariscal Cáceres province, Juanjui district. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Trabajadoras” (The Workers). Her business is located in market number 1 and she sells merchandise such as clothing, CDs, DVDs, perfumes, shampoo, etc. She has experience in business, since she was very young she worked in various stores and this motivated her to have her own business which permits her to improve her family’s economic situation and educate her children.

With the loan from Manuela Ramos of 2500 soles (approximately $833), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy more products to broaden her merchandise business (clothing by the dozen, CDs and DVDs by the hundred, perfumes, shampoos in cases, etc.), and keep her well-stocked so that her clients find in one place all that they need and they don’t have to go to another store because here they find what they are looking for -and therefore she improves her sales.

Gudelia is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children who depend on her and her spouse. Previously she had 2 merchandise businesses bigger than what she now has, but her spouse’s poor administration made the business decline and was left with nothing. Along with the economic situation, her relationship with her husband grew worse. But thanks to her perseverance and the desire to succeed she did not despair, and with the little that was left and with the support of Manuela Ramos, she was able to begin anew from zero and arise little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Gudelia vive en la región San Martín provincia de Mariscal Cáceres distrito de Juanjui, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Trabajadoras. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado Nº 01 de la zona y se dedica a la venta de mercería (ropa, CD, DVD, perfumes shampoo, etc), ya contaba con experiencia en el negocio por que desde muy joven trabajo en varias tiendas y eso la motivo a tener un negocio propio que le permita mejorar la situación económica de la familia y educar a sus hijos.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500.00 ($ 833.00) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará más productos para ampliar el negocio de la mercería (ropa por docenas, CD y DVD en cientos , perfumes, shampoo en cajas , etc), y mantenerla surtida de todo para que así sus clientes encuentren en un solo lugar lo que necesiten y no tengan que acudir a otro sitio por que aquí encontraran lo que buscan y así mejorar las ventas.

La señora Gudelia tiene 44 años, esta casada y cuenta con 03 hijos que aun dependen de ella y de su esposo, en tiempos anteriores ya contaba con 02 negocios de mercería más grandes de lo que ahora tiene, la mala administración del esposo hizo que el negocio decayera y quedara en nada, la relación con su esposo empeoro así como la situación económica, pero gracias a la perseverancia y a las ganas de sobresalir no se dejo vencer y de lo poco que quedó y con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos logró empezar de nuevo desde cero y a surgir poco a poco.

loans.use: Purchase of general merchandise products (clothing, perfume, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Carla

texts.pt:
Maria Carla lives with her boyfriend and 3 children. Her boyfriend works as a driver for a company. Maria joined the credit program this year and this is her first loan. With the income from the business she wants to help with the household expenses. Her boyfriend’s salary is not enough to cover all expenses. All their children are in elementary school.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Carla é solteira , mas vive com um homem com quem tem 3 filhos. O marido de Maria é motorista numa empresa privada. Maria entrou para o programa de crédito aind este ano. Este é o 1º empréstimo que ela vai tomar. Com os rendimentos ela do negócio se correr bem, ela pensa em ajudar o marido a custear as despesas da casa. O seu marido recebe um salario baixo, precisando da ajuda da esposa para pagar todas as despesas. Os filhos de Maria estão a estudar no Ensino primario.

loans.use: To buy more products for the grocery store

loans.name: Ermo

texts.es:
Mr. Ermo is 61 years old, married and has 3 children all of whom are married and independent. His parents were shopkeepers and from them he learned the ropes and received economical assistance to start his own business.

Due to an accident, he lost an arm and had to shut down his business temporarily. But he is a fighter and did not let his misfortune get in the way of reopening his store. Since 2003 when he reopened for business, things are going well for him thanks to a strong will to succeed. He even started another business purchasing scrap metal that is generating a good income.

The loan Mr. Ermo is requesting will be used to increase the stock of drinks available in his store (beer, soft drinks, wines and other drinks).

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase beer, soft drinks, wines and other drinks

loans.name: Eleuteria's Group

texts.en:
Carmen and Eleuteria have all been part of the community bank “Inti”, which means “sun” in Quechua, for a year or less. In that time they have learned how to develop their businesses and to save. In addition, they have learned how to care for their children, and how to avoid sicknesses.

Carmen is 26 years old. She lives with her partner and one son. Carmen and her partner make ice cream, yogurt, and milkshakes, which they have been selling at various markets in the area for one year. Carmen used to make ice cream as an employee, but prefers having her own business. During the rainy season Carmen and her husband have a car detailing business.

On the other hand, Eleuteria is 31 and lives with her partner and three children. She and her partner are artisan weavers who make beautiful tapestries and pillows. Eleuteria lives in the artisan neighborhood of Santa Ana. She sells her products in Cuzco, both in her home and to intermediaries. Carmen and Eleuteria need loans of 600 and 400 soles, which they will use to buy sugar, alpaca wool, weaving needles, and some replacement parts for the loom.

One of the key aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account that each associate has. Carmen and Eleuteria plan to use their savings to buy a piece of property and later build a house on it. Their dreams are to own a house, see their children become professionals, and to continue developing their businesses.

loans.use: Carmen and Eleuteria need loans of 600 and 400 soles in order to buy sugar, alpaca wool,  weaving needles, and some replacement parts for the loom.

loans.name: Ben A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Devotor M.. She is currently in the business of poultry keeping and is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry feed and chicks. Devotor is 42 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children. Each week, Devotor makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house. Devotor has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX in order to buy more feeds and the loan was paid back on time.

Devotor is joined in her small group by Lilian N., Rona N., Rashida N., and Aisha N.. Lilian N. has a business in selling used clothes and wants to boost business. Rona N. is currently operating a business in retail shop and wants a loan to purchase a fridge. Rashida N. operates a business of bar and wants to buy a fridge. Aisha N. is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to expand business.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed

loans.name: Servan

texts.en: Servan D. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. He settled with his family in Beylagan in 1993. Servan is a 40-year-old man. He is married and has three children. He is engaged in fruit and vegetable sales in the Beylagan city bazaar. He started his business seven years ago. He has taken five loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch and used those loans to develop his business. Now, he needs a KIVA loan in amount of $1200 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
The business of buying and selling groceries is profitable for Eusebia, an intelligent young entrepreneur. Eusebia is an industrious 26 year old who has dedicated herself to this work since she finished high school. She buys merchandise in the city of Juliaca for distribution among the various small stores in her hometown of Santa Rosa. She also works as a cashier in the municipality of Santa Rosa and with these two jobs she is able to support her parents and 3 younger siblings. She is now turning to you and hopes to receive your support.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de compra y venta de abarrotes le resulta muy rentable a Eusebia, joven inteligente, emprendedora y hacendosa de 26 años de edad que desde que concluyó sus estudios secundarios viene dedicándose a esta labor.Ella adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Juliaca para distribuirlas al por mayor a las diferentes bodeguitas de su pueblito natal Santa Rosa.Adicionalmente a esta labor trabaja como cajera en la municipalidad de dicho pueblito y con estas dos actividades está logrando apoyar económicamente a sus padres y a sus 3 menores hermanos.En esta oportunidad recurre a vosotros con la esperanza de recibir tu apoyo y le permitas aumentar el monto de su inversión.

loans.use: Increased capital to purchase a larger quantity of products.

loans.name: Comunicadoras Maya Group

texts.es:
In the remote town of Pujujuil 1, hamlet of el Progresso live the ladies that belong to the Comunicadoras Mayan communal bank. El Progresso is a town that is located in a very remote area in the mountains of the region of Solola. The ladies have to walk an hour and a half to arrive at the first location of "pick ups", the main method of public transportation of this region.

Sadly, this town was violently affected during the civil war. Nevertheless, little by little non-governmental organizations and governmental institutions have begun to help this group of people to develop and to increase their standards of living through different types of assistance.

Comunicadoras Mayan is a formidable group. They have two loans with the institution and they have never been late with their payments. It is incredible that people who live in a so remote an area and with so few opportunities for work have such an excellent credit record.

The majority of the group works in the textile sector. Many are weavers. They weave the traditional suits using the waist loom technique. Other ladies work in the breeding of animals. They raise chickens and hogs. Some ladies have two businesses. For example Ramos X. weaves traditional clothes and makes jeweled necklaces.

When it was asked of them if they faced competition, they responded yes. However they noted that, due to working a long time in the business, they already have specific buyers to whom they sell.

The ladies think that the loans have helped them a lot, because this has been the only infusion of capital that they have received in their life. Some say that without this loan their business would never have been able to do well.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

En el remoto pueblo de Pujujuil 1, caserio el Progreso habitan las señoras que pertenecen al banco comunal Comunicadoras Mayas. El Progreso es un pueblo que queda en un área muy retirada en las montañas del departamento de Solola. Las señoras tienen que caminar una hora y media para llegar al primer paradero de “pick ups”, el método principal de transporte público de esta región.

Lamentablemente, este pueblo fue violentamente afectado durante la guerra civil. Sin embargo, poco a poco ONGs e instituciones gubernamentales han empezado a ayudar a este grupo de gente a desarrollar e incrementar sus niveles de vida por medio de distintos tipos de asistencia.

Comunicadoras Mayas es un grupo formidable. Ellas llevan dos préstamos con la institución y nunca se han atrasado con sus pagos. Es increíble como gente que vive en un área tan remota y con tan pocas oportunidades de trabajo tenga un record crediticio tan excelente.

La mayoría del grupo trabaja en el sector textil. Muchas son tejedoras. Ellas tejen los trajes tradicionales utilizando la técnica de telar de cintura. Otras señoras trabajan en la crianza de animales. Ellas crían pollos y cerdos. Algunas señoras tienen dos negocios. Por ejemplo Ramos X. teje ropa tradicional y elabora joyas a base de mostacilla.

Cuando se les preguntó a las señoras si ellas percibían la competencia. Ellas respondieron que si, sin embargo ellas especificaron que debido a que llevan mucho tiempo en el negocio, ellas ya tienen compradores específicos a quien venderles.

Las señoras piensan que el crédito las ha ayudado mucho porque este ha sido la única infusión de capital que ellas han recibido durante su vida. Algunas dicen que sin este préstamo sus negocios nunca hubieran podido salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy thread for weaving and embroidering traditional clothing and also to buy animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo is a young businessman, 33 years of age. He has lived with his partner Rosa, who is 25 years old, for five years. From their union a beautiful boy was born and he is now five years old and attends school.

Arnaldo has a store in his home that he has managed for six years. He says that before, he worked as a traveling salesman until the day he met Rosa, who was to be his hardworking companion.

After they got together they decided to set up a small store in their home and with the income that it generated for them they were able to get ahead. The business has grown tremendously and they are increasing the size of the room since they are planning to grow a little more.

At this time Arnaldo is requesting a loan to buy merchandise like sugar, flour, rice, pasta, canned goods and meats so that he can offer more in his store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Arnaldo es un joven comerciante de 33 años de edad, vive en pareja hace 5 años con Rosa que tiene 25 años de edad. De la unión de ambos ha nacido un hermoso hijo que hoy día tiene 5 años y ya va a la escuela.

Arnaldo tiene una despensa que funciona en su casa desde hace 6 años. Comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta ambulante hasta el día que conoció a Rosa, quien sería luego su compañera de lucha constante.

Una vez juntos decidieron montar una pequeña despensa en su hogar y con los ingresos que le generaban la misma lograron salir adelante. El negocio ha crecido bastante y están ampliando la habitación debido a que piensan agrandarla un poco más.

En esta oportunidad Arnaldo solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: azúcar, harina, arroz, fideos, enlatados, carnes, etc. y así surtir un poco más su despensa.

loans.use: Purchase flour, rice, pasta, soft drinks, dairy products, canned goods, meat, etc.

loans.name: Lorreine

texts.es:
Lorreine is 44 years old. She rents rooms that she installed in her house: she's been doing this for the last 4 and a half years, and it is going very well. In addition, she's a good dress-maker, and as a result she wants to open a new sewing workshop. She is a women with entrepreneurial vision, as she also wants to expand and improve some of her rooms. She is a single woman, with four children, three of whom are independent, with the only the last still in her care. In order to renovate some of her rooms she is asking for the present loan so she can complete the planned project.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Lorreine tiene 44 años, alquila habitaciones que implementó en su casa, actividad que realiza hace 4 años y medio y le va muy bien. También es una buena costurera, por ello quiere abrir nuevamente un taller D. costura, es una mujer con visión D. negocio, pues quiere ampliar y mejorar algunas D. sus habitaciones. Es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, siendo tres D. ellos independientes, y quedando el último aún a su cargo. Para refaccionar algunas D. sus habitaciones solicita el presente préstamo y cumplir así lo que tiene pensado.

loans.use: Renovate the rooms that she rents in her house.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Cinthia, 20, is a student and lives with her parents. She makes a living buying and selling all kinds of clothing for children and adults. She rents a shop, selling her merchandise in the neighborhood where she lives and collecting from her customers in weekly installments. Cinthia needs this loan to buy athletic shoes because there's a lot of demand. In the future, she hopes to build her own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Cinthia tiene 20 años, es estudiante y vive con sus padres. Cinthia se dedica a la compra y venta de todo tipo de ropas ya sea para personas adultas y niños. Ella alquila un local , vende sus mercaderias en la zona donde vive y le cobra en cuotas semanales. Cinthia nesecita este credito para la compra de calzados deportivo ya que tiene muchos pedidos. En el futuro desea construir su propio local .

loans.use: Buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mr. Eng Sakhan's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group is located in Vath Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and consists of seventeen people. They plan to use the loan for different purposes.

Mr. Eng S. is the village bank president. He is a farmer who has a plot of land (a hectar) where he cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he now faces a small problem because his field is infertile which affects his crop. To solve this problem, Mr. Eng S. is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to support his field to produce a better crop.

His wife, Mrs. Ngaet Sorn, helps him in his plantation. Mr. Eng S. is 51 years old and the father of six children one of whom rents out speakers for parties to earn an income, while another one is a laborer who can make only a small income to support the household. The third one assists their parents on the plantation while the remaining three are attending the local school.

Mr. Mam S. did not come in to take the loan but his wife did so she is shown in the picture. Mrs. Suon Savoeurn is the group guarantee but she is also present in the picture.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eleven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to improve his field

loans.name: Rebecca Nakalema's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is a leader of a five-member group. She is a 24-year-old married woman with two children aged between four and nine, both of whom are in school. She resides and rents a two-room house where she is staying with four other people.

The family gets two meals a day and occasionally take tea. Rebecca resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She is a hard worker who sellsb charcoal in Kasubi, one of the city's suburbs; she has been in this business for over four years. Rebecca sells to an average of 20 people a day. Her monthly expenses include rent for her home and business, and water and electricity bills.

Rebecca has been with MCDT for one year and is servicing her sixth loan .

loans.use: To expand her charcoal business

loans.name: Quadri

texts.en: Quadri sells spiritual items like incense, olive oils, crucifixes, and candles, etc. She supplies churches and individuals. She has been in this business for the past five years. Quadri is 40 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are undergoing a vocational training while the other two are in school. She needs the loan amount N50, 000 to purchase more spiritual items to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spiritual items to sell

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr: Native et originaire de Tori  Bossito dans la commune d'Abomey-Calavi de parents cultivateurs, dame T. Albertine n'eut pas la chance  d'aller à l'école. Elle fut initiée très tôt par sa grande sœur défunte à la vente de maïs ,gari,et condiments.A son propre compte ,elle continue avec la même activité , en y  ajouta la vente d'igname .Il y a cinq mois qu'elle a commencé par vendre de l'igname frite avec des beignets de haricots.C'est pour renforcer son étalage de condiments, et de vente de maïs et gari qu'elle a sollicité ce prêt de 150000f. Mariée à un mécanicien auto,AMOUSSOU OKE Mathieu,elle a 3 enfants.
texts.en:
Born and raised in Tori Bossito in the township of Abomey-Calavi in a farming family, Mrs. Albertine T. did not have the good fortune to be able to go to school. Her older sister, now deceased, taught her how to sell corn (maize), gari (cassava flour), and condiments at a young age. She continued this business on her own account, adding the sale of coco yams.

Five months ago, she began to sell fried yams with bean fritters. She is requesting this loan of 150,000 F CFA to diversify her stock of condiments and reinforce her sales of corn and gari by buying 2 jerry cans of oil, 1 basket of coco yams, 1/2 sack of dried beans, 4 baskets of tomatoes, 5 boxes of Maggi cubes, and 1/2 sack of onions. Married to an auto-mechanic, Mathieu Amoussou Oke, she has 3 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying 2 jerry cans of 25 liters of vegetable oil, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Назарова Фотима жительница района Абдурахмони Джоми. Замужем. Возраст 49 лет. 7 лет занимается торговлей золотыми украшениями.Торгует на рынке  в городе Курган-тюбе. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товароборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев. Таким образом она увеличит ассортимент товара и привлечет новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Fotima N. lives in the Abdurahmoni Jomi region. She is 49 years old, married. She has seven years of experience selling fine gold jewelry. She sells on the Kurgan-tube market. She wants to get a loan to increase her inventory circulation. By doing this she will increase the assortment of her merchandise and attracts new customers. She will pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor P., 36, is married and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She has been a village teacher since 1998 and is able to make $2 per day, while her husband has a business as a cow dealer and earns around $2.50 every day. This couple has two children and they are both students. This loan will be used to purchase more cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia E. tiene ya más de 2 años dedicándose a su negocio que es venta de ropa usada y nueva. Este es el ingreso de su familia ya que bajo su responsabilidad tiene a un hijo el cual está estudiando y quiere terminar su carrera profesional.
   Al negocio le está haciendo falta un techo de lamina para cubrí la mercancía del sol y de la  lluvia y además desea comprar mas variedad de ropa, pero en este momento no cuanta con el dinero para llevar acabo de la mejora y surtir el negocio. Ella planea pagar el préstamo con los ingresos que genera su negocio.
texts.en:
Virginia E. has more than two years' experience dedicating herself to her business selling new and used clothing. This accounts for her family's income because she is responsible for her son, who is in school and wants to complete his professional degree. Her business is missing a sheet roof to cover her merchandise from the sun and rain, and furthermore she wants to purchase a wider variety of clothing. However, at the moment she doesn't have the necessary money to make the improvements and stock her business. She plans to repay the loan with the income she makes from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof to her store and purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Tạ Thị Bích  năm nay  44 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có 2 con đã trưởng thành.Năm 1998 chị Bích tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bò. Đến nay sau 10 năm tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị không chỉ mở rộng chăn nuôi mà còn có thêm vốn để đầu tư trồng rừng. Hiện tại ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, trồng rừng hàngtháng gia đình chị còn có thêm sự hỗ trợ của hai con đã đi làm với tổng thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và mua giống cây về trồng.
texts.en:
Mrs Ta Thi B. is 44 years old. She has three children, two of them are grown up. In 1998, Mrs B. joined the TYM Fund and borrowed money to raise cows. To date, after 10 years of participation in the Fund, her family not only has expanded livestock raising but also has had money to invest in growing forest. Currently, in addition to income from livestock raising and forest growing, her family receives financial support from the two grown up children, which brings the family total income to VND 6,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 20,000,000 to invest more in raising livestock and buy small plants to grow

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest more in raising livestock and buy small plants to grow

loans.name: Yeu

texts.en: Yeu S. (not shown), 42, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province.  She has three school-aged children.  Yeu makes about $7 daily in revenue by raising fish from her home.  Her husband, pictured here, is a fisherman who earns $11 in revenue per day.  Yeu is asking for a loan to purchase fish food and fishing tools.

loans.use: Purchase feed for fish and fishing tools.

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.ru: Саидов Абдурауф житель Гиссарского района. Возраст 34 года, женат и имеет троих детей. Имеетвысшее образование. Работает экономистом. Кроме этого имеет столовую. Работает там вместе со своей женой. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить продукты питания длительного хранения. это поможет ему увеличить ассортимент предлагаемых блюд , а так же сохранить цены на них. Таким образом он сможет привлечь новых клиентов , которые дадут дополнительную прибыль.
texts.en:
Abdurauf S. lives in the Gissar region. He is 34 years old, married and has three children. He has higher education. He works as an economist. Besides that he owns a cafe where he works together with his wife. He plans to get a loan and use it to buy food stuffs for long term storage. This will help him increase the variety of the dishes on the menu and also keep the prices the same. He can also attract new customers this way which will bring additional profit.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Ilhomzhon

texts.ru: Эргашев Илхомжон- мужчина 27 лет. Женат отец 2-х детей. Илхомжон занимается купли продажей скота. Илхомжону помогают братья. Скот он покупает у чабанов и перепродает на рынках Аппон и Булок Аштского района. Илхомжон также закупает пряжу. Мать и жена занимается переработкой пряжи. Илхомжон весной занимается посевом помидор и реализует свой товар перекупщикам.
texts.en:
Ilhomzhon E. is a 27 year old man. He is a married father of 2 children. Ilhomzhon purchases and sells livestock. Ilhomzhon’s brothers help him. He purchases the livestock from shepherds and resells it at the Appon and Bulok markets in the Asht region. Ilhomzhon also purchases yarn. His mother and wife process yarn. In the spring Ilhomzhon plants tomatoes and sells his produce to resellers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of livestock

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas nace gracias al a señora María L. quien con mucho entusiasmo informo a sus vecinas y amigas acerca del proyecto comité de mujeres.  Ellas estuvieron muy contentas y puntuales en sus reuniones, plantaron el arbolito, y se comprometieron a ser un grupo responsable y solidario. Ellas están en el primer ciclo del programa de la Fundacion Paraguaya. 

Las integrantes del grupo son: 

María L..	Peluquera.
Ceferina A..	Venta de carteras.
Mercedes Tilleria.	Venta de joyas y ropas.
Zunilda A..	Venta de frutas, verduras.
Cristina A..	Venta de comidas.
Carmen A..	Venta de comidas.
Felicita P..	Venta de escobas.
Ramona A..	Costurera.
Ingrit C..,	Venta de ropas para niños.
Dionisia A.	Venta de comidas.
Cristina C..	Copetín.
Norma C..	Venta de comestible.
Valeria A..	Venta de cosméticos.
Luciana S..	Venta  de merceria
María C..	Venta de bijuterie.
texts.en:
The Mujers Unidas (United Women) group is born thanks to Mrs. Maria L. who, with a lot of enthusiasm, informed her neighbors and friends about this women’s group. They were all content and punctual at their meetings, and they planted a small tree and promised to be a responsible group in solidarity. This is their first loan with Fundacion Paraguaya. The members of the group are: María L.. Hair Salon Ceferina A.. Sells wallets. Mercedes Tilleria. Sells jewelry and clothes. Zunilda A.. Sells fruits and vegetables. Cristina A.. Sells food. Carmen A.. Sells food. Felicita P.. Sells brooms. Ramona A.. Seamstress. Ingrit C.., Sells children’s clothes. Dionisia A. Sells food. Cristina C.. Sells drinks. Norma C.. Sells food. Valeria A.. Sells cosmetics. Luciana S.. Retail. María C.. Retail.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: various:  food, jewelry, vegetables, drinks, materials, etc

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La señora Isidora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros” ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 2 hijos, posee estudios de educación primaria incompleta (3er grado), y vive en el pueblo de Choquechaca.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi medio año, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para su aumentar el capital de su negocio de compra y venta de pescado. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder aumentar el capital de su negocio, de compra y venta de pescado, que luego será vendido en la plaza de Yunguyo y también en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando para darles una buena educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gusta las capacitaciones y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Isidora is a member of the Señor de Los Milagros ("Our Father or Miracles") Village Bank, located in the community of Imicati in Yunguyo District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 27 years old and lives with her partner and their two children. She has a third grade education and currently lives in the village of Choquechaca. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for six months. She used her very first loan of 300 soles to increase working capital for her business buying and selling fish. She is currently requesting a loan of 500 soles to buy fish for her business, which she will then sell in the Yunguyo plaza and in local markets. Her greatest dream in life is to continue working in order to provide her children with a good education. Her favorite parts of village bank membership are the educational sessions and the ease with which she can take out loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different kinds of fish

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 33 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Currently both of them are schooling. She lives at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. She is a trader who deals with assorted products like cooking utensils and plastic bowls like lunch boxes etc. She mostly sells through hawking, that is house-to-house selling. She has been trading for five years now. She has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her stand. She treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more products like cooking utensils etc., which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With the loan, she believes she will be more resourced to make lots of profits to build a store and reduce the frequent walking in the street to sell. She is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: Lita C. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin. She is 34 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Lita owns and operates a specialized retail shop, primarily selling personal products such as pouches, necklaces, bracelets, key chains and other items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to improve her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lorena Karina

texts.es:
La señora LORENA KARINA P. M.  , tiene 31 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco SEÑOR DE LA PIEDAD II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene  2hijos de  10 y 4  y que  dependen  económicamente de ella.
LORENA   se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en la tienda de su casa.
Este crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra abarrotes, tales como: arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, fideos, jabones, detergentes.
 LUCRECIA  sueña con tener surtir con mas productos su tienda y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Lorena Karina P. M. is 31 years old and lives in the Moche District of Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the communal bank “Señor de la Piedad II”. This entrepreneur completed her studies through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 2 children (ages 10 and 4) who are financially dependent on her. Lorena sells groceries from a store she operates out of her home. Her loan of 300 soles will be used to buy groceries, such as rice, sugar, sodas, cookies, chocolates, noodles, soaps and detergents. Lorena hopes to restock her store with more products and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, sodas, cookies, chocolates, noodles, soaps and detergents

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.en:
I. Lutfiya has a successful business selling high quality clothes for women. In business for 3 years, she is a very experienced entrepreneur. She offers her customers polite service, reasonable prices and quality products. Lutfiya is married and has three children. She has requested a loan of $1500 USD to increase her business capital. This loan will allow her to continue investing in her business and pursue her future goals of expanding and opening new sales locations.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of clothing.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es: La señora Enriqueta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amistad y Paz”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 52 años y 04 hijos, 01 que aun dependen D. ella.Su carácter y su anhelo D. cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio D. venta D. abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desD. su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama D. casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atienD.  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, huevos en javas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Enriqueta, se siente con muchas ganas D. continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Enriqueta is a member of the Communal Bank “Amistad y Paz” (Friendship and Peace), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 52 years old, married, and has 4 children (1 is still a dependent). Her character and desire to fulfill her dreams motivated her to start her business of selling groceries so that she could contribute to the household expenses. She has been gaining business since the beginning and now has regular customers who come to her store to shop because it has all the products a housewife would need. Enriqueta personally welcomes her customers with her charismatic personality.

With this loan of 1500 soles, she will buy she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packets of noodles and salt, milk, various brands of canned fish, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene products. This will help her continue providing good service to her customers.

Enriqueta looks forward to continuing her hard work. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping women like her and providing them with opportunities to develop in the communities where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to increase her inventory

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine S. is from the village of Z-3, Lumbia Cagayan De Oro City. She is 32 years old. Catherine is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Catherine owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a variety "sari-sari" store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products in the local community. Catherine has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Catherine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catherine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Catherine is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Catherine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mercideta

texts.en:
Mercideta B. is from the village of Brgy. Santiago, Iligan City. She is 39 years old and married with four school-age children. To make a living, Mercideta owns and operates a business selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Mercideta has been engaged in her business for over sixteen years and earns approximately $153 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mercideta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mercideta is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 44 years old, married and blessed with two children. She makes a living selling clothing from a shop that is located at Kuruta in Eldoret. She was introduced to KADET by a friend, and has decided to apply for a loan to buy more clothing to sell to her customers. Her dream is to expand her business and become a wholesaler. She would also like to buy a pickup truck in the future.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia Tnadug’s family income comes from rice farming and the selling of dried coconut or “kopra” in Filipino (Philippine language). It is her wish that her business will develop with the assistance of a loan. 

Her husband is a farm laborer and does not earn enough to take care of the daily needs of the family, especially the needs of their only child who is presently studying at college. For their child’s education to be sustained until graduation, Gorgonia regularly requests a loan through ASHI to develop her business' profits. Being poor, Gorgonia at times is hesitant to take out a larger loan from ASHI.
