However, her determination to bring her family out of poverty gives her the courage to face the consequences, including the interest rate of her loan. Eventually, she will overcome the obstacle of being poor. She is able to operate a few businesses, just in case one fails. 

Gorgonia will use the present loan for her hog raising and rice farming business. Income from her other business, selling “kopra” and vegetables, has enabled her to repay her loan from ASHI weekly including its interest. Seeing her only child continuously study in college is the fulfillment of the dream she keeps in her heart, and is the result of the hard work she does every day.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, feed, and supplies for rice farming.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en: Nabil is a 45-year-old married man with a wife and two young children. He has owned a farm since 2004, servicing the neighboring villages. Today, Nabil is asking for a loan of $800 to buy materials and fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: To buy materials and fodder for his cattle.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. is from the city of Santa Cruz in Tarlac. She is 30 years old. Joyce is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joyce sells soft drinks in the local community. Joyce has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Joyce joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joyce has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40000 PHP from ASKI that she used to buy more products to sell. Joyce is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Joyce's 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maritza Dolores

texts.es:
Maritza C. de 26 años de edad, vive en la zona de Fortín de Guayaquil en una casa de cemento solo cuenta con agua como servicio básico, su esposo trabaja como operador de maquinas, con el tiene 2 hijos uno de 4 años que no estudia y otro de 2 años.

Maritza empezó sacando copias y así poco a poco saco la papelería con la idea que le iba a ir muy bien por lo que hay una escuela por su sector, ahora Maritza trabaja desde las 09h00 hasta las 22h30 vende cuadernos, golosinas, copias etc. Una de las mayores dificultades es tener que cuidar a sus hijos y al mismo tiempo tener que atender la papelería.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, dulces, papelería, para poder agrandar el negocio, en el futuro quiere tener un Cyber y así que sus hijos después lo puedan administrar.
texts.en:
Maritza C. is 26 years old. She lives in Fortín de Guayaquil in a brick house. The only basic service in her house is water. Her husband works as a machine operator. They have 2 children a 4 year old and a 2 year old. Maritza began making photocopies and little by little she opened her own stationary store. She was confident she will make a good profit as there's a school near her area. Today, Maritza works from 9am to 10:30pm. She sells notebooks, candy, photocopies and others. One of the hardest things to do for her is to take care of her children and working at the store at the same time. With this loan, she would like to purchase, notebooks, candy and stationary items to expand her business. In the future, she would like to open a cyber coffee that her children could manage when they grow up.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, candy and stationary items

loans.name: Bigando C Christine Bubiromubi Group

texts.en: Christine B., who is this loan group's leader, is 50 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is currently in school. For the last five years, she has made a living running a poultry business. The main problems she faces are an outbreak of disease in her flock and lack of feed. That is why she will use this loan to buy more food, chicks and drugs, each of which will allow her to produce high-quality poultry. Christine is a hard worker and dreams of expanding her business and increasing her profits.

loans.use: To buy feed, chicks and drugs need to maintain a high-quality flock

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia DELIA, pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”, la socia vive en la ciudad de Cusco, en el barrio de san jerónimo ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad.

Nuestra socia tiene 41 años y está separada, la socia tiene 5 hijos de los cuales vive con 4 de sus hijos de 23, 17, 14, 12 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades de su hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia vende ropa y calzados, ella compra al por mayor y distribuye la mercadería a diferentes clientes, la socia trae la mercadería desde Juliaca y Bolivia, ella viaja cada cierto tiempo para abastecer su mercadería. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y otra parte para ahorrarla y hacer capital de trabajo.

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Delia, belongs to the group “Sun of Gold", she lives in the city of Cusco, in the neighborhood of San Jerónimo located 15 minutes from the city. She is 41 years old and is separated, she has five children, four of which live with her, ages 23, 17, 14, 12 years of age. Delia alternates activities at home with retail activities. She sells clothes and shoes that she buys and distributes the merchandise to different clients. Delia brings the merchandise from Juliaca and Bolivia, she travels at a certain time to get her supply of merchandise. She is seeking a loan to buy merchandise and to save and to have capital for work. Delia is grateful for the loan and she is committed to complete the repayments in the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Sii

texts.en:
Sii A. is 35 and married with 3 children (ages 4 - 18).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Sii has many years of experience in this business.  Sii needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2006, Sii joined SPBD.  This is her 5th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sii's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sii A. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.9 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                1.6 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline sells kerosene. She buys from an authorized dealer and sells at retail. She started her business in 2000 and she is a big dealer.          

Roseline is 44 years old, married with four children and her husband works in one of the printing presses in Lagos. With part of her profit and what her husband brings in, they are able to clothe and feed the family and take care of their house rent, as they do not yet have a building of their own. 

Roseline is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell to improve her business. She says a big thank you to Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario M. vive en casa propia, en la zona de LimaniPata, ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa la señora Graciela Tincuta y sus cuatro hijos.
El señor Mario trabaja como chofer de transporte publico en la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa es empleada de una empresa de reciclaje en esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito será para la conclusión de obra gruesa en planta alta, para ampliar su vivienda y brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mario Madani lives in his own house in the Limanipata region, which is located on the outskirts of the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife, Graciela Tincuta, and their four children. Mario works as a public transportation driver in the city of La Paz. His wife works for a recycling company in this city. They use their earnings to support their family. The loan will be to finish the rough work on the second story. This will expand their house and give his children better living conditions. This is the fifth time he has requested a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement, sand, iron, and bricks to expand the second story of his house

loans.name: Porvenir Feminino 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Flavia, 50, lives in Samana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Porvenir Femenino (Future Women), and her story is representative of those in her group and of other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Flavia and her husband live with their four children in a simple home in Samana, a mountainous rural peninsula in the northeast of the Dominican Republic. Life in rural areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate access to healthcare, among other dangers. Despite these difficulties, Flavia runs a successful business selling coconuts. Coconuts are a popular snack in the Dominican Republic, and can be sold for their milk, meat, and oil. With this loan, Flavia will purchase more coconuts to sell at a small markup to her customers.

This is Flavia’s eighth loan with Esperanza International. With her access to capital, she hopes to continue the growth of her business. Flavia’s profits have helped her purchase food for her family and school supplies for her children as well as supported her efforts to study English. She hopes to one day purchase a computer and build her own home, two very important moves out of the cycle of poverty. 

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families from poverty through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Flavia and the Porvenir Femenino group!

loans.use: Coconut for resale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel A. R. de 39 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos mayores de edad, tanto su esposo como sus hijos trabajan en conjunto con Maribel. Ella posee un taller de marroquinería, en el cual se encargan de elaborar carteras y bolsos de cuero, los cuales comercializan en el centro de San Salvador, así mismo elaboran pedido hecho por clientes los cuales vende las carteras en el centro de Soyapango. Tanto Maribel como toda su familia son personas muy trabajadoras quienes siempre entregan su trabajo a tiempo, los cuales han salido adelante gracias a su esfuerzo. Maribel solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de hilo y cuero, por medio del cual pueda elaborar más carteras, y de esta manera mejorar sus ventas, lo cual es de mucha importancia para ella y toda su familia ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuentan.
texts.en:
Maribel A. R., aged 39, lives in the municipality of Ilopango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and their two adult children. Her husband and her children work together with her. Maribel owns a leather workshop in which they produce leather wallets, purses and handbags, which they sell in downtown San Salvador. In addition, they produce wallets and purses on request for customers who sell them in the center of the city of Soyapango. Both Maribel and the rest of her family are very hardworking people who always deliver their finished products on time and have been successful thanks to their efforts. Maribel applies for a loan to buy large quantities of yarn and leather, which well enable her to produce more wallets and purses and thus increase her turnover. This is very important to her and the whole family, since it is their only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather and yarn to produce wallets and purses

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkan de l’association Benkadi est composé de 4 femmes mariées de la ville de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles se sont connues à travers le voisinage, la  parenté et exercent ensemble  des activités génératrices de revenus il y’ a environ 5 ans et font entre autre le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de boissons  et aussi des divers. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et au moins 7 enfants. 
Le groupe a intégré l’institution de microfinance il y’ a une année et  est à son deuxième prêt solidaire. 
Quant à l’utilisation du prêt Rokiatou Traoré, qui est la présidente du groupe,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 50 casiers de boissons sucreries de toutes sortes pour les mettre dans le réfrigérateur et revend  en détail et en espèce.
Elle s’approvisionne chez le dépositaire de la place et sa clientèle est composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Tandis que Rokiatou espère réaliser un bénéfice de 28000FCFA, les autres membres envisagent obtenir 23000 FCFA. Ces bénéfices seront utilisés pour subvenir aux dépenses familiales et réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The Benkan group of the Benkadi association is composed of four married women from San, a town in Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large extended traditional families and got acquainted through bonds of community and kinship. For about five years, they've been running businesses together, selling, among others, food condiments, beverages, and various items. They average 32 years of age and have at least seven children. The group joined Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso one year ago, and it is now seeking its second solidarity loan (group loan). Regarding the use of the loan, Rokiatou Traoré, the group president, intends to use it to buy 50 boxes of soft drinks, thats she refrigerates and retails for cash. She gets her supplies from authorized dealers in her town, and her clientele comprises women and men. She hopes to turn a profit of XOF 28'000 (ca US$ 54), whereas the other members foresee XOF 23'000 (ca US$ 44). The profits will be used in part to pay for the family expenses, and in part reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Feruzahan's Group

texts.en:
Feruzahan E. is the leader of the group. She is married and her husband has gone to Russia to work.  Her one son was born in 2003 and is currently in kindergarten. For a living, Feruzahan sells cigarettes, drinks and chocolate in a kiosk. She set up shop in a bustling part of town six years ago. Feruzahan’s initial investment for the kiosk was 3000 soms ($62.28) and now she makes 15401 soms ($335.16) per month. With money from the loan, she plans to purchase a variety of soda drinks for the summer season. Her wish is to increase turnover and open a new shop.

Zharkynai M. is the treasurer of the group. She is 29 and is divorced. She makes a living by growing and selling agricultural products. Fortunately, her brother and his wife help her with her work. Seven years ago, she began to cultivate the land with 300 kg of seed potatoes. Today she wants to use her loan to buy fertilizer and more seed potatoes. Zharkynai dreams of buying a house in the city.

Orozmamat M. is 40 years old, is divorced and has two daughters who are currently at school. Orozmamat collects and resells plastic and glass in villages and then sells them in the district center. Orozmamat started this business three years ago with a 2000 som ($43.52) investment, today he makes 7450 soms ($162.13) per month. He plans to use the loan to increase his turnover so that he can make repairs to his house as well as purchase livestock.

Gulzina T. is 25 and married. Gulzina and her husband are both farmers. She breeds, fattens and then sells the cattle. Gulzina learned this trade from her parents—the tradition has been passed on. She makes a monthly profit of 2133 soms ($46.42) and with the loan she plans to purchase more livestock to improve her living conditions.

--- Where did this loan come from? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan which delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of soda drinks for the summer season

loans.name: Teacalco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama TEACALCO, esta ubicado en el Estado de Morelos. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes.

La señora Delia C. ocupa el puesto de Presidenta  del grupo tiene 33 años de edad, tiene dos años vendiendo refrescos.

La señora Reyna G. está casada y se dedica a la producción y venta de Leche y sus derivados, así como de carne.

Hace 38 años su esposo y ella tenían unas vacas, empezaron vendiendo leche en el pueblo, hasta un día que le pidieron que entregara leche en la Escuela Técnica en la que asistía su hijo.
Al ver que no le alcanzaba el dinero, la señora comentó esto con su hijo quien pidió a uno de sus maestros le enseñara a hacer queso Oaxaca. El maestro le enseño no solo a el sino también a sus padres, mismos que aprendieron muy rápido y hoy en día tienen un pequeña empresa productora de Leche y sus derivados, así como de Cría y venta de cerdos.

El programa de Desarrollo Agropecuario la visitó y le apoyaron con un crédito para una prensa y una descremadora.

Posteriormente inicia con el pie de cría de cerdos, ellos los crían y los sacrifican para vender en su carnicería y algunos clientes.

Actualmente ellos tienen clientes en Taxco y Cuernavaca.

El crédito que recibió lo utilizó en la compra de materia prima: cloruro de calcio, blanqueador y cuajos, mismos que utilizan para producir el Queso Oaxaca.
texts.en:
This group is called Teacalco, and it is located in the state of Morelos. The group is comprised of ten members. Delia C. is the president of the group. She is 33 years old, and she has been selling soft drinks for two years. Reyna G. is married, and she produces and sells milk and its derivatives. She also sells meat. Thirty-eight years ago she and her husband had some cows. They started selling milk in the town. After one day they were asked to deliver milk to the technical school their son attended. Upon seeing that this was not enough money, she mentioned it to her son. Her son asked one of his teachers to teach him how to make Oaxaca cheese. The teacher not only taught him, but his parents as well. They learned very quickly, and they now have a small business producing milk and its derivatives. They also raise and sell pigs. The program for “Desarollo Agropecuario” (Farming Devlopment) visited her. They helped her with a loan for a press and a machine that skims milk. She later began raising pigs. She raises them and then butchers them to sell in her meat market and to some customers. They currently have customers in Taxco and Cuernavaca. She used the loan that she received to buy raw material like calcium chloride, whitener, and rennet. She uses these to make Oaxaca cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calcium chloride, whitener, and rennet to make Oaxaca cheese.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Enrique C. S., es casado y su esposa trabaja como comerciante, apoyando a los gastos del hogar, tienen 4 hijos adolecentes que estudian y apoyan a su madre en las tareas del hogar, son agricultores con una experiencia de más de 30 años de realizar esta actividad de siembra de yuca y platano.

Dentro de todos estos años han tenido variedad de problemas y enfermedades de la cosecha, uno de esto problemas es la infección de plagas que no permiten a la tierra la producción optima de las cosechas, es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, que permitan esta mejoría al terreno y la oportunidad de mejorar los recursos económicos de la familia en la obtención del capital necesario para la incursión de nuevas fuentes de ingresos.
texts.en:
Carlos Enrique C. S. is married and his wife works as a shopkeeper to help with the household expenses. They have four teenage kids who are in school and who also help their mother with the housework. They are farmers with more than thirty years of experience in this business of planting yuca and plantains. During this time, they have encountered many different types of problems with the crops like an infestation of pests that won't allow the earth to produce optimal harvests. This is why they are taking out a loan, so they can buy farming materials that will help improve the land and help provide the family with a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertalizers, pesticides, and manure.

loans.name: Alda

texts.en:
Alda A. is from the village of Malibangcao Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Alda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Alda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Alda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Alda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Alda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La Sra.  Máxima tiene 58 años y tiene una despensa en Mariano Roque Alonso en su casa propia.
Tiene dos hijos todos ellos ya mayores.
La señora Maxima tiene su negocio en el centro de la ciudad y cuenta con todos los articulos de primera necesidad en exposión para la ventas.
Ella comenta que el negocio es el sosten de su familia ya que es madre soltera y trabaja mucho para una buena administracion de su negocio.
Agradece a la Fundación por darle la oportunidad de acceder a un crédtito para poder surtir mas su Despensa con azúcar, harina, fideo, arroz, aceite, bebidas en general y otros.
texts.en:
Máxima is 58 years old and has a store in her home, located in Mariano Roque Alonso. She has two children who are already grown. Maxima's store is in the city center and has a wide range of staple goods on display for sale. She comments that her business is the source of support for her family, since she is a single mother and works hard to run her business effectively. She is grateful to the Foundation for giving her the opportunity to obtain a loan, which she will use to expand her store's inventory with sugar, flour, noodles, rice, cooking oil, various beverages, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sugar, flour, rice, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Every morning, Mrs. Sim R. travels to the market where she frequently buys ingredients that she uses to make traditional cakes. She makes the cakes at her house before selling them to villagers for a profit. Another source of family income comes from her husband, who works driving a motor-taxi. The couple has four children who are already married.

Sim R. has a son who makes wooden furniture, but his income is not very much as his business has come to a low capacity due to insufficient financial capital. Sim R. is taking out her loan to increase the capital of her son’s investment, which will allow him to improve his profit.

loans.use: To increase the capital of her son's furniture-making business

loans.name: Lucinda Maria

texts.es: Lucinda María  H. vive con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos de 28 a 33 años, en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio de la ciudad de Barranquilla, lugar donde interactúan los negocios formales e informales y escenarios deportivos como el Estadio Metropolitano donde se juega el mejor futbol de Colombia. Lucinda   se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas como perros calientes, hamburguesas, salchipapas, chuzos a los que agrega las mas deliiosas salsas que ella misma aprendió a preparar  en el año 1993, mientras tenia una miscelánea. En su actual negocio  trabaja desde las 5:00 AM a 5:00 PM y los días viernes, sábados, domingos y días festivos;  ella dice que la forma higiénica, delicada y la sazón con la que   prepara sus alimentos, agregándole un trato amable a sus clientes,  son la base de sostenimiento de sus clientes, por eso   no la cambian por otra; en su microempresa trabajan ella, su cónyuge y tres empleados , sus compras las realiza una vez por semana exactamente el día jueves, para que estén muy fresco sus productos. Lucinda ha recibido14 créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo durante 17 años, los cuales le han servido para mejorar sus ventas, adecuar su vivienda y aumentar su calidad de vida  y la de su hogar y eso hace que ella y su familia sean muy felices y permanezcan unidos. En la actualidad solicita su credikiva para comprar embutidos, cárnicos y refrescos para la preparación de sus productos.
texts.en:
Lucinda María H. lives with her husband and 3 children (between 28 and 33 years old) in the community of 20 de Julio in the city of Barranquilla--a place where formal and informal businesses interact with sports events at the Estadio Metropolitano (metropolitan stadium), site of the best soccer in Colombia. Lucinda makes and sells fast foods such as hot dogs, hamburgers, sausage and fries, and shish kabobs, to which she adds the most delicious sauces that she herself learned to make in 1993, when she had a general store. At her current business she works from 5 a.m. to 5 p.m. on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays. She says that the sanitary, delicate, and flavorful way in which she prepares her food and the friendly service she provides to her customers are what sustain her business--that's why her customers don't buy from anyone but her. Her small company consists of Lucinda, her husband, and three employees. She buys her ingredients every Thursday so that her products are very fresh. She's received 14 loans with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo over the course of the last 17 years, which have helped her improve her sales, renovate her home, and improve her family's quality of life so that they're happy and are able to remain together. She's currently requesting a Kiva loan to buy sausage, meat, and soft drinks for the preparation of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meats and soft drinks to make her products

loans.name: El Zapote 3 Group

texts.es:
el grupo El zapote 3 esta integrado por 4 mujeres luchadoras y que tienen muchos deseos de salir adelante, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

doña Angela O. V. es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de gallinas desde hace 12 años, es madre de 4 hijos a los cuales los tiene estudiando en la escuela.  Angela y su esposo trabajan 
duro para sacar adelante su familia, su esposo trabaja en una camaronera y sus tiempos libres los dedica para visitar a sus padres y hermanos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar gallinas.

Lizhet del Carmen O. es una joven emprendedora que se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas en su casa de habitacion, Lizhet es soltera y vive con sus papas.
lizhet ayuda economicamente a sus padres para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para hacer sus ricas tortillas y salir a venderlas en su comunidad.
su tiempo libre lo dedica  para ir a la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar harina de maiz, cal, leña, agua.

Blanca Luz O. una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia, Blanca  se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para atender a sus clientes, junto con su esposo han sacado adelante su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio.

Deysi Isabel V. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia desde hace  6 años.
Deysi es madre de 4 hijos los cuales los tiene en la escuela.
todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para atendrer a sus clientes  y despachar a sus hijos para la escuela.
sus tiempos libres los dedica para asistir a la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
The El Zapote Group is made up of 4 struggling women who have a strong desire to get ahead. The following details the various businesses in which they are engaged: Angela O. V. is an enterprising woman who has been selling chickens for the past 12 years. She is the mother of 4 school-aged children. Angela and her husband work hard so their family will get ahead. Her husband works at a shrimp farm and in their free time, they visit their parents and their brothers. They will use the loan to buy chickens. Lizhet del Carmen O. is an enterprising young woman who makes tortillas in her home and sells them. Lizhet is single and lives with her parents who she helps financially by covering their household expenses. She gets up every day at 4:00 in the morning to make her delicious tortillas and goes out to sell them in the community. In her free time, she goes to church. She will use the loan to buy corn flour, lime, firewood, and water. Blanca Luz O. is a hard-working woman who sells general consumer products. She has a small general store. Blanca gets up at 5:00 in the morning to take care of her customers. She and her husband have helped their family get ahead. The loan will be used to buy merchandise to supply her business. Deysi Isabel V. sells general consumer products. She has owned a general store for the past 6 years. Deysi is the mother of 4 school-aged children. She gets up at 5:00 in the morning to take care of her customers and send her children to school. In her free time, she attends church. The loan will be used to buy merchandise to supply her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de gallinas, harina de maiz, cal, leña, agua, fosforos, arroz, azucar, manteca, frijoles, leche, refrescos, aceite, huevos, candelas, sopas, pastas, espaguetis, salsas, margarina, sal, condimentos, sopas instantaneas.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es soltera y tiene 1 hija de 3 años que están en el nido, Reyna vende leña en su casa, producto que adquiere de los productores que le traen a su casa. Además Reyna trabaja en una pastelería como vendedora.
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas y necesita un préstamo de 900 soles para la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Reyna son comprar un terreno para construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reyna is a single mother of a three-year-old daughter who is still at home.  She sells firewood from her home, which she gets from producers who deliver it to her.  Reyna also works in a cake shop as a salesperson.

Reyna is a member of the Villa Huatatas Community Bank, and she is applying for a loan of 900 Nuevos Soles (~300 USD) for the purchase of firewood.

Her dreams are to buy property to build a house, and to provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud is a housewife and mother of three sons and lives in Bethlehem.  Kholoud's husband, who appears with her in the picture posted here, is a construction worker. He builds houses in the city of Bethlehem and in Beit Sahour and Beit Jala, which are the neighboring cities of Bethlehem.

Khouloud's husband works for a workshop with a team of builders. He wants to start doing freelance construction work in addition to his work with the workshop, so Kholoud took a $1,000 loan from FATEN for this purpose. Kholoud's husband's freelancing will increase the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El Sr.  Nicolás es un cliente nuevo, pero su hijo ya saco varios créditos en la institución, la puntualidad y responsabilidad fue un factor común en los créditos de su hijo,  la  actividad que tiene el cliente es fotógrafo, el trabaja con un estudio fotográfico, el estudio agarra los contratos y le pasa al señor Nicolás,  los contratos que tiene el cliente son en fiestas, cumpleaños, matrimonios, y demás, el señor Nicolás es jubilado hace 26  años  de la empresa, después de su jubilación el se dedico a la fotografía por completo,  los equipos que tiene en su casa son variados desde la cámara mas antigua hasta la mas moderna, sus contratos son frecuentemente en la zona 16 de julio y ceja de el alto, el trabajo que realiza nuestro cliente es sacrificado porque el tiene amanecerse los fines de semana,  su trabajo comienza normalmente los fines de semana desde el día jueves hasta el día domingo, su esposa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa por mayor, ella los distribuye al interior,  el tiene hijos pero todos son mayores, el crédito será invertido en la compra de una cámara fotográfica digital.
texts.en: Nicolas is a new client, but his son has already taken a number of loans from Emprender and has been punctual and responsible in paying them back.  Nicolas works as a photographer; he works with a photographic studio.  The studio gets the contracts and passes them on to Nicolas.  The contracts that he gets are for parties, birthdays, weddings and other occasions.  Nicolas retired from a company 26 ago.  After he retired, he dedicated himself completely to photography.  He has a variety of equipment in his house, from his oldest to his most modern cameras.  His contracts are frequently in the "16 de Julio"  and "Ceja de El Alto" neighborhoods.  His work involves sacrifice, since he has to get up very early in the morning on the weekends.  Typically he works on the weekends, from Thursdays to Sundays.  His wife sells cosmetics and clothing at wholesale; she distributes to the interior of the country.  He has children, but they are all grown.  He will use this loan to invest in the purchase of a new digital camera.

loans.use: to buy a digital camera

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a thirty-nine-year-old, married with six children living in her own home in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is in the retail shop business and over a period of twenty years, she has managed to educate her children and buy land as well from the profits of her business. Although she is faced with a big challenge of limited capital, she still hopes for the best in her business. Margret needs a loan to purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil, and soap to sell at her shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, salt, cooking oil, and soap for resale

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Calavi, une ville du Bénin, T. Odette est mariée à OSSA Mathieu, un coiffeur. Odette est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis douze ans à Adogléta un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple a six personnes à charges et se partage ensemble les charges familiales. Odette mène comme activité la vente de nourriture (riz, haricot) à son domicile. Cela fait maintenant dix ans que Odette exerce cette activité. Odette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché populaire du Bénin. Odette a déjà bénéficié de sept prêts qui ont été tous très bien remboursés. C’est dans l’optique d’améliorer la qualité de ses repas que Odette désire obtenir un huitième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Odette souhaite augmenter son fond de roulement
texts.en: Born in 1980 in Calavi, a town in Benin, Odette T. is married to Mathieu Ossa, a hairdresser.  Odette is a mother of four children in school.  The family has lived in Adogléta, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for twelve years.  The couple have six dependents and share the family expenses. Odette runs a business selling food (rice and beans) from her home. She has been running this business for the past ten years. She buys her products at the popular Dantokpa market. Odette has received seven loans and she has reimbursed all of them. With a view of improving the quality of products, Odette seeks her eighth loan with ALIDé. Odette hopes to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and beans and condiments.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina A. is a married woman who lives in Prk.Tikoy, Brgy. Bogo, Argao, Cebu.  She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  abaca weaving and Ready-to-Wear clothes businesses.  Her husband Modesto A., who is 65 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 34 to 42 years old.  

Florentina  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Florentina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 27,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 27,000 which she intends to use as additional business capital so that she can continue to save up for the future.  

Florentina  A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is a homemaker with many household responsibilities. She and her husband have three daughters and a three-year-old son. Her daughters are obtaining their education at the local school. The family lives in a residential area called Lakar Mandi in Chichawatni, a small city known for its agriculture industry located in the Punjab province of Pakistan.

Nusrat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah in order for her husband to improve his dried-fruit vending business. He imports dried fruit at cheap rates from northern areas such as Murree and Sawat and sells these to his customers. Nusrat is hopeful that this investment will open new horizons of success for her husband's business and will help to improve her family's standard of living.
 
Nusrat is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has established a good credit record by paying her installments on time and has attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits to offer for sale

loans.name: Las Diez Azucenas Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama Las Diez Azucenas, el nombre se debe a que en la casa de reunión se encuentran estas flores. En la ciudad de Tehuacan en el estado de Puebla en Mexico. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes. La sra. Guadalupe G. A.se dedica a la venta de leche,negocio que inicio hace dos años. Solicita el  prestamo para la compra de pastura para su ganado ya que con una buena alimentacion del ganado tienen una mejor productividad para asi poder tener mas ventas. Tiene 57 años, estudio hasta el 6 año de primaria. Es casada y tiene en total 4 hijos 2 varon y 2 mujeres. Sus clientes opinan que tiene buen servicio porque siempre llega puntual y su producto no está alterado, ademas cuenta con lo necesario para cumplir con todos sus clientes. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente alegre porque va a poder asegurar la alimentación de su ganado. Para asi poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.Tambien espera que su negocio tenga crecimiento y seguir apoyando a el menor de sus hijos para que salga adelante ya que aun esta estudiando y tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en: This group is called Las Diez Azucenas ("The Ten White Lillies"), which originates from the presence of these flowers in the house where they hold their meetings.  Señora Guadalupe G.A. works in the sale of milk, a business that she began over two years ago.  She is seeking a loan in order to be able to purchase pastures for her livestock, since feeding her livestock better will produce better milk and higher sales.  She is 57 years old and her highest level of education is the 6th grade.  She is married and has 4 children: 2 boys and 2 girls.  Her customers say that she offers great service because she always arrives on time and her products are never altered.  In addition, she has enough to fulfill the demands of her customers.  As she seeks this loan, she feels happy because she is able to ensure the feeding of her livestock and thus continue satisfying her customers.  She also hopes to grow her business and continue supporting her children so that they may continue studying and have a successful future.

loans.use: Purchase pasture for livestock.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.fr: Jean Bosco N. est conducteur de taxi-voiture, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Il est marié, et il a une éducation d’école secondaire.  Il a 4 enfants entre 5 ans et 12 ans, et tous vont à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat de la peinture pour la voiture, assurance, et autorisation de transport et contrôle de sa taxi-voiture.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de développer son business en achetant beaucoup ou une autre taxi-voiture.  Il voudrait accroitre son affaire et devenir un taximan de haut niveau.  Il voudrait assurer le bien-être de sa famille, et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.  Pour gagner plus de revenu, Jean Bosco et aussi élévateur des vaches.
texts.en: Jean Bosco N. is a taxi driver and a client of ACB since 2010. He is married. He has completed secondary education. He has four children between 5 and 12 years of age, all of whom are in school. He is going to use his loan in order to purchase car paint, insurance, permit and registration for his taxi. His strategy is to grow his business by purchasing in bulk or by getting a second taxi cab. He would like to expand his business and to become a high-class  taxi driver. He would like to provide for the well-being of his family and to pay for the schooling of his children. In order to increase his income, Jean Bosco also raises cattle.

loans.use: Purchasing car paint, insurance, permit and registration for his taxi cab

loans.name: Temtemneh Group

texts.en:
John T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. John was born in Makomp village about 44 years ago. He is married and has eight children. Six of John’s children are attending primary and secondary schools, and two are not yet of school-going age. For fifteen years now, John has been selling palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), rice and slippers. 

Members of the Temtemneh group are requesting a loan of 1,200,000 SLL for each in the group from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. John T. will use his share of the loan to expand his business. He will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale prices to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy more palm-oil, gari, rice and slippers to sell

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Doña Maria C. se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “GINA”.

Cabe mencionar que la Sra. C. la mayoría de sus ventas las hace al crédito, por que casi todos sus clientes son empleados de fábricas y le pagan a ella cuando reciben su salario mensual.

La Sra. Maria C. esta casada y de su matrimonio solo depende un hijo, su cónyuge se dedica a la agricultura (siembra de maíz y frijoles). en la zona donde ellos viven es muy buena para la producción de granos básicos.

En la actualidad Doña Maria no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor y asi surtir su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña María C. has a small grocery store that she operates out of her home under the name "GINA" Grocery.

Most of her sales are made on a credit basis since nearly all of her customers are factory workers who pay her at the end of the month.

Mrs. Maria C. is married and has a son.  Her husband is a farmer (corn and beans).  They live in an area that is very good for growing basic grains.

At this moment Doña Maria does not have enough working capital to stock her business well and satisfy customer demand.  She plans to use the credit to buy goods wholesale so she can increase her inventory and generate more income.

loans.use: To buy softdrinks, pastry, bread, cookies, flour, beans, lard, oil, margarine, rice, sugar, salt, condiments, pasta, soup, tomato sauce, cereal, soap, toilet tissue, candles, matches, batteries, juices, sweets

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy N. is 45 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is widowed and has five children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Cissy has a boutique shop that sells clothes. She has had her shop for less than one year.  She also has a second business of renting houses.  

To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Cissy hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Cissy hopes to open another boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen P. is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. P. and her husband are farmers and also produce cow ties to sell, earning an income of USD $5 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD $50 on food and USD $100 on other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of USD $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to transport cow ties to sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport cow ties to sell

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Hean V. is 24 years old and has been living in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Hean V. is married to Nara, a 31-year-old machinery repairman. This couple has four children. Ttwo of them are students in school, and the other two are not enrolled in school yet. 

To earn a living, Hean V. is a fresh fish seller in the busy market. She buys fish in bulk at a low price from rural people and then sells them at retail in the market for a profit, earning around $2.50 a day. 

Hean V. is requesting a loan to purchase additional fish for selling.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for selling

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Daniel C.. He is married and has four children aged six, nine, 12 and 15. 

In 2001, Daniel established his spare parts business. He began his business because he wanted to generate income, establish a savings scheme, and provide a livelihood for his family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 350,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to help him buy more spares for different makes of motor vehicles. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 100,000 SLL. In the future, Daniel plans to open another shop and build a house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for for different kinds of motor vehicles

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 40 years old and lives in the New Kru area.   He and his partner have three children, aged  2, 5 and 13.  They are all in school.

For five years, James has been running a medicine store providing service to his community.  He’s requesting a loan to purchase more drugs (Paracetamol, Folic Acid, etc.).   He plans to open his own clinic in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs (Paracetamol, Folic Acid etc.)

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es madre de familia de 40 años de edad, tiene su casa propia donde vive con sus hijos, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande, a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Cristina es la crianza y venta de ganado caprino (cabras), desde hace 4 años, el lugar donde cría  sus animales en la parte posterior de la casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela en la ciudad de Piura.  Esto le permite obtener mayores ganacias para cubrir sus obligaciones familiares.  También cuenta con algunas tierras de cultivo donde siembra plantas de limón. 

Cristina solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar el alimento para sus animales, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para venderlos a un mejor precio y también lo va utilizar para la compra de fertilizantes para sus tierras de cultivoy pueda tener una buena producción de limón. Cristina  es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque es una persona que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos, con el ideal que en un futuro cercano pueda brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 40-year-old mother.  She has a house of her own where she lives with her children.  The only utility the house has is electricity.  It’s located in Tambogrande District about 40 minutes from Piura Department.  These areas are dedicated to farming, livestock raising and crafts.

Cristina’s activity is raising goats to sell.  She’s been in this line of work for 4 years.  The place where she raises the animals is the back yard of her house.  She feeds them balanced feed and natural grains.  Once they reach ideal size and weight she sells them in the various markets since she has an established clientele in the city of Piura.  This allows her to obtain higher profits to meet her family obligations.  She also has some farmland where she grows lemons.

Cristina is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to buy animal feed so that they will be well fed and she will be able to sell them for a better price.  She will also use it to buy fertilizer for her farmland to obtain a good production of lemons.

Cristina is very well known where she lives because she’s someone who is always concerned about the wellbeing of her loved ones with the ideal in mind that in the near future she’ll be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Book Liggueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Book Liggueye est crée le 31 Mai 2007. Il est composé de 14 femmes toutes du même quartier. 

Leur principale activité est le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 52 ans .
Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de produits divers tels la pâte d'arachide, l'huile de palme, les poissons fumés et les balaies.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de financer son activité de vente de produits divers. 
Son objectif est d'assurer une meilleur prise en charge de sa progéniture et d'améliorer sa condition de vie familiale. 

La femme en médaillon fait partie du groupe de solidarité, elle était absente lors de la prise de la photo.
texts.en:
The solidarity group called Book Liggueye was formed on May 31, 2007. It is composed of 14 women, all from the same neighborhood. Their principal activity is selling various small items.  

Madame Mariama, standing on the right raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 52 years old. She's married and has six children. 

She sells various goods such as peanut butter, palm oil, smoked fish, and brooms. Her new loan will serve as working capital for her small sales business. 

Her objective is to ensure that she can support her offspring and improve living conditions for her family. 

The woman in the snapshot is a member of the solidarity group who was absent when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy peanut butter, palm oil, smoked fish, and brooms.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and running water. Linda’s greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Linda operates a beauty salon business and her neighbors and passersby are her potential customers. In addition, she also makes natural fruit juices to sell and this contributes to her income. Linda’s major business challenge is seasonality. 

Linda decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase pieces of hair weaves, a blow dryer, and sacks of fruit for making juice.  In the future, Linda dreams of expanding her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase hair weaves, a blow dryer, and fruit to make juice

loans.name: Bessarion

texts.en:
Bessarion comes from village Gulgula, Kakheti Region. This region is well-known, with fertile land and well developed agriculture throughout the country. 

Bessarion is a 48-year-old farmer. He is married and lives with his family – his wife Ia, two sons (14 and 11 years old) and his 76-year-old mother. Ia is a teacher in a local school. The children go to school. 

Bessarion is leading the farming activities of the family. They have 0.6 hectare vineyard and sell grapes in season. Also they grow barley, garlic and haricot beans on family-owned 2 hectares of land. Harvested vegetables and grains are sold locally to retailers. The average monthly income of the family is 520 Laris. 

With the requested credit Bessarion will pay the hired workers, which will help them to perform seasonal work in the vineyard and kitchen garden – treatment of different parasites. Also they will assist Bessarion in the process of barley harvest. Part of the credit will be used to purchase medicines for the above-mentioned process. Bessarion hopes that after the treatment for parasites he will get a quality harvest and planned income from his sales.

loans.use: to purchase medicines against parasites and pay workers.

loans.name: Maritza Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora Maritza es socia del banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió pero su gente tiene un corazón muy cálido, fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999 por su belleza arquitectónica.
 
La Señora. Maritza tiene 28 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico automotriz, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Maritza se dedica a la venta de cosméticos esta actividad la realiza hace 3 años y su producto lo vende  a sus amigas y conocidas.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por su suegra, el dinero de su crédito lo va ha invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas, bisutería y cosméticos.

Su meta es ampliar mucho más su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza is a member of the communal bank Divino Niño Jesús.  She lives in the city of Cuenca which has a cold climate, but warm-hearted people.  It was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 because of its architectural beauty.

Maritza, 28, is married and has two children, ages 9 and 4.  Her eldest daughter attends a local school.  Her husband is an automobile mechanic.  They live in a rented house.

For three years Maritza has been seeling cosmetics to friends and acquaintances.  This is her second loan through the communal bank, where she was invited by her mother-in-law to become a member.  She will use the loan to buy perfumes, creams, costume jewelry and cosmetics.

Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, costume jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: C4370 Abisungane Group

texts.en:
Marie is 37 years old. She is married with four children and takes care of seven children. She is also the leader of this group which is called "ABISUNGANYE" in the local language. Marie employs two people to help her and she has five years of experience in this business. She works from 6am to 9pm every day except Sunday. 

Marie and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of food and drinks for sale

loans.name: Noel Nestor

texts.fr:
Client de 48 célibataire  et père de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 6 ans et 18 ans, Ayant déjà bénéficié de plusieurs prêts de Hope , il est aujourd'hui a son troisième cycle de prêt, ses ventes ont augmentes de 80.000 a 120.000 frs par jour, il a eu a faire des épargnes considérables et a rembourser sans difficultés , et avec ses bénéfices , il est entrain d’élargir son activité du jour au jour.

Avec ce troisième prêt il va acheter des  tuyaux PVC, des câbles et fils électriques, des ampoules, des robinets,vices, pointes et tous ce dont ses clients ont besoin.
Il tient a atteindre son objectif celui d'ouvrir une quincaillerie et aller en Afrique de l'est et en Asie pour s'approvisionner
texts.en:
Our client, aged 48, is unmarried and the father of four children who range in age from 6 to 18. Having already benefited from several HOPE loans, he is now on his third loan cycle. His sales have increased from 80,000 to 120,000 francs per day. He has saved a considerable amount of money and has repaid without difficulties. With his profits, he is in the process of expanding his business from day to day. 

With this third loan, he is going to buy PVC pipes, cables, electrical wires, light bulbs, faucets, screws, sparkplugs, and anything his customers need. He is intent on achieving his goal of opening a hardware store and going to East Africa and to Asia for his supplies.

loans.use: To buy PVC pipes, faucets, electronic equipment, light bulbs, and cables

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is thirty-eight years old and has one child, aged nine, whom she hopes to educate to the university level.  She operates a clothing sales business at Mtamboni in Mombasa. She says that though the business is profitable, there are challenges in competition. She is using her loan of KES 70,000 to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her business to wholesale. She describes herself as honest and accountable.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Fahmiya

texts.en: Fahmiya is a 46-year-old woman who is married with eight sons. Her husband is employed by the Ministry of Education with a decent salary. Fahmiya has its own project: a food stall for selling pastries and falafel, which is a Palestinian traditional dish. Fahmiya wants to purchase a new oven for baking pastries and a new machine for making falafel to improve her work. But the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Fahmiya takes the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase the machine and oven to improve the quality of food she is making and to sell more food to get better income and live with her family in better living conditions. Fahmiya is photographed in her food stall.

loans.use: To purchase an oven to make pastries and a machine for making falafel

loans.name: Edelisa

texts.en:
Edelisa is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Edelisa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Edelisa is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. They live in a house that they own which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

With the Kshs 10,000 she is requesting, Mesaid wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, oil and beans. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy wheat flour, cooking fat, oil and beans

loans.name: Juana Manuela

texts.es:
Juana Manuela es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una pequeña venta. Ella inicio este negocio con la venta de golosinas, gaseosas y unos cuantos productos en la actualidad su negocio ha crecido poco a poco ahora vende granos básicos, huevo, pan, enlatados…etc. 
Ella con el crédito comprará gaseosas, arroz, aceite y azúcar entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Juana Manuela is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has a small store. She started her business by selling candy, sodas, and a few other products. Now that her business has grown gradually, she also sells basic grains, eggs, bread, canned good, and other items.

She is requesting a loan to buy sodas, rice, oil, sugar, and other products.

loans.use: to buy sodas, rice, oil, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Tam's Group

texts.en:
Tam is 57 years old with 3 children who are married. Now she is living with her youngest son in Anninh village. She has a small shop that sells artificial  paper things for the dead. It is a very traditional business in Vietnam and also creates very good income for those who are both making and selling. Every month, she gets about 4,000,000 VND of profit from this business. 

Joining with our credit program in 2008, she has used loans very effectively in expanding her business and also repaid on time. She sees that this kind of credit is very suitable with her business. For her new loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy more materials.

 Phuong is 28 years old. She is managing a wood workshop that makes family furniture. She hopes to get a loan of 7,392,000 VND to buy wood as material.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make artificial paper things for the dead.

loans.name: Elburus

texts.ru:
Elburus 33 qoda. On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda,seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Araz Dilagarda vmeste so svoyey semyoy.
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyey mashini chtobi pochinit yeyo , tak kak on ne mojet polzovatsya yeyu poka ona isporchena. On uje 4 qoda kak rabotayet taxistom.
texts.en: Elburus is 33 years old. He is married and has one child. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the city of Fuzuli, currently living in the town of Araz Dilagarda, in Fuzuli region, together with his family. He needs 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts to repair his car, as is it unusable in its current state. He has worked as a taxi driver for four years.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells cloth at Kokoado in Elmina. She is a widow and has seven dependents. She is responsible for caring for her children. Mercy has been selling cloth for 12 years. She will use her loan to buy cloth and materials. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy cloth and materials.

loans.name: Mahamadou

texts.fr:
Né en 1985 à Sikasso ville, Monsieur Mahamadou  est marié et père de 2 enfants il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle avec ses parents et ses frères à Sikasso.
Après l’activité de boulanger sans succès, Mahamadou s’est initié il y a deux années à la vente de matelas en provenance de Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso). Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a une année.  Il a bénéficié deux prêts  tous correctement remboursés, ainsi il sollicite un troisième afin d’augmenter son fonds de commerce.
 Ce troisième prêt lui permettra ainsi d’acheter 15 matelas d’épaisseur 15, 8 matelas d’épaisseur 20 “deux places” et 10 matelas d’épaisseur 20 “trois places”. Il est très sollicité surtout par les menuisiers-ébénistes de la ville. Ses matelas sont vendus en détail au comptant et souvent à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1985 in Sikasso City, Mr. Mahamadou is married with two children. He lives with his wife and children in a traditional family along with his parents and his brothers in Sikasso.

After unsuccessfully trying his hand as a baker, Mahamadou started two years ago selling mattresses coming from Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso). To satisfy the increasing number of his customers, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution a year ago.

He was granted two loans, both of which were correctly repaid, and he is now requesting a third loan to increase his business assets.

The third loan will enable him to purchase fifteen 15-cms-thick mattresses, eight two-person 20-cms-thick mattresses, and ten three-person 20-cms-thick mattresses. He is much in demand especially by furniture makers from the city. His mattresses are sold retail, for cash and often on credit.

He expects this loan to generate monthly profits of 120,000 FCFA that will serve mainly to help with family expenses, pay interest on the loan, with the rest being reinvested in his business activity.

loans.use: To buy mattresses

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham is a 22-year-old single man from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. 

Haitham is requesting a loan of 900 JD to finance his higher education fees.

Haitham is looking to graduate and get a good job to improve his family life conditions.

loans.use: To finance his education

loans.name: Abuol

texts.en:
Abuol is a 35 year old married woman with three children one of whom is in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Langber Bor, South Sudan for three years.
Abuol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Pedro Alfonso

texts.es:
La venta de granos básicos es el negocio que desarrolla el señor Pedro Alfonso en el departamento de León desde hace 12 años siendo este el negocio que le permite llevar el bienestar a su casa.

Es menester mencionar que la demanda ha aumentado y por ello está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los granos principalmente de maíz y trigo para su respectiva comercialización y así obtener los ingresos para el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro Alfonso has been selling grain in the Department of León for 12 years.  This business enables him to provide for the well-being of his household.

It should be mentioned that demand has increased, so he is requesting a loan to buy grains, mainly corn and wheat.  By selling these products, he is able to generate income to provide for his family’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy corn and wheat.

loans.name: Christian

texts.es: Christian de 28 años convive con Mónica con quien tiene 2 hijos de 10 años y una pequeño de 2 meses de nacido. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Christian es un hombre de negocios y muy trabajador. Se dedica a la agricultura en sus 3 parcelas de terrenos siembra café, plátanos y yuca. En la zona de Villa María el plátano es muy solicitado por las bondades de sus tierras y climas. Es así que cada quincena Christian cosecha 20 arrobas, las que vende con éxito en la ciudad de Pichanaki. A él le gusta su trabajo, por ser más independiente y sobretodo porque sus ingresos dependen de su propio esfuerzo. Para agilizar su trabajo contrata personal que le ayuden a posear (acumular tierra alrededor de las plantas), desyerbar y sembrar sus cultivos, principalmente en el café.  Cuando tiene alguna urgencia económica, el plátano y las yucas siempre lo sacan de apuros, por ser quincenal, mientras que el café es anual. El piensa sembrar más productos para el próximo mes, para eso alquilará terrenos de vecinos o amigos. Sería la primera vez que Christian accedería a un préstamo de MFP. Se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente contento de pertenecer al banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”. De obtener el dinero, podrá comprar bolsas de abonos para su cafetal y pagará los servicios de los jornaleros quienes apoyarán en la ardua labor.
texts.en:
Christian, 28 years old, lives with Monica with whom he has 2 children aged 10 years and 2 months. This family lives in their own house in Villa María Alto Yurinaki, an indigenous community in the Chanchamayo Province. 

Christian is a businessman and a very hard worker. He does agricultural work on his 3 parcels of land, growing coffee, plantains, and cassava. Plantains are much sought after in the region around Villa María due to its good soil and mild climate. So every two weeks Christian harvests 20 "arrobas" ["arroba" is a unit of measure equal to 24-36 pounds depending on the region], which he sells with great success in the city of Pichanaki. 

He likes his work because he is more independent and especially because his own efforts determine his income. To facilitate his work he hires personnel who help him to build up the soil around the plants, remove weeds, and plant his crops, mainly the coffee. When he finds himself in some economic tight spot, the plantain and cassava always get him through, since they are biweekly while the coffee is annual.  He wants to plant more produce for the next month, and to do so he will rent land from neighbors or friends. 

This will be the first loan that Christian has received from MFP. He takes responsibility for being punctual in making his payments. He is happy to belong to "Los Productores Yaneshas" communal bank. On obtaining the money, he will be able to purchase bags of fertilizer for his coffee plants and will pay for the services of the farm workers who will support him in the arduous work.

loans.use: to purchase bags of manure and to hire farm workers.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a 42-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house with piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. Her husband Swalehe is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. 

Deborah has operated a motorbike transportation business for the past 6 years; her potential clients are residents of the local area. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of establishing a water distribution business.

With the requested loan of KES 21,190, Deborah wants to pay her children's school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTALEZA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y esta dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de CD’s, carpintería, venta de queso, venta de ganado, venta de lanas, tejido de camas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de lechería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás aprendiendo la técnica de su madre a quien le ayudaba desde niña.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vaca lechera) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The "Fortaleza" (Strength) Communal Bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Community Center. It is made up of 8 members and run by a board of directors, of which Virginia is the president. The members of this communal bank carry out a variety of different businesses, such as selling milk, selling CD's, carpentry, selling cheese, selling livestock, selling wool and woven bedding.

Virginia is one of the female micro entrepreneurs who will benefit from the loan they will take out. She says that this is the first time she has been a part of Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a group promoter who came to visit her at her house. At present she has a dairy business that she says she learned several years ago, picking up the skills from her mother, whom she helped since childhood.
 
The loan she will take out now is for an increase in capital (the purchase of a dairy cow) that she will buy from the neighboring fairs and, after raising it, she'll sell it at her store. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responds that she likes the health training and the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.
